A friend of mine spent about a $1000 to install a more expensive system in his house -- what a ripoff!Anyway, long story short -- for me I had no snags, easy install, easy update, easy apps, easy website, waiting for a sale on the night vision d-link camera :)And as always, amazon free shipping, great service can't be beat

Reviews.Title: Great camera for Wired Connection...  Poor for WI-FI beyond one room
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C Napier
Reviews.Content: 4 Star product for direct Ethernet connection.2 Star product for Wi-Fi connection beyond medium range of normal devices.I bought 2 of these.My original one was hooked up via Ethernet and it works great.Decent Video / Poor audio.I bought another one and this time I wanted to place it In a location that required Wi-Fi.The Wi-Fi on this device has the worst reception of any device in my house.I can only keep a connection if it is in the very next room on the same floor as the router.I have phones, laptop and a tablet that works in any room on any floor but this device fails to stay connected.I really like the DLink web site and the android app.I was planning to expand to more of these devices but now I am having second thoughts.I would probably have to resort to power line adapters or a wireless amplifier to get these to work everywhereI need them.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: At first it was a hassle to get these to work. But tech support at D-Link was awesome and they got it hooked up to work like a champ. Yes I had to by a repeater due to low signal strength but that was not their fault. Got it cheap and totally works. I have seen some negative reviews but you get what you pay for. Great tech support from D-Link.

Reviews.Title: D for Dumb
Reviews.Author: John S. Maguire "Cyberwasp"
Reviews.Content: Everything looked good out of the box. Initial setup went flawless until you try to adjust settings. Instead of the camera recording video continuous I wanted to set it to trigger on motion. Well, after the 6 try I threw it back in  the box where it's waiting to go back to the store. If anyone has found a better product, please speak up! btw, D-link support is none existent!

Reviews.Title: Overall - D-Link DCS-942L is D-Frustrating
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Pesantes
Reviews.Content: Setting up this cam on a Mac was challenging but not too difficult thanks to the instructional video on YouTube:[...]My router did not have a WPS button for direct wireless connectivity so I had to set it up manually which involved a few more steps. Things were going well, the wireless function was in-effect and the night vision was really cool. The next and final step in setting this cam up was the insertion of the micro SD card for recording. Easy, right? In it went and no recognition of the card mounted or to format it was being seen. I went to disk utilities on my mac and formatted card several times and no luck.I went on-line and found a blog of other users with similar problem. The solution for some was to reset camera- which I did and boy was that a huge mistake. I could not get the camera back to the wireless state of the cam, just wired after that. Hour upon hour of wasted time and high levels of frustration. Just wouldn't work wirelessly and even re-registerd it with d-link. Wasn't happening. Sadly I had to return it. For what it is, it is a decent camera with many different ways to customize the functionality depending on how it would be used. No way was I going to spend more hours on the phone with customer service.Note: I noticed if using for outside surveillance, the LEDs on the camera to view in night vision mode are so bright that the reflexion off the glass on the inside window makes any image outside impossible to see, just glare. Another thing I didn't like was the light sensitivity, easily switching on night vision when there was still light on but I think that can be adjusted in the "set up" tab on the d-link live view preferences page.I didn't get to play with the camera too much because I spent so much time trying to get it back to the wireless mode. The recording mode never was tested as well as the motion detection feature, so I can't comment on the quality of the video. I would rate the camera itself slightly higher but in factoring in the set-up experience and how the cam would have been used in my situation, I had to lower it a bit. I wanted to like this product.

Reviews.Title: they're an alright camera
Reviews.Author: papatech "c.p."
Reviews.Content: i'm on the I/T side of things and I install these for customers and family neighbors alike.  they work fine. the software and mobile phone/device app is fine too.  it's not a $20,000 system.. it's a $100 camera..  they're fine.. i haven't seen a defective one yet.  the dlink cameras from 10 years ago, now THOSE sucked really bad.  these are good though..

Reviews.Title: Shy away if you're a Mac owner
Reviews.Author: ADAM D W BEEBE
Reviews.Content: Read all the customer reviews before ordering. For many customers, the D-Link DCS-930L set appears to have been seamless. But for those like myself with a Mac, the set-up process was so difficult, frustrating, fulls of bugs, and ultimately unsuccessful that I finally gave up. I followed the included instructions, downloaded updated firmware from the D-Link web site, and even received 45+ minutes of assistance over the phone from friendly D-Link customer service reps, but even they couldn't help me set up my wireless camera. Maybe my computer and network configuration is the problem, but regardless, the set-up process for a device as seemingly straightforward as this should not be so difficult.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and use
Reviews.Author: Charles Gunawan "Charlie"
Reviews.Content: I bought this "DIY" security camera because not satisfied with Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera. This camera uses mini SD card to save pictures and video, as opposed to pay monthly fee for recording if you use Dropcam. I don't have any problem at all with wired and wireless connection. Picture looks great and detects day and night correctly. I just wished it came with battery so I can mount it anywhere without running the cord to power outlet. Dlink DCS-942L comes with many customization which you will appreciate much unlike other security camera. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: REBUTTLE TO "USER ITA" REVIEW
Reviews.Author: rolandc
Reviews.Content: I purchased this model (942L) not knowing anything about it. I have the 930L and the 1130 in my home now. I bought the 942L because of the night vision and it's pointed looking outside my front window. I am very pleased with this camera. Not sure what user ITA is talking about. You're an IT guy??? Give me a break! My version 1.0 works great. It does everything advertised. It also sends me email photo shots to my HTC mobile phone of people driving by my home and people walking up to my door during the day when I am not home. Works perfectly. It reccords to my 32 Gig SDHC without any issues. I can access it at the hotel when I am on the road. Nice camera... Good work D-Link...

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Majenta
Reviews.Content: Picked this up at Future Shop for 79.99 (Amazons is way over priced it seems)... the main purpose of my purchase is to have a camera I could tap into to view my dog during the day when I wanted to (from work, or in the community).  I didn't need some super fancy, and expensive security set up, just simply a window into my living room where she hangs out.  After looking at a number of options I decided to try this out simply because it a) had a good price and b) was available at the store in my area (didnt have to wait for shipping).  I also know that I have 30 days to return if necessary.I am on day 4 of using the camera and I must say I am pleased... not over joyed, but pleased.  Day 1 I was ready to throw the camera and box right out the window.  I consider myself to be semi tech smart but this little camera had me extremely frustrated.  I was able to hook it up to my wireless router no problem... I was able to see the camera on my computer but not on my ipad.  I called tech support 4 times... and after 3 hours in total of trouble shooting I was able to get things up and running.  There were helpful but there was a major communication barrier and it was often frustrating to understand their english.Once I got it up and running it has been pretty much flawless.  I am able to move the camera from outlet to outlet (it takes about 1 minute to reconnect itself to the internet) and I am ready to view a new room... I only did this for testing purposes... it is now on my shelf in the living room where it will stay.  The picture is good - not excellent but good.  There is an online settings window that has MANY settings you can change around.  I have it set on the highest resolution and it seems to be great.  There are also some complaints with it going to black and white too quickly - this was the case for me as well but I got around that by setting the settings so that 8am-8pm it is day time and 8-8am is night vision - seems to be working out fine :)  when the daylight changes I will have to adjust the times of day, but that is minor and not really necessary since there is a night time mode.I also did not give this camera a 5/5 is because when viewing on ipad/ipod you can only see the feed for 1 minute.  While at my work computer it is fine it can go on all day if I let it (once in a while it does get timed out but its no big deal) but on the ipad every minute you have to hit "view again" - is this an annoying feature for me, not really - like I said I just wanted it for a sneak peek into my home, I am not sitting there for hours viewing it but I could see how this could be frustrating for most and thought it was note worthy.Over all I would purchase another one, perhaps to see the kitchen as well, just another angel, but for now the one camera is doing its job and I am a satisfied customer... if I paid $150 I think this review would have been different, but since I didnt spend that much I am giving this a solid 4/5

Reviews.Title: Overheating
Reviews.Author: M. Riley
Reviews.Content: After two months this camera overheated and died.  The camera was inside an air conditioned house the entire time, so it wasn't the ambient temperature that caused the problem.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Namrata Kripalani
Reviews.Content: This is a nice product as it is simple to install (mac or PC, although the product only ships with installation for PC. You can download the Mac version online). Also there is not need to bother with port forwarding on the router to have the video feed accessible from the internet. The image quality is good and the mobile app works pretty well. The only con I noticed so far is that while accessing the feed via the browser or via the mobile app, the bit rate was around 2 Mbps and tends to hog the network. So be careful while accessing at work or you might get flagged to clogging the network.Best of all the price is reasonable

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: M. Orr
Reviews.Content: This is my first security camera. I bought it for two reasons. To catch the neighbors dog in my yard and to experiment before buying a full blown multi camera, dvr based system.This camera seems fine for a simple stand alone setup. I haven't used all it's features.  I use mine with a 4gb SD card in it to take snapshots, and that's working exactly how I wanted it along with the motion sensor set up.As stated earlier, my only downfall is the little flimsy plastic adjustment ball between the camera and stand. Then again, it's a security camera and not meant to be a coat hanger. They could have used a metal joint instead.  I wouldn't let that stop you from buying it though.The night vision works pretty well actually. To view out a window to your yard at night...useless. The LED's are not powerful enough, and you get flashback from the window glass.  But indoors for a room, it actually works better than I thought.The picture and video quality is actually pretty good !

Reviews.Title: Solution for deterioratating Wireless Performance
Reviews.Author: michael stoddard
Reviews.Content: I purchased both the Dlink Model DCS-930L and the DCS-932L Night vision cameras and had the same loss of performance for any extended distance away from the wireless router inside my house. I solved it for both cameras by adding a D-Link DAP-1360 Wireless N Range Extender to my network. I keep it within a short distance away from my furthest cameras in my home and they work as expected. Configure it as a Wireless Repeater, and checkmark the setup option to support streaming for video. I can use the cameras anywhere in the house, thru walls, outdoors, and in the garage with no problems. Again, keep it close to the furthest-away cameras for the best pereformance.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but make sure you do this before installation!
Reviews.Author: Michael Horr
Reviews.Content: I received the camera and immediately went to set it up.  The basic camera installation was very simple (plug it into the wall).  I got it to connect wirelessly very quickly also (just follow the directions).  Then I went on my computer to complete the installation.  I put the CD in my drive and was following along without issue.  The software then went to find the camera.  After a little bit, it said it could not find any cameras.  Well, I brought the camera to my computer and connected it with the provide ethernet cable and tried again.  Same thing.  Could not find any cameras.  So I opened up my network and there was the camera, connected to my network.  So maybe I did something wrong on the install wizard.  Closed that and reopened it and walked through again...same thing.  I called tech support and after downloading the latest install wizard and firmware to my camera, still, the software could not find the camera.  The Teir I tech told me the camera wads defective and I would need to return it.  Well, since I could see the camera on my network map, and could connect to it directly through my network, I told her she was wrong.  I asked to be connected to a supervisor who they connected me to Teir III support.  Once he started troubleshooting, he (connected remotely) turned off my firewall (both the Zone Alarm and windows) and reran the wizard.  Well, guess what, that worked!  and everything came up without a problem after that.So, I highly recommend this camera, but make sure you turn off all your firewalls before running the install wizard software.  Once installed, you can turn them back on without issue.The only reason I knock it down one star is that I spent almost 2 hours on the phone with tech support and one of them told me I had a defective camera.  So it seems to me the Teir I tech support is not up to speed as it should be.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the low Price
Reviews.Author: CougarPride
Reviews.Content: After my neighbors got robbed several times, I needed a motion capable camera that records movement. This D-link 930L is perfect. I bought this @ $59.99. Even though there is technically NO darkness support, it works acceptable in low light. The resolution is OKAY and enough for me. I was able to use this with default D-Link D-View Cam iPad & PC software, iCam iPad & PC softwares. An alternate would be Wansview which is also good too!

Reviews.Title: Serious Setup Issues
Reviews.Author: Padge
Reviews.Content: The maker of this product is currently experiencing severe product disability/servicability issues.  During the setup numerous internet connection error issues occurred.  They are currently unable to send out verification emails to activate and allow camera access.  After talking with tech support, I was informed amy case was handed off to headquarters and a rep will call sometime in the future, when asked no projection of when was avialable.  As of right now, I give a vote of no confidence in this product and the manufacturer.  I will update this post if/when I either get a working camera or return it for a refund....more to come...update.  I was finally able to get the camera working and wirelessly.  To begin go ahead and run the setup CD the and hard line the camera to the router/modem.  I have a wireless router/modem from my ISP.  The steps below are Windows Vista.1.  Open Control Panel2.  Open Network and Internet3.  Open Network and Sharing Center4.  Under the Tasks menu, open "View Computers and Devices"5.  A new window will open listing all devices6.  Write down the camera's IP listed, you'll need this to make it wireless7.  Open the camera, a window will appear in IE asking for your camera's password.  From here pretty basic.Once in I was able to setup the wireless, adjust resolution, etc.  The camera is actually quite good overall.  Hence my upgrade from one to three stars.  Next item...get access via my droid phone...oh joy...

Reviews.Title: D- Link DCS-932L
Reviews.Author: Margaret M. Robinson
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and decided to go ahead and purchase this product. received this Item yesterday January 16 2012 and not being much of a tech person I had no problem setting it up. software installed with no issue,only had to call D-link tech support for one small issue and that was for the download site for the remote live software,the tech guy talked me through downloading the software,and bingo I'm running a descent software that allows me to record my video.I mounted the camera in my Bay Window of my house, and it covers my Driveway my mailbox part of the street in front of my house an a few neighbor drive ways.picture is nice I went into settings and choose the best video option,very nice color video,the camera can read the address on my mail box very clear. and for the camera viewing through a window during the day it works fine.at night it's a little more challenging because of the reflection. I put a small piece of black electrical tape over the flashing green light in front of the camera so that it's not so obvious at night.I also had several family members log into my account to see if it worked and they said they had very good pictures. so all in all I'm pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Darius C. Uible "Saving the world, one kitche...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to be used as a baby monitor and my wife and I are in love with it! While it's true that they didn't support sound on the iPhone and Android apps in the beginning, they do now so it's not an issue.  Long-term connections are stable if you're connected to the same home network as the camera(s). If you're away from the house either using 3G/4G or using the wifi in a hotel, you'll find that the connection drops after somewhere from a minute or two to a few hours.  The quality of the night vision is plenty good enough to see what the baby's doing and lets you determine whether that was a stray cry and the baby's already headed back to sleep or if he/she is standing in the crib wanting some attention.  Ever hear that cry and wonder? Then you open the door to check and here you were wrong, but now you woke him/her up opening the door!  No more! When we awake to a stray cry, we first roll over (each night we either have my ipod touch on my night stand or my wife's ipad on her night stand) and check out what's up, then go to her room if necessary.  Added bonus!  I'm on the road 2-3 nights a week for work and love using technology to feel a little closer to home.  While the biggest thing for us is skype sessions, the camera adds something.  Many nights I fall asleep in the hotel watching the baby sleep from a thousand miles away. Toooo cool!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but difficult setup
Reviews.Author: sunstorm
Reviews.Content: The video is excellent on this little camera, motion detection works great and sends me an email with 6 pictures every time motion is detected. This is exactly what I was looking for. Works flawlessly.As others have already mentioned setup is a little difficult. To register your camera with mydlink you have to use the setup CD that comes with the camera. However, the setup program stopped working at some point. It couldn't determine my network settings. So I manually went into the camera settings and set my network information. Get the manual from the setup CD or DLink website to find out how to do this (page 25 if you have wireless). It's easy. While on the DLink website I also noticed that they have an updated setup wizard for download. At the time of this review the file is called "DCS-932L_wizard_v101_1420.rar". So I stopped the setup from CD, downloaded the new wizard and started over again. The new wizard found my network info (don't know if this is due to the fact that I manually entered it or if it would have found it anyway). Then it asked me to register a new mydlink account. After I did the program seemed to freeze again. However, checking my email revealed that I had to confirm account registration by clicking on a link in the email. After I did, the program started working again and finished registering my camera to mydlink. You can sign up for a mydlink account before starting the camera setup, confirm registration and then the setup program shouldn't have a problem. You just type in your existing mydlink login info instead of creating a new account.All in all, setup took a lot longer than it should have. And I can see how people not too familiar with computers and networks might not be able to set it up at all. DLink should really work on this. For me personally the trouble of going thru setup was well worth it. I like this camera a lot.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't access remotely
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: My advice: avoidI was hoping this camera would work out because it looks very nice. However, after two days struggling to get the remote access working I have given up and returned the item. I'm technically savvy and I have a dlink router so I thought it would be easy to use.The main problem is Dlink tries to make things easier by running these java applets or active X on your computer to help configure your system. That's great if it works but if it DOESN'T work you're screwed. Their program couldn't connect to the internet so I could never proceed. I manually configured the camera and my router and forwarded the port. I could access the camera internal to my network and everything was fine. But when I tried to access through mydlink, it again launches some program to access my camera and it fails. I called tech support which is nice but not too technically savvy. I was told I shouldn't forward the port since mydlink expects the port to be 80. I reset the camera to default and ran the programs again to no avail. After two days of all sorts of workaround attempts I have given up and returned the item.

Reviews.Title: Installation can be really easy or nearly impossible...
Reviews.Author: Pablo Castro "Man of Surprises"
Reviews.Content: This camera can be really easy to install if you don't have a firewall, and a real pain if you do. We used it to monitor one of our stands in a shopping mall, and there the WiFi had no firewall. A real breeze to install. Then we tried to use it at our office, where our ISP has a firewall and... what a pain. Haven't been able to get it to work yet. I'm aware this might be more of a problem on our behalf than a flaw with the camera itself, but what can I say, the whole experience is what counts.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, with some caveats
Reviews.Author: J. Hope
Reviews.Content: The layout of my condo requires me to go downstairs to answer the door most of the time.  I purchased this camera to allow me to see who is at the door before schlepping down to see who's there.  I also am using it as a simple security system at the front door, as it is the easiest point of entry to my condo.Set-up of the camera, without using the D-Link software, was relatively easy.  I connected it using the included Ethernet cable to one of my switches (to note, my home network consists of a D-Link DGL-4300 802.11b/g wireless router and two D-Link DGS-2208 switches).  I was instantly able to pull up the configuration page in Chrome.  I stepped through the Web-based configuration, and everything worked as expected.  I was able to choose WPA2-PSK as my wireless network type, and was able to enter my key (which does have some spaces in it, this becomes important later).  I disconnected the camera from my wired network, and after rebooting the camera came up and connected wirelessly without a hitch.An important note here:  Oddly, this camera appears to use the same MAC address for wired and wireless connections (I don't think this is proper according to the IEEE).  In my case, the MAC address used just happened to NOT be the MAC address listed on the back of the camera nor is it the one listed in the Wireless section of the camera's configuration page.  This became a problem as I was trying to reserve a DHCP IP for the camera on my router.  Eventually I realized it was only using one MAC address, and was able to fix this.I then downloaded the D-Link Android app which, supposedly, requires registration of the camera on something called mydlink.  The only way to register the camera on mydlink is to go through the D-Link camera setup wizard that is included on the disc with the camera.  I downloaded the latest version from D-Link's Web site and gave it a go.  This is where set-up got really bad.It steps you through many of the basic set-up steps that I had already completed all over again.  I set it up as a wireless camera and inputted my PSK for the wireless network once more.  When it got to the part where it was supposed to register with mydlink, it failed saying it could not contact the mydlink servers.  I tried again, resetting the camera, having it plugged in via wired Ethernet, unplugging the camera, etc.  Each time it failed saying it could not contact the mydlink servers.After my first attempt, and after resetting the camera, I noticed it would no longer connect wirelessly.  Looking into the Web-based settings, I found that the D-Link wizard could not handle spaces in the WEP2-PSK key.  It merely had the first word of my key in there!  Another major oversight on the part of the programmers of the wizard software.I went onto D-Link's American Web site looking for a firmware update, but did not find one.  Luckily, I came across a post in a forum referencing the Taiwanese Web-site which actually does have a more recent English language release of the firmware (if Amazon does not strip it, the address for D-Link's Taiwanese download site is [...]).  I updated to this latest firmware and tried to register on mydlink once more, with the exact same result: Failure.I contacted D-Link support via e-mail and got a simple response back basically saying to try it again.  The most frustrating thing about this response was there was no way to reply!  It came from a no-reply e-mail address and stated I had to open a whole new incident with D-Link support to reply.  I ceased pursuing this avenue of support.The mydlink service still does not work, and so far I have given up on it.  I found a free program on the Android market, tinyCam Monitor, that connects to my camera very well so I no longer really miss the mydlink service.  I also wrote a simple Windows 7 desktop gadget that continuously refreshes the view of the camera.I configured a Cerberus FTP server on one of my machines and configured the FTP functionality of the camera to write an image once every 5 seconds to the FTP server.  Every day takes up about 500MB (at the highest resolution setting for the camera which is 640x480).  This functionality works very well.  I also configured e-mail to work with my gmail account and to send me images whenever motion is detected.  This also works very well, with the sole exception that as the camera changes into day mode or night mode, I get two e-mails.  Most days this only happens twice, but some recent rain storms caused this to happen multiple times in the day which deluged my inbox with needless e-mails.I mounted the camera inside my house, looking out through a window.  During the day this provides a wonderful view.  At night, though, the infrared light just bounces off the window and I can't see anything outside.  I have scoured the documentation and support pages at D-Link and have seen no mention about whether or not this camera can be used outside.  I plan on moving it outside, as the area is protected and shouldn't get wet or even direct sunlight, it should be safe.  I am hopeful the image will be better at night if the camera is outside.  This problem (with infrared bouncing off windows) is well known and I expected this behavior, so I cannot hold this against D-Link.Overall, the camera is of good quality and does what I want it to do, and I am already considering purchasing one or two more, especially if the camera does well outside.  Set-up was relatively easy (with the exception of mydlink) for me, considering I did most of it manually using the camera's Web interface.  Image quality is mostly great, especially during the day.

Reviews.Title: Can't recommend due to hardware issues
Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to keep around the house for watching my kids, dogs, etc. It's important that the wireless networking work so that you can plug it in and use it anywhere in the house, as opposed to just where you happen to have a wired Ethernet connection available. The two units I've tried have not worked wirelessly.The first unit's wireless module did not work at all; the site survey function didn't turn up any wireless networks, even after I plugged in a spare wifi router and set it up with no security--should've been a slam dunk. But convincing D-Link that there was a problem took two half-hour phone calls. The first person I talked to was the doorstop--the person who goes through a checklist trying to get the product to work. After I finally convinced her it wasn't working, she escalated it, which meant waiting for someone who knows a bit more about the product to call me back. That took the better part of a day--waiting from 9 AM to 3 PM for that return call. The next guy actually just went through the same checklist with me, and with the same result; except he was able to issue an RMA.So the second unit just arrived a few days ago (took a couple weeks for the RMA to process) and while it finds plenty of wireless networks via the site survey, and then allows it to be configured to talk to my wireless access point and establishes a connection, for some reason the unit doesn't then allow me to connect to the camera to view the images. I can see the router got an IP address and its MAC address is listed in the wireless router's list of connected devices, but I can't connect to that IP address from a computer, which would be a prerequisite to viewing the video over my local network. I've gone through the settings page twice very carefully and am pretty sure I'm not missing anything important. So I've given up.I give it two stars instead of just one since at least I have a working camera now, albeit working only through the wired Ethernet connection.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy from D-Link
Reviews.Author: Nic "Nic"
Reviews.Content: D-link is an awful company!  I used to own a Dlink router DI-624... had numerous connectivity issues and eventually ceased working at all... D-link support by phone was awful to deal with (poor english, unable to understand the problem, poor troubleshooting...etc)  eventually an RMA# was issued.  Now I have mad the mistake of purchasing a DCS-930L camera... the set up and working of the product was great until one day when I logged into [...] to view my cams and got an error message that my firmware (ver 1.0) needed upgrading.  I followed the instructions (did NOT do it wirelessly) and successfully upgraded firmware to v1.03.  The camera shut down and rebooted as the f/w instructions said it would... the red light on front came on (non-blinking) and stayed solid red.  I have soft and hard rest the cam multiple times (and again multiple times while the broken english helpers at the 1-888 support number walked me thru the steps)...the red light is always solid and the camera is unable to be detected by the network - whether hardwired or wireless.  The F/W upgrade bricked the camera and customer support only can ask me to unplug and re-plug and press the reset button with a pin... no matter what action I take the camera is undetectable - even using the default IP 192.168.0.20now I have spent multiple hours on the phone with customer support and sent multiple emails and they have yet to release an RMA... POOR POOR customer service

Reviews.Title: Mostly a novelty
Reviews.Author: SgtZim
Reviews.Content: It took about 4 hours and two calls to tech support to get the camera set up.  I had similar problems to others who have posted reviews here.  If you are considering a network cam, plan on having a computer wired to the router for the initial setup.  I had to buy a long ethernet cable for that purpose.  Now that it is set up, the wireless works - kind of.  Logging into mydlink.com has been slow, up to 5 minutes to log in sometimes.  Logging into mydlink lite (ipad, iphone apps) is also slow, may take several attempts, often results in a black screen or extremely slow frame rate, and only allows you to view for a max of 60 seconds.  Overall, it's not very useful or fun to use.  A cheap web cam would be more usable, but you'd have to leave a computer running all day.  I'll keep looking for a better way.  On the plus side, the motion detect and email functions work fine, but with 2 cats the email inbox fills up very quickly.

Reviews.Title: My versions: firmware 1.02 (12/20/10), hw A1
Reviews.Author: P. Albrecht
Reviews.Content: This firmware solves any problem of network name ("SSID"), which now can have spaces.  However the network password (key, PSK WPA2-AES) still must not.  Both phrases can support most other "special" characters.My transmission range is good.  To a DLink DIR-655 router set on "low", the furthest I have tried is 25 feet straight line.  However that is through two walls and a very oblique angle floor/ceiling.  As the documentation mentions, any ostruction at an angle looks that much thicker to the transmission.  My own wifi rule of thumb for any device, is to take the open-air maximum distance and cut it in HALF for EACH wall etc which the transmition has to pass through.The camera has options to rotate the image before you view it.  This is nice if you wish to mount the camera upside-down, etc.  And if you do have a problem with transmission range, you might also try rotating the camera 90 or 180, as that may affect the antenna, and you compensate by rotating the image.I am using the D-ViewCam recording software, and not MyDlink.  The camera can be setup fine under W2000 also, and of course just viewed/managed via browser from W2000.  But as spec'd, D-ViewCam did not seem to run there and needed Vista/etc, no surprise.  D-ViewCam has comprehensive recording options.  I don't understand and have not tested the distinction between limiting motion-detection areas in the camera itself (via browser), and limiting in D-ViewCam.  The camera's option breaks the screen up into 25 fixed blocks, any combination which can be selected, and perhaps that reduces network traffic from the camera?  D-ViewCam's allows finer resolution.Nice that the power cord has an L-shaped plug into the camera, which makes the profile more streamlined.  Of course the camera body can be detached from the base, for use in smaller areas.  I'd also like to remove the related little metal mounting arm/pin protruding from the body, but it's not clear how/whether to do so.  It does not unscrew with moderate force, and may even be a part of the antenna?My continuous recording at 640x480, 20 frames/sec, high-qual compression takes about 1.9 GB/ hour, so c. 1 TB/20 days.  Whereas with normal motion sensing, and only very minor motion, 12MB/hr.  You can assign multiple destinations for the recorded files in D-ViewCam, and when those are all full, it can automatically start overwriting the oldest.Cheers.

Reviews.Title: set up was NOT simple like the product claims. It was painstaking and took multiple attempts with poor support!
Reviews.Author: SRL
Reviews.Content: i had to reset the camera 4 times, re-download the software 3 times, call support multiple times and waste half my evenings on the line having them talk me through 100 steps to get me to the same problem that I tried to explain to them at the start of the call. my account kept rejecting my new camera from being an installed device because it was "already registered to another DLink account". I figured since most basic electronics these days have simple step-by-step, seamless installation procedures, that this would be the same. it wasnt! It was glitch after glitch after glitch. wasnt worth the stress i went throught getting it to work.

Reviews.Title: Simple, Easy to Use Monitoring
Reviews.Author: diljs
Reviews.Content: As someone who lives in an area that's not the safest in the world, I was looking for a simple camera to watch my place when everyone is away.  This camera was simple and did what I wanted.Setup was extremely easy.  You first use the included ethernet cable to hardwire it to a router (this one time only).  The included software will locate the camera and set everything up, after which you can use the camera wirelessly.  Next the camera just needs to be mounted somewhere discrete (attachment hardware is included).  Be sure you have an outlet handy to plug in the camera.Picture quality is good but not amazing.  A max resolution of 640x480 is the same as the first webcam I bought 12 years ago, but should be adequate for most home needs.  The microphone is decent.Wireless range was fine for my setup (about 10 feet).  As with anything wifi, connection will deteriorate the farther you get from the router.Monitoring can be done on dlink's website or from one of their smartphone apps.  With some more technical setup, one can forward the feed elsewhere.  Dlink's software can also save recordings to a hard drive.  You can set up recording to only happen when motion occurs.Overall this is a great product for anyone with security concerns.  It is easy to set up but does all the basics.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Quick and simple
Reviews.Author: Prime junkie
Reviews.Content: Have been on the fence for quite a while regarding various features of these types of wireless cams.  Glad I finally jumped in with the 930.  Although I have some good tech skills, I don't want to get involved with the nitty gritty networking settings, opening ports etc.  In addition, as a Uverse user, a lot of those features of the router are fairly unavailable.  I had this cam setup, throwing video that I viewed on mydlink, within 5 minutes.The mydlink service is a big part of the ease of using this product.  The first cam was a tester, I'm planning on adding 3 others.  Mydlink looks to be easy to add other cams that I see in one window.  Accessing the service across several computers has been seamless.  Although it calls for IE, it's working fine in firefox.Downsides:  went completely dark in a room with good natural light as soon as dusk hit.  I'll add the 932 for low light applications.  As others have said, the AC cord is short.  I'm planning on hardwiring a couple of these, so that's not a big deal for me.Great features for the pricepoint.  Go buy one.

Reviews.Title: Consistent performer.
Reviews.Author: S. Power
Reviews.Content: The automated set-up worked very well with my Linksys E3000 Router. I was quickly able to set it up to show video anywhere in my house, over the internet, and even on my Android phone, using the Dlink App.It is easy to configure the camera to send e-mails at set times or via motion activation. It is also easy to have to camera send its data to an FTP site.The range and video quality are both very good. The automated software and the mydlink website make it all simple to use. The camera stays connected to the network, and never stops broadcasting.The only task that isn't very easy to set up, is having the video go to a local hard drive. There isn't a quick and easy way to utilize this feature, though having it save a stream of pictures to a local or remote FTP site is very simple and reliable.Overall, I would recommend this camera. Everything you would want a wireless camera for is very simple to set up. I am a complete novice with this setting network devices up, and had no problem.------- Update February 22nd, 2011 ---------I am still very happy with this camera. Since my initial review, I have continued to have very good experiences with it. Here are some more observations:- It reconnects to the network within 20 seconds, if you unplug it and move it to a new spot.- Though it works great over Android, they keep updating the software to make it more and more reliable. The camera always stayed connected to the net, but the phone would sometimes lose the connection. That is no longer a problem.- Also works on iOS products.- I have played with the Motion Detections settings in conjunction with FTP quite a bit recently. The camera is working great, and is highly adjustable in this regard, but the FTP service on my Linksys E3000 was giving me problems. Initially, I thought the camera wasn't working properly, or wasn't adjusting to my settings, but when I switched the FTP to an external site from my router, it is working fine. Either my E3000 isn't working right, or something with my network settings was causing it to intermittently disconnect. Either way, it isn't the camera's fault, because it is now working fine, connected to a remote FTP site. That is better than having it store the images in the house anyway.------ Update July 2011 --------This camera continues to perform very well and gives us a lot of peace of mind. There is occasional crime in our neighborhood, but an alarm system never seemed worth the expense. This camera coupled with our off-site FTP storage gives us confidence that we'd at least be able to give the police a photograph of anyone who commits a crime on our property or in our home.

Reviews.Title: D-link DCS-932L
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: Neat product....audio quality is lacking but can be turned off.  Night vision works well.  Just the thing for a poor man's home monitoring system.

Reviews.Title: MAC User
Reviews.Author: Tamara Richards
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera after much research.  Was a bit concerned about previous reviews from MAC users that said it was difficult to setup.  After reading the new dlink instructions (as of jan 20 2011) for setup via MAC,  I decided to give it a go.  Setup via my MAC with an airport express was a BREEZE... took 10 minutes to configure camera, and setup wirelessly.  Not a fan of the mydlink (no recording or email alerts), but was able to use other apps to bridge the software gap (mobiscope, phoenix)....

Reviews.Title: Great camera does what it needs to do--super price!
Reviews.Author: 2much2do
Reviews.Content: My nine year-old daughter and I hooked up this camera in about an hour.  The picture is not fantanstic but it works and I love the microphone feature.  We didn't have any trouble with the installation; however, we have an ICF home (concrete and steel walls) and had a little trouble with the camera maintaining the signal from the other room.  After a little trial and error and a wifi booster (which we already had) moved around everything was fine.  We bought it so that we could monitor the comings and goings on in the house while we were on vacation.  I have a playroom for the kids with a different camera and I intend to replace that camera with another of these as I will be able to get rid of the audio monitoring box I have due to the microphone.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA  W / EXCELLENT TECH SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Kirk Taylor "SANDIEGO"
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything it says and i have no cons but im most impressed with tech support.  I called  1st day and got both camera working with router and spent maybe 1 hour on phone. It flowed so smoothly . This is the best tech support I have had with any company, EVER. I called the 2nd day and TECHNICIAN MAE - ID #AR004630 helped me , actually she took control of my computer and helped me set the record times and zones and lighten up some cameras in a dark area. IM PRETTY LIVID THAT SOME BUYERS SAID TECH SUPPORT WAS BAD. THEY ARE LYING. THESE TECHS WILL HELP YOU POLITE AND COURTEOUS FOR HOURS IF YOU NEED IT.BUY THIS CAMERA DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT HESITATING. Just get the night cam if you need it and not through a window  and also get the newer brand for detailed 1080p but mines works great for jus simple yard and porch security. I brought 2 and im buying 2 more cameras just because i want more cameras because they are so simple and cheap to get up and going. I think the people who had problems were people who were tech heads and tried to set up manually.  I suggest if it doesnt 1st auto connect with router - dont fret at all just call tech support and let the do it and / or walk you through it. Its a lot of stuff to set up and lots of clicks but they talk you through it. I have been on the internet everyday since 1995 and i know my way around the net and comp but this stuff is deep. so jus call em and dont try to be some engineer. Thank You - drops Mic

Reviews.Title: Worst experience ever!
Reviews.Author: Leigh A. Brennan
Reviews.Content: Ordered this to monitor our pets while we travel.  It never worked and the support for it was terrible.  First and last D-Link product I will ever purchase.

Reviews.Title: Don't Expect Technical Support
Reviews.Author: MightyOak
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the remote access to it via MyDlink.com The camera worked fine within my home's WiFi range, but I couldn't sign on to MyDlink.com for remote monitoring. Eight days of "hold" and two Case Numbers issued with their so called "technical support" and I still cannot log into MyDlink. They used to have wonderful support and that's why I always brought D-Link products. Obviously, they have outsourced their support to people with little or no knowledge of the product and total disrespect for you as a customer.I strongly recommend you shop elsewhere. If it weren't for Amazon's great return policy, I would be stuck with something I could not use (remotely).

Reviews.Title: Watching Granddaughter Long Distance
Reviews.Author: Susan Walther
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are very proud grandparents, but being 1300 miles away has been challenging. Our friend gave us this idea and so we installed this camera above her crib. We can now catch up on her daily routine and growth whenever we want.There even is a feature to take pictures of her when she looks so cute!

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: David M. Lowrance
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 5 stars because of how well it works after you get it up, however getting it up was not simple in my case.I have included here, everything I ran into, in hopes it will assist others during the more complex installs. I think the video shows just pressing two buttons, and that was not my experience at all.Technical:  My system -Microsoft Internet Explorer 11  -  Windows7  64 bit  -  Dell XPS i7 desktop  -  Linksys Cisco Wireless Router WRT110  -  DCS-942L CameraInstallation Wizard:The major problem I had was after installation of the local software using the wizard, there was no picture when accessed inside the LAN. I spent an hour or so trying to cipher it on my own, then the troubleshooting section was no help at all. I finally had to go back to the d-link site and read very carefully at the bottom of the DCS-942L downloads, where you first download the wizard. There is a note about using microsoft's latest browser [Internet Explorer 11] and a promise they were going to fix this in December of 2013, which apparently they have not. If you are trying to install it fast you may miss this very important note. A rather complex fix in the browser pushing [alt T], and then [shift b] then saving the site as "compatible." Then within minutes I finally had a picture.Firmware and added downloads after the installation:I also had to upload new firmware! The program also uses java script, and one other DLL that must be loaded as an "add on" after the camera is accessed inside the LAN, well after setup. So more time for me to get it working then expected from the reviews.Once up, I was very impressed. The SD recording worked great, as did the IR and video motion triggers for recording.Wireless:You have to install from a LAN cable at first, then moving from the initial wired config to the wireless config, required a bit of time also, I suppose because I do not use WEP, but use a mac filter for security on my wireless LAN. I ended up giving the camera a static IP address outside of the DHCP range of my cisco router, and then discovered the internet accessed picture stopped working on the D-Link Site. Solution was to give the static IP address the DNS addresses also, which I did not know right off. Without the DNS addresses, the camera cannot access the internet for remote viewing, although it will work fine locally within your LAN. These DNS addresses can be found in the Windows7 Network setup of your PC, or in the Router.Site Certificate:I should mention also, the "HTTPS certificate" is not recognized as valid by Microsoft's Internet Explorer, so every time I access the camera from inside my LAN I first get a screen saying the certificate is not a trusted site, then I have to press on open this site anyway selection. I do not know, as of yet, how to get rid of this annoying screen. The certificate is from TWA I believe Taiwan. There is a certificate generator in the software, but that will be another challenge I suppose. Accessing the camera remotely from the d-link site does not have this problem.Configuration Backup and Reset Problem:After I had all the software fixes in place, and everything working, I copied the configuration file to my PC, and the onboard http management software is great in that respect. Then after I experimented with the setup and messed things up again, it was easy to get back to a working unit quickly by uploading it from the PC, after a reset operation. Download the two pdf manuals for the unit and look at the "pictures" to locate the reset button. You have to use a small wire or paperclip end to reach through the tiny hole and press it. I had trouble finding it, and got it confused with the larger square button which is the WEP button, which cost me a few hours of tinkering. The wizard is not clear on this either, you have to look through both pdf documents in the download section.Access:I could then access the camera by it's IP address inside my network from my Windows7 IE explorer 11. Remotely on the internet you access the D-Link site with an account you set up during the initial wizard setup. I did both simultaneously and the delay was about the same. A very slight delay between moving my arm across the camera and the image on the screen.SD Chip:I ordered 32G chips, not sure if they should have been 16G, but they seem to work fine. You use the browser to access the camera from inside your LAN, and you can format the SD, and then monitor and manage it as well. From outside on the internet access to the chips memory storage is rather slow, so I may consider an FTP server down the road. I ran for about 8 hours and then pulled the chip out, inserted in the adapter and then into my PC and the files were all there dated and played fine in mp4 format. So access by date and time is a breeze. This is a real plus for a surveillance system!Comments:For my application, all the software problems had fixes, but they were not all that easy to locate. Likely a better installation wizard, an improvement I would desire for such a good product, with better notes in the Wizard. The troubleshooting section is also lacking for Windows7 application, it only gave me notes for Windows8 I think, and they did not apply to me. A good Wizard would grab the OS from the PC, and then offer all the important notes during the setup phase, or at least at the end of the setup phase, rather then hide them in the wizard download section at the very bottom. Who looks for notes at that phase of the installation?All in all this is a great value for what you get, and if you are network savvy you will have it working as expected, even on a cisco router, with Internet Explorer 11. Not using it with the new D-Link routers, I was a bit worried when I ordered it.I look forwards to working with this camera now as time progresses, but from what I see, the picture quality is pretty nice, and all the advertised functions work great! Now after my learning curve, I would order another one in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Robert Kelley
Reviews.Content: I recently purchase 2 DCS-930L cameras. I configured the first camera with no problems at all. Attempting to configure the second camera I could never get the front green light to quit blinking during the process and consequently get it on the internet. I called their customer service and while trying to overcome the language barrier they were of no help at all and just referred me back to Amazon. I will be sending the camera back to Amazon and hopefully will get a replacement. The first camera works great yhough.

Reviews.Title: It works and was EASY to set up
Reviews.Author: Kelly Taylor
Reviews.Content: I'm a gadget geek but I wouldn't call myself a tech expert by any means.I simply followed the guide and had this connected in 10 minutes tops.The camera is good, but as others have stated the sound is AWFUL.  You can hear, but the static is very loud to go along with what you want to listen to.  That would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Cool, but you need a plug.
Reviews.Author: pro_crustes
Reviews.Content: This thing is kind of amazing. It really does just join your household WiFi and is quickly visible on the Web and/or your iPhone. Picture is impressive and the IR mode works rather well. Only complaint is that it must be plugged into a wall outlet, and the cord on the power adapter isn't very long. So, if you want to leave it perched high, or peeking out a window near the front door, you may need to cook up an extension wire for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality without a huge price tag
Reviews.Author: S. Deokar
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews for this camera I decided to try it out myself. This my first IP camera and I didn't want to spend a fortune getting one. I am glad I went for the DLink 942L.Initial Setup:The initial setup was not as smooth as I would have liked. As the mydlink setup wizard suggested, I connected the camera using the ethernet cable provided and the wizard was able to locate the camera. But after setting up the camera on wired connection, I tried to connect using wireless WPS function, but it didn't work. So I went back to the wizard and tried to select the wireless option. But after many tries, different operating systems (Win 8 and Win 7) still the wizard couldn't locate the wireless network. That's when I gave up and called technical support. The rep asked me to put in the camera IP address in the browser (http://192.168.x.x)  - which took me to the setup page. In the document that comes with the camera this is not mentioned anywhere. Once logged in to the camera settings it was a breeze setting up all the features (Wireless, SD Card, Motion detection, Voice). The customer rep was extremely helpful. Finally everything works the way it should and I am on happy customer.I was also able to get the camera working with my Synology surveillance system. Also the iphone app works great.I will update the review after using this camera for few more days. So far this is a great camera for the price. Just wish the quick install guide includes the step to login into camera settings using the IP address.

Reviews.Title: Low cost security option
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Puchel
Reviews.Content: I purchased two DCS930s for my home.  Set up took less than 10 minutes.  Picture quality is not the best and definitely not for low lighting applications. After downloading Dlink light app I can see pictures on any of my computers including Iphone and I pad.  A good buy if picture quality and lighting are not a requirement

Reviews.Title: Setup a little snarky but I called the 877 453 5465, had to wait a few mins
Reviews.Author: Curtis J. Rush
Reviews.Content: but Carlos (agent AR004279) was sharp as a tack and guided me right through.  Set up now so I can see it from a web browser and also downloaded the dlink app on my android... perfect thus far.For the price, not bad!!

Reviews.Title: The big boy camera, with SD card and PIR, but not awesome.
Reviews.Author: BlinkDog
Reviews.Content: I bought several of the indoor D-Link cloud camera line to compare them, and this was the most feature-rich of the group that I looked into. This one has the PIR detection, IR lighting, and SD card recording. I set it up and tried most of the features, and compared to some of the Panasonic BL-Cxxx line that I also have. The Panasonics are much more configurable by the way in terms of setting up and verifying motion detection. This camera, the DCS-942L had a nice feature where you could draw the sensitive area for motion detection, and a single setting for sensitivity, but no way to verify when it would trigger other than set it up and walk past it, then go check online to see what it got. It tends to get a lot of false triggers at high sensitivity and miss a lot of triggers at lower sensitivity. I could not make it work like I expected it to work or as well as the Panasonics do. The SD recording is done pretty well and efficiently, and you can get days of storage, depending on the settings you use. The IR night vision works well and you can get a decent sense of the scene even in total darkness, 30 feet away.Another annoying lack of feature is that there is only one admin account. You can create other user access accounts, but they all have the same basic user privs and you can not make them admins. On Panasonic, all accounts are configurable.It's a decent, feature rich camera for under $100, but not as good as some of the $250 or so cameras out there.

Reviews.Title: Best Value IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian's Reviews
Reviews.Content: I have had various IP cameras over the last 5-10 years but this is by far the best value, the easiest to setup, and the most versatile with mobile application support.  My previous cameras did not have a mobile app and required PC only to view.  This is such a massive improvement that I switched my entire house to these cameras.  To be clear I know that I can spend a lot more for a little bit sharper cameras but these are more than sufficient to allow me to check on my house and record for basic security on top of my security system.  Once again these provide the best value or bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely useful
Reviews.Author: Sarju Singh
Reviews.Content: After trying so many camera system for my twins bedroom day night I finally found the best system ever... Looking or a good system this is the one....

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: skyway
Reviews.Content: I will definitely recommend this to my family and friends. Product can be use on windows based as well as on Mac. Packaging is very good and product received in good condition.

Reviews.Title: Wireless function does not work
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: The installation disc that was included did not work.  I downloaded the installation software from the D Link website and installed the camera using the ethernet cable; however, the camera will not work wirelessly and must be connected via the ethernet cable to function which means that it is useless to me.  Google revealed that it is a common problem.  Totally sucks.

Reviews.Title: 5 minute set up
Reviews.Author: Wael Azmy
Reviews.Content: Very easy to setup.Works on the iphone.You can control the stream quality, higher quality and frame rate the slower and lagging it becomes on a slow internet connection. If you will use it locally on your WiFi network and connect from the same network eg. both device viewing and the camera at home, then it will be very fast on any frame rate and quality.I gave this 4 starts for the following reason, you can not add family members to the stream using your mydlink account, you will have to give them your password and account details so they can see the camera feed. But you can create local accounts on the camera when you connect to it using the ip, and you can add accounts for other people to connect to it.I think it is more convenient to allow a user to add people to the feed through mydlink cloud control panel.

Reviews.Title: It works, but took buggy setup and narrow view angle
Reviews.Author: gadget guru
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a wireless camera to monitor my front door, which is well sheltered from the elements.  I wanted something simple that didn't need constant access to a hard drive for recording so I liked the thought of it recording to the onboard micro SD card.PROS:1. Good image quality (although brightness and contrast had to be adjusted.2. Can easily view from my phone via free mydLink app.3. Can view from any computer on mydLink web site.4. Night vision mode works well (for sort range at least)5. Can be set record only when motion is detected.CONS:1. Tedious setup.  Although it supports Mac, I had to find and download the setup wizard online.  Then I had to download and enable Java (I had chosen previously not to run Java because of security risks). After the initial setup, the camera wouldn't record to the SD card so after trying everything else, I had to do a hard reset and start over from scratch.  Now I couldn't connect wirelessly all from the setup wizard - I had to logon to the mydLink site and finish the wireless setup from there.  I had to delay mounting it on the wall twice because it had to be re-setup. I may have had a glitchy camera or it may not like my Mac and router, but it really would've been easier to to use a different camera and set up port forwarding on my router.2. Noise on microphone. There is constant background noise when viewing the camera live feed.3. Narrow view angle.  Horizontal: 45.3° • Vertical: 34.5°• Diagonal: 54.9°.  Just too narrow to see everything that I would like to see.4. No external antenna and so signal strength is very dependent on camera position. I mounted it just 40 feet and 1 concrete wall from my router.  It will give me 10 frames per second when facing towards the router but less than 1 fps when turned 90 degrees to it.  This limits what I can monitor (especially given the narrow viewing angle).5.  Each time I view it on on my home computer, I get 4 separate pop-up security warnings about Java applets.  This is annoying but I'm reluctant to lower my security settings at this point.6. Just checked on the camera and it's lost connection AGAIN.  Time to start replacement shopping.OVERALL:Good image quality (but too narrow to be really useful) and records to onboard SD card (not included), but way too glitchy and too much trouble for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Worked right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Ming "Ming"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't able to activate the camera over my wifi network, but had to plug it into the router to set up. But after that it has worked flawlessly on the wifi.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Hard to Configure
Reviews.Author: Teddy L. Boulden
Reviews.Content: I'm a computer guy and spend long hours configuring my devices.  This one took some learning.  I wanted the camera to record, had an extra computer, and then had to take the time to learn how to configure Windows and my router so the camera can FTP images to it.  I'm busy so this took me quite a while to achieve especially to do it in a secure way.  Now that it's working, it works flawlessly.  It's great.  I can see it anywhere on my smart phone.  One thing I'd like, though, is a chance to turn on the email feature on from my smart phone.  I'd like to leave my house, touch a button and turn on the email feature.  When no one is supposed to be there, I can turn it on and have it email me if there's an intruder.  Right now, I turn it on and it floods me with email of me leaving and entering my home.  I'd like to do it remotely.

Reviews.Title: D-Link 932L - Motion Sensor feature triggers continuous false alarms
Reviews.Author: John Conte
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the explicit purpose of setting up a motion detection and notification mechanism while I am away from home.  Although the camera works in terms of streaming video, the motion detection part continuously sends notifications via email (based on my configuration) even when there is no one home.  I have tried various sensitivity and area configurations, but there is definitely some issue with this camera.  I have the latest firmware, etc.  Then I found this post on the d-link forum:forums dot dlink dot com/index.php?topic=54646.0Basically, there are many other folks with the same issue and no solution from dlink.What a shame, because the camera itself is not bad - but for the motion detection purpose, it is pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: "Wireless" camera, it is not!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Maddox "When??"
Reviews.Content: Item works only while connected through Ethernet cable. Item is specifically listed as "Wireless" camera and after 3 separate days or 3+ hour attempts with working with trouble shooting and customer services, also purchasing of a new router to see if that may have been the issue, the item will still not run through wireless.I am currently in the process of attempting to return item as not as described.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-942L Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink enabled
Reviews.Author: Herb40
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good value, considering its features and the price.  But I soon ran into an obstacle when following the suggestion to use the router's WSP security capability with the camera.  My wireless network was not set up to use WSP, so I was worried that if the camera used WSP then the router would insist on WSP for all users. I sent an inquiry to MyDLink support for an answer but NEVER got a response. I used the WSP approach anyway and my fears were realized -- the camera worked but my computers could no longer connect to the router, and the password needed was not obvious to me.  I reset the camera and my router and started over, this time using WPA security, with me supplying the key (password). I had to reset the network connections of all of my devices, but at least I knew what the password was. After that, the setup process went smoothly and I soon had images available via mydlink.com. (All of the preceding was with the camera directly attached to the router.)Getting the system to work wirelessly took some extra effort since the MyDLink wizard could not recognize my wireless network and therefore could not continue.  My e-mail to MyDLink support was NEVER answered. To get around this problem, I had to connect directly to the server within the camera system and set up wireless networking there, but this was an easy thing to do.  I was also able easily to set up motion detection and e-mailing of images.  I plan to use the camera primarily for when we are away from home on longer trips, so I do not use it on a daily basis. However, I did experiment with both daytime and nighttime images and both appear to be good enough to help identify an intruder.Edit: Shortly after I posted the above review, I checked my e-mail and found an alert from MyDLink that the camera had been "disconnected." But it was still plugged in and was warm, and should have been able to communicate wirelessly with the router, which is only a few feet away, but MyDLink could not connect to it.  I will have to investigate this problem after Thanksgiving -- grandkids are arriving today.

Reviews.Title: At $70, you get what you pay for but it can be better.
Reviews.Author: Adrian Hernandez
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever web and security cam I have ever purchased so I did not really know what to expect. I purchased the cam for $69.99 so it wasn't too costly to get some security and piece of mind while I am away from home. Setup took longer than expected. To elaborate, ethernet setup was fast and simple but wireless setup was tougher. I installed the set up program to my laptop and when trying to setup wireless, the setup program would not pick up my wifi which meant the camera could not be setup wirelessly.After some tinkering, I left the camera connected via ethernet and went to the advanced settings via the mydlink.com website. Here I was able to enter my wifi router's password and set it up wirelessly.The quality is not HD but it is not bad. I would suggest you youtube some videos regarding this cam so you know what to expect. When I am home on my laptop and same wifi as the camera, the picture is great and there is hardly and lag. When I access the camera via the "mydlink Lite" app on my iphone5 and on AT&T; LTE, the framerate suffers. Also, I seem to have a clearer picture when night vision is on during most of the day rather than the normal day setting.One of my biggest pros and cons about the camera is the motion sensor and the email notification settings. I love that it has motion sensor abilities so it can alert me of an intruder. I hate that the motion sensor cannot be scheduled for certain times. It would be great if I can have the motion sensor be active while I am away and turn off when I get home but that is currently not an option. Instead I have to be careful when I get home not to step into a motion sensor area (that you get to choose via the advanced settings) or else it would automatically send me tons of emails and notification alerts.Overall, the camera does what it is supposed to do. While the picture may not be HD and the frame rate suffers depending on your connection, it does provide extra security at a cheap price compared to its competitors.

Reviews.Title: Best value...
Reviews.Author: Turk
Reviews.Content: I have a whole slew of these D-Link cameras.  According to my needs I'll buy a more expensive or cheaper model.  The software to operate them/watch is FREE.  They are very easy to pair with your wireless modem, and relatively concealable.

Reviews.Title: Won't connect to wireless network
Reviews.Author: Scott D
Reviews.Content: I was unable to get it to connect to my wireless network (2wire 2701).  I spent 1.5 hours on the phone with tech support and they could not get it to connect.  When they wanted the password to my router so they could do remotely the same things we had been doing over the phone I said enough.  Even if I could have gotten it to connect, I am not sure how useful it would have been.  The camera was 20 feets from the wireless router, no walls and when I did a site survey during installation and it found my wireless network, it said signal strength was 34%.  When we updated the firmware I noticed that the orignal firmware was from 2010-8-10, over three years old.  I noticed in the manual that if your router doesn't support UPnP the the installation wizard will not work (mine doesn't support it).  My son-in-law purchased a higher end D-link camera and he has had the exact same problem, won't connect to wireless network.  I think I am going analog.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little camera to get your feet wet
Reviews.Author: D. Booth "Fighting Back One Gadget At A Time"
Reviews.Content: It's November and I've been using this camera since May. I wanted to set up several cameras to watch different areas in my home when I'm not there. This is a day only, 1-way audio(I can hear what is in the area of the camera but can't talk to anyone there), there is no pan and tilt. It works wirelessly for the signal but yes, you have to have a wire to plug in to a power outlet. You also have to use the provided ethernet cable and connect it to your wireless router to do the initial set up. When I first opened the box, there was a CD that was clearly marked "begin here". I put it in the drive on my computer and followed the direction and this little puppy was up and running wirelessly in no time. I could then unplug it and move it room to room and each time it was still communicating wirelessly. If you do unplug it and you want it to have the right time, you do have to rest the new time but that is pretty easy and can be done wirelessly. Since this was my first dlink camera, the set up took me through setting up my mydlink account. This is free and you log in to it to watch your camera when you are away from home. Your computers can be off while your gone but your modem(I'm on DSL) and wireless router need to be working. I set this up to send  6 pictures to my email on any detected motion so I can also see snapshots of things that may have happened when I wasn't watching via the mydlink website. You can also use the Dlink lite free application to watch the video feed on a Kindle HD. Once I was happy with this camera I mounted it on a wall in my home office and it detects anyone that enters the office. This was mounted several months ago and I haven't had to do anything to it. I can watch the office from anywhere at anytime and I can check emailed images to see anything I may have missed. After this camera, I thought I would move up to a day/night, pan and tilt camera and bought a dcs5010L which I have found requires a lot more attention and has a few issues. However the 5010L made me realize how nice this little camera was for the price. I do wish it had the day/night feature but I don't find the pan/tilt that useful on the other camera for my current use. If you just want a simple camera to look at one specific lighted area and to detect motion, this is a good camera. I look at it at as a good camera to start with. I have plans for a few more of these and one or two with additional features for specific jobs.

Reviews.Title: WiFi feature doesn't work, otherwise OK
Reviews.Author: Bill Guenthner "Bill G"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 5 D-Link cameras including this one. This model was the least expensive and is also the worst by a wide margin. It  won't connect with WPS and must be set up manually and then it simply will not stay connected over wi-fi for more than a few minutes. Otherwise it works as advertised as long as it's connected to the router with an ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: Good product, easy to install
Reviews.Author: CAVA
Reviews.Content: The D-Link DCS-930L is a camera you can easily connect to your home WiFi network for recording or remote monitoring.  The integration with the MyDlink service is excelent and easy to use and you can start to monitor your camera via WEB or using a mobile device in minutes. The motion detection with notification to the EMail works fine but I had to adjust the sensitivity to avoid the activation by shadows or the wind.  It sends 6 images, 3 of before and 3 of after the motion was detected but if the subject is moving too fast, the camera will miss it.If you need to record video to a PC or NAS, you need a PC always on and running an additional application.  The camera can save still images each second to a NAS using the FTP protocol without using a computer but it cannot record video by itself. The 930L has good image with good light conditions but it won't work if it is too dark so I am buying the 932L for my backyard.I connected this camera to a Netgear WNDR3400v2 router and it works fine, I have not been able to use the FTP functionality since the Netgear has a weird implementation of the protocol and it delivers a 230 message type when connected instead of a 220 message, so the camera thinks it is not connected. I sent a note to Netgear and I will update this post if they answer.

Reviews.Title: Ok if you get it on sale.
Reviews.Author: Bryan D. Uslick
Reviews.Content: Setup was easy.  Viewing on Ipad costs 99 cents for app but it works well.  Viewing in a browser works once you have Java updated but you have to keep giving it access over and over.  The picture quality is worse than their website pictures leads you to believe.  Out of the box it runs in 320 mode but by changing default advanced settings in browser it can be changed to 640 which is better.  Colors are way off from reality.  Night mode is not true IR but is adequate for basic picture.  Sound quality is bad as mentioned in many reviews.  I got it on sale for 50 bucks which is ok for what you get.  Not sure it is worth much more than that.

Reviews.Title: BEST Security/Survailance out there for cost/ease
Reviews.Author: Chad Gilezan
Reviews.Content: Wanted something in-expensive to monitor when people leave and come to my house since I have out of town guests all of the time.  This has exceeded my expectations.  It's very inexpensive, has live feed with audio, has software that can send you an email when motion is dectected (you can even pick the section of the frame to detect motion), phone app to show feed as well, and ALL FREE after you buy the camera.  Better than any security system I've seen when it comes to features and price.  Uses of this are endedless!

Reviews.Title: Good for what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting a security camera setup for some time being as how I live in the not of best neighborhoods. I did not need night vision (at least for now) as the two areas I wanted to monitor have lights on timers. So in comes the DCS-930LGreat size and versatility in mounting. I have one hanging on a wall and one hanging from the base part at the top of a set of miniblinds looking out a window. By having a curtain over the window and turning off the LED in settings, I do not get any glare from the window itself.To help with mounting, there is a removable ring on the base plate so you can place screws right through the plate.Able to send an email with motion detection. You get 3 frames before detection and 3 frames after. You are able to set a sensitivity level as well as which sections of the image to activate from. You can also do a time out after first detection before it emails again. Something I should have done when my second floor neighbors were moving in. Setting up the email is a chore, you need the various settings. I had issues with setting up my @live address so I made a @gmail one. Settings are easy to find on search engines. You may not want to have your primary email receive the notifications if there will be a lot of detections. Those emails can fill up your inbox pretty fast.Able to ftp to local storage. I got one of those new WD My Cloud 2TB drives. I set up a user for security and a folder for the camera. The settings page for the ftp (and everything else for that matter) are decent but while giving you lots of control, there is a learning curve on the advanced page. To help others: Host: (whatever the ip is for the NAS, 192.168.x.x) Port: 21 (usually), Name / Password: these are whatever your NAS has for access, I initially had these blank but camera was happier with an actual log-in.
