Path: Here is the one I had issues with. MY path for MY NAS is //Security/FrontCamera where "Security" is the user and FrontCamera the directory I made in that user folder. I saw some indications on the dlink forums that the exact method of the paths / or \ may be interchangeable so if one slash ain't working slash it the other. Options for storage for ftp are:AlwaysSet days and timesMotion (no time out)1,2,3 frames per secondx (your choice) seconds per frameImage Quality is decent for what I paid. HD this is not. However, in proper lighting I can see well enough to make out faces. At night time I have some interference in the signal shown by horizontal lines. This is probably 60 cycle interference from the fluorescent bulbs in the nearby security lights. There is an option to go between 50 and 60 Hz but I did not see a difference. It is not that big of a issue with my setup.DLink Brand. Now that I have a dlink cloud account for this and am able to view the live feeds through the web on their site and a free android application, I will probably stick to dlink moving forward when I get a IR cam for my driveway. I see no reason to change it up at this point.Anything ElseSetup was a headache when I tried to set everything myself. I finally gave up and used the WPS button. That was much easier. The cord is pretty short but was able to pass it through a window (and still close it) onto my porch for placement of one of the cameras. The microphone is able to be disabled, which is a good thing since the other camera is mounted in a bedroom. Be aware of all laws regarding recording in your locale. For instance, in my state audio recording without permission is illegal, video recording when there is no expectation of privacy without permission is not illegal.

Reviews.Title: Great if it works - but it doesn't
Reviews.Author: Stubborn Dutchman
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a decent, low-cost Surveillance Camera for a vacation home that would notify me in the event of an intrusion. I've had this camera for a while, but never used it because I could never get the wireless to work; would not recognize any SSID.Since I plan on using ethernet anyway (I don't trust wifi for continuous dependable service) Thought I'd give the DCS-930L another try.Setup for motion detection and email alert is fairly straighforward, and it works great sometimes.There's the rub - sometimes. What's more, usually not!If I have an intruder, I want to know every time, not sometimes.This is a so-so low resolution network security camera, but don't waste your time and money if you're wanting anything reliable beyond that.

Reviews.Title: Mac Owners Beware
Reviews.Author: Roy Ernst
Reviews.Content: After hours of trying to get this to work with my Mac and a couple of exchanges with technical support, I received this: "We apologize but our cameras has not been updated yet to work properly on Java 7. We highly recommend to use Java 6 instead. However, rest assured that our engineering team are working on it."They could have saved me hours if they said that in the first place. It is not easy to download Java 6 and I really don't want to.I have a new Mac running the latest software. It might work with older software and Java 6.I will probably return it.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Howard A. Paul "happhd"
Reviews.Content: The basic function of the camera is excellent.  It could be improved if the image produced on the computer were scalable or if it could be cut from the entire web page on only the image shown.  The positive is that it works as advertised and tech support is reachable and helpful for set up.

Reviews.Title: Ease of Plug N Play hides advanced features
Reviews.Author: J. Sikes "zoinkster"
Reviews.Content: You won't be making award winning digital shorts with this camera.  But it handles low light ok.  The video sometimes has lines in it.  But for security, it does it's job for me.The myDlink software is great.  It's a simple setup and you can view your camera from anywhere.It hides some excellent features tho, that you can only get to by connecting to the IP address of the camera and using the "old" administrator interface:Two of the big ones for me:Motion DetectionEmails sent when Motion Detection Sensors go offI'm glad they left it as an "advanced user" option (it existed on older options as the default interface).

Reviews.Title: Nooooooo....
Reviews.Author: Karen Warren
Reviews.Content: I wanted to purchase a great novelty, a camera within my home, that I could go onto my smartphone, (using the downloaded app), so I could access - from my work, to watch my 2 dogs and 1 cat - roaming around and getting up to much mischievous behaviour while I was at work.  I have spent far too many hours trying to set this up and be compatible to my computer and smart phone. I gave up, practically pulling my hair out....what a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: My link
Reviews.Author: Inger Turner
Reviews.Content: Camera to small, picture not clear, and too much static when listening to the audio. Therefore, i would not recommend this camera to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Patricia Walters
Reviews.Content: Very easy to see on phone and my family can check on me. Considering getting one that sees at night. Tech support was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: Wireless can be very difficult to connect.
Reviews.Author: Jackson
Reviews.Content: Could not get this to connect to my wireless router; tried with three different computers (2 pcs and 1 mac), no luck.  Four hours later, still no luck.Gave up and purchased a new wireless router with WPA and the camera finally connected.

Reviews.Title: Works for home (pet) surveilance EXACTLY as I wanted.
Reviews.Author: YsLadyMN
Reviews.Content: I have 5 pets... and sometimes some of them are naughty.  I wanted to be able to set this up and find out who was doing what.  I will be moving this around my house for just that purpose... but one problem and it's perpetrator has already been caught on camera!This was moderately challenging to get working the way I wanted.  Getting the camera 'active' with the password, etc. assigned was pretty easy following the quick setup directions. Getting the right setting on the number, delay, etc. of email photos I want with the motion trigger took a couple days of experimentation.  All in all, I got this on sale for $50 and it is EXACTLY what I want.  I can use it for critter spying, kid spying and also home security when I travel. I may get a couple more if I can catch them on sale again!!I had used a hunting camera before.  that was fine after adapting for inside use... but I like this because I can see what is going on from any mobile device and I don't have to unload an SD card to get the photos, I have them emailed to me and 'when something happens' that I want to know "who and how" I just review the photos from that day or estimated time slot and get my answer.  Otherwise I delete the messages in mass and don't even have to look through them.

Reviews.Title: WIRELESS DOES NOT WORK
Reviews.Author: yorkiemom
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. After months of trying to get the wireless feature to work I decided to get a different device.  If you have a MAC you have to download software that is not on the disk.  This is definately not SIMPLE to set up unless you are familiar with IP addresses and all.  I wanted something I could plug in and have it walk you through setting it up.  It does not do that.  I agree with other reviewers that tech support has no clue.  If they sell something as wireless they should support getting it set up without having to pay an extra "premium" amount to simply get their product to work as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera Once You Get Past Setup
Reviews.Author: D. Beckman
Reviews.Content: I work in IT for a living, and for most devices like this I immediately bypass whatever setup CD came with the product and just configure the device from its default web page. You can do that with this device (over Ethernet), but if you want to use their smart phone app, you'll end up having to start from scratch and use their setup anyway -- that's the only way to create the Dlink account that you need to use their phone app. Also, I had problems getting it to connect over WiFi. Eventually I figured out that the camera didn't like my Wifi network's password, because it had a space in it. (Mind you, everything else on the network worked fine with this password.) So I had to remove the space from the WiFi password, and of course re-configure every other WiFi device. Annoying, but it's been working fine ever since.Once setup, I like the camera. I use it to keep an eye on our dog. I shared the address with lots of family, and now I can't even disconnect the camera without getting complaints about the "puppy cam" being down. So, initial setup can be a pain, but I would get it again.

Reviews.Title: Nice little wireless IP camera
Reviews.Author: A. Gift For You
Reviews.Content: I have had this outside under the eve of my house for over a month. No issues with rain or humidity yet, although it is not directly exposed to the rain. The IR LEDs are useless in this application and for anything other than a baby monitor.In day mode image quality is what you'd expect for 640x480, namely just ok. Night mode video even with a 100% signal is full of horizontal scolling lines which appear to be related to the camera setting a high ISO sensitivity. That's better than a completely black video, but I would still rate the night mode quality as poor.Live video is available via ActiveX (ugh) and Java (seems to work fine). NOTE: The Java viewer will not work on android, so you must use another app like MJpegViewer.MJPEG encoding at 640x480, "Auto" fps, and "Very High" quality requires (very) roughly ~500 KB/s with a mostly static scene.Quick install guide should include information concerning the web interface and the default username and password. (admin, "empty") Installing their software is not necessary.Motion detection, email, ftp, and wireless features work fine.I very much like that it supports HTTPS! I do not allow the device to acces the internet directly, because security is generally not a focus for these sort of widgets. (http://storageservers.wordpress.com/2013/05/01/d-link-firmware-vulnerability-makes-its-security-cameras-prone-to-hacking/) When I want to access it away from home, I use it over an SSH tunnel instead.The ability to disable the front LED is excellent.DLink, thanks for making the GPL'd code obviously available.

Reviews.Title: Not necessarily the best
Reviews.Author: Chalupa Batman
Reviews.Content: The cameras seem very nice and have a great amount of features. Unfortunately because it's based on wireless internet, which is a very good feature, I have problems getting a camera to work well because it's at the other end of the house at the edge of my wireless signal.The app for my phone is a little wonky as well. It has a lot of trouble connecting to the cameras but the website always seems to work. It would be nice if the app was a little bit more stable. I think it could easily be fixed with an update in the future.Other than that, it's a great buy. I have it set up with picture capture based on the motion detection and it dumps them all into an email account I created and set up just for that. Some of the cameras don't work as well with the motion capture as others but that could be based on a number of different variables outside of the settings.EDIT: Also be wary of reflective surfaces. I have these sitting in different windows all over my house. I have to put them at angles so that when it switches to night vision, they don't reflect directly off the windows and cause massive glare. I still get a reflection off of the screens on my windows so I will have to take them off in order to be able to have the cameras work with night vision. I have a friend who uses these whose windows reflect the light no matter what angle they are at so be careful to make sure they work with your windows.

Reviews.Title: Not so Wireless...
Reviews.Author: H Siefers
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these and they are both going back today.  The installation seems to be easy, right up until I get to the part where I try to connect the cameras to the Wifi.  Neither of the units would connect to my Wifi, so I tried at 2 of my neighbor's houses with the same problem.  When you try and enter in the Wifi password the units fail to connect.  I will say that they worked great when connected to a Lan line and the my-Dlink website was easy to log into and view. But I ordered them because of their wireless capabilities which do not work.  I emailed tech support and did not get a response after 5 days.  When I called the 1-800 # to get customer support I found out that I had to provide a credit card # as it was not a free service with no indication of the billing rate... Um WHAT?After several hours of wasted time and money, I can't say that I would purchase from Dlink again, even a newer more expensive model based upon what I experienced with their customer service.

Reviews.Title: Works, but not easily configurable
Reviews.Author: James Holweger
Reviews.Content: I like the product, but beware you need to configure your router.  The biggest issue was I cannot get the wireless to work and the firmware was a pain to get installed

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer support
Reviews.Author: UtahDave
Reviews.Content: I am by no means "technically challenged", but I did have problems connecting this camera to my wireless router. I called customer support, and was surprised to get a knowledgeable, courteous and patient customer support representative without any delay.  Kudos to Carlos (agent#AR004279), and to D-Link for caring enough about their customers to provide U.S. based knowledgeable customer support.  Carlos had my camera working after patiently troubleshooting my problems.  After nearly returning the camera, I instead bought two more!  I wish more companies would realize the potential return on their investment with good customer care. My strong recommendation to anyone interested in this product is to spend an extra $30 to upgrade to the D-Link Wireless Pan and Tilt Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera (DCS-5020L).  For some reason, installation of this camera was much easier.  Plus, the ability to pan and tilt the camera from anywhere in the world on my android phone gives me much more of an area of my home that I can see.  It is well worth the upgrade, and I give this model 5 stars.  In summary: I now have one stationary D-Link camera, and two pan & tilt cameras through which I can access live video and audio, day or night, from anywhere in the world.  It is fun to see what my dogs are up to when I'm away.

Reviews.Title: RTSP doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Fuddy "amazon5815"
Reviews.Content: rtsp video streaming does not work on this camera.  Be aware if it's a feature you require for compatibility with vlc, mobile phones, DVR software or others that require it to operate.

Reviews.Title: Great for window locations
Reviews.Author: George J. Novak
Reviews.Content: Perfect slim size for window ledge installs. East to connect and setup. Avoid the D-Link software and terrible My Link website and just use the webpage generated by the camera. I wish this was available in grey/black as you can get glare bounce from the white camera body. Some issues using the hardwired Ethernet port, but this is mainly designed as a wifi unit.

Reviews.Title: Great cam that is just a little difficult to set up
Reviews.Author: Rano
Reviews.Content: Just go this cam and used a mac to set it up.  I spent several hours trying to set it up before calling tech support which is conveniently 24/7.  It turns out the Installation wizard needed to set up the device had an out-dated link label on the box.  The box says to go to www.dlink.com/mydlinkMAC but this ends up downloading the beta version of the software that is buggy.  Instead, tech support told me to go to mydlink.com, goto the downloads section, select the correct model number and download that wizard.  The updated installation application was able to sync everything properly with the website and the camera is working great now.  Don't hesitate to call tech support.  I had a good experience with them.

Reviews.Title: Not many features
Reviews.Author: Louis F.
Reviews.Content: I suppose I didn't do my research.  No panning capabilities, viewing on the internet the image is too small.  Never did figure out how to set up two cameras wirelessly on my network.  Planning on returning them.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: This works great for the price but later I bought the 932l which has infrared. I would recommend the 932l for the simple fact it will work in the dark.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Scott Davis "ScottInHawaii"
Reviews.Content: This camera works fine except the constant audio static and popping, which seems worse in the DLink app on my phone and tablet. I'm only using it for fun, nothing serious so it's not that big of a deal. Turning the volume to a lower lever, like 30, in the setup helps. Down at 10 the static ones away, but the sound also cuts in and out a bit.

Reviews.Title: DCS-930L Great picture in bright light; terrible picture in low light.
Reviews.Author: MammonLord
Reviews.Content: I hate it when Amazon mixes reviews for different products. I bought the DCS-930L because reviews say it works well at night. Now I've come back, I realize many of the reviews are for different cameras. The 930L has an absolutely awful picture in less than bright light. I use mine for surveillance mounted above two bright lights on my driveway. The camera creates awful blue and brown horizontal lines over the whole image and doesn't seem able to auto-adjust to capture low-light images. See my image capture in the user images above. I have a much older D-Link DCS-920 and it is able to operate perfectly in the exact same conditions where this camera fails completely.If you want to use the DCS-930L only during the day in a well lit area, it delivers a great picture and is inexpensive. For 24 hour surveillance, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Bad customer support
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Yablan
Reviews.Content: Motion detection didn't work. It never saw real motion, but when nothing was moving it sent emails. Maybe it's a ghost detection device?I contacted customer support and they ignored me. No response. Ever.At least I have a ticket number! You know what they can do with that...

Reviews.Title: DCS 932 - Page times out...
Reviews.Author: Trenice Edwards
Reviews.Content: It times out after 2 minutes...have to constantly refresh the page...even though I disabled the PnP option on my router...However, the video quality is pretty good...

Reviews.Title: Picky about wifi
Reviews.Author: Donna Campbell "Donna in AZ"
Reviews.Content: It really doesn't work that well for us.  It is at the other end of the house from the router and doesn't stay connected well.  Once we add a booster for our router it might be much better.

Reviews.Title: Great for my dog daycare
Reviews.Author: patty a thomas
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my dog daycare. I can eat up in the middle of the night and check my iPad and see the dogs resting. The night vision is really cool!

Reviews.Title: Don't do it if you are looking for REAL video clips
Reviews.Author: Elle
Reviews.Content: We purchased these cameras to help monitor some of the happenings around our house - You know teenagers and their tricks.  When reading the description I THOUGHT I was getting a camera that will send VIDEO to my designated email address. It does NOT do that.  It sends still photos.  This is not what I wanted for my monitoring.Also, if you are pointing the camera out of a window at night there is sometimes a reflection and it will not capture images.  One thing that is truly disappointing is the length of the power cord. I am running this though my wifi and I want to attach them to the upper area of my windows.  The 4 foot cord it comes with does not do the trick. Lastly, the marketing video does not show you that you have to SCREW in the clip on plate if you want to mount it. If I was keeping this item I would have holes in my window casings.I should have gone with my gut and purchased another system that I was eyeing.  I know better now.  We are returning the product.  It just stinks.P.S. My brother has one as a baby monitor. It works perfect for him.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time trying to get this camera to work. When I finally got it to display the feedback from the audio was horrible and I had to mute it. Night vision did not work and the image during the day wasn't exactly terrific. I had my son try to set it up again to try and get it to work properly figuring I was doing something wrong. He couldn't get it to even configure again and he mentioned that there was something wrong with the software. The installation process wouldn't accept the password for the camera which pretty much stops you dead in your tracks as far as continuing with the installation. I ended up returning the camera for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Expectations Fulfilled
Reviews.Author: Pra "PL"
Reviews.Content: Scenario: Axis M1031W ($250+) has been running for just about 2 years pressed against a window pane giving me a yard view.  Worked fine, nothing spectacular, but started to act up about 2 months ago. Would not stream an image reliably anymore. Contacted Axis, quoted a $98 repair/refurbished fee...began to look at my options.  My requirements were quite modest, 640 x 480 is fine (no megapixel required), good FTP, maybe audio, okay low light (don't need LEDs), remote access. Setup was a breeze, FTP was a bit quirky (needed FTP IP address, not server name) and was up and running.  MyDlink remote access service worked fine initially, but once I switched to my own static IP and port, it stopped connecting....no problem, since I use my own app (TinyCam) to access remotely.  Adjusted settings for image to best available, and at $43 vs $250 new or $98 repair, the winner is this neat little IP camera.  If you look at all the features that Axis provided versus this DCS930L, I'm 90% there and very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Camera functions as advertised except technical support is unresponsive
Reviews.Author: KPH
Reviews.Content: Camera functions properly but setup is confusing if you wish to enable motion detection and have a picture emailed to you. Repeated attempts to reach and get a response from D-Link have been unsuccessful to date.

Reviews.Title: It works okay
Reviews.Author: c. lam
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my wireless g cams of another brand.  Works as advertised, cost is reasonable.  Image clarity is not great but adequate for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Does What It Says
Reviews.Author: helen_in_tn
Reviews.Content: I have pets so bought this to check in on the when I'm not home. It is actually relatively easy to set up as I just followed the included instruction.  It is wireless, which is great. I can put it any where in my house. Colored view when day time, night vision in dark is black white view.Overall, I'm satisfied.. Except the power plug wire is too short for me as I like o place my camera up high n a book shelf.I can hear and see what my pets are doing when I'm not home from my iPhone.  Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: Customer service non existent!
Reviews.Author: Michael T Richardson
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera, will not work with Mac OSX.  Tried calling customer service on hold for an hour, when someone finally answered, they said I had the wrong department and transferred me.  Waited another half hour, still no answer!  Four messages to customer service through their website have gone unanswered.  Can not even update the software for the camera.  Totally useless!  Do not buy if you own a Mac!  Will never purchase another item from this manufacturer!

Reviews.Title: DCS-930L great camera and great support
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: I purchased 6 of these camera and had an initial problem with connecting to my router. I worked with May (ID  AR004630 MAY) who was extremely helpful and informative. Recommend their support when needed.

Reviews.Title: GOOD LUCK SETTING IT UP
Reviews.Author: BillBrasky9999
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions from dlinks support website to a "T". I could not wait to set this up and it all seemed deceptively easy enough, until I got to the mydlink.com registration which did not recognized the email address I had literally just entered during setup. I tried two more times. I also clicked the "Forgot Password" link by the sign-on does not work apparently so I logged a support ticket and received a confirmation from them that I would be contacted. A week passed and I never heard anything from their support team. I then decided to call during one evening and after being on hold for over a half hour with no indication of further wait I just got fed up and called it quits. This should have been a very simple fix for them but they never bothered to try to help me as a customer. "Your call is very important to us" ...yeah right.I'll return this and buy one of their competitors' products now, hopefully they understand customer service.

Reviews.Title: easy setup but rather fuzzy image
Reviews.Author: N6AC "n6ac"
Reviews.Content: This is our third DCS-93xL camera - setup and utility have been good, even using our Mac computers. There is lots of helpful information at the forumDOTD-Link.

Reviews.Title: not for mac
Reviews.Author: swissy
Reviews.Content: not possible to install on a new Mac. requires down loading a separate difficult to find installer, then the latest java is too "new" so you need to uninstall, but then the the old one is no longer available from apple. try switch between chrome & safari neither allows you to see video. managed to finally get a picture on my ipad after 2 hours but then disconnect the ethernet cable and it does not work in wireless mode.... going back to get a refund. waste of time.

Reviews.Title: Total garbage, even with the update
Reviews.Author: P.
Reviews.Content: Even with the firmware update, unit is useless. The real problem is with dlinks software and web interface. Its buggy, never works right and crashes 4 out of 5 times. Save your money

Reviews.Title: Ahh don't bother
Reviews.Author: ltscaep
Reviews.Content: It works but I had a heck of a time getting features to work.  Once I did it was ok.  However the stand is flimsy I have it propped up in different ways

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with easy set up
Reviews.Author: G. M.
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about ordering at first because of all the varying reviews but it seemed like there was a pattern to the complaints. Either you got a good one or a troublesome one. So I took that chance. This camera works great with a very crisp clear picture and the sound is fantastic.When I put something in the front yard for sale I can't see it from my family room. So I set up the camera in another room window and can see whats going on in the yard in real time on my computer even while I do other things on my computer.It works for me and I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: John John
Reviews.Author: Big BA
Reviews.Content: This camera had to keep program after hanging it up.For the money you pay, it should work better.This security camera is not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: Bad security...
Reviews.Author: Sonny
Reviews.Content: I read in a previous review that the sysadmin pwd is passed in clear text as viewed by a packet capture.That is a terrible security hole, as this type of sniffing is very common in any hack attempt. It's bad enough that most wireless networks can be compromised with some effort, but to fail at step one? This should be a common evaluation for any device that is attached to network. My thanks to the reviewer that alerted me to this.I'm not going to waste time and money to disprove this, I'll just take this one at face value, as this type of poor quality is all too common anymore in software in general.So, I guess that more reseach will be done prior to purchase, in the future.No thank you.

Reviews.Title: Very unstable | D link has the worse support line ever  , do not even think about it
Reviews.Author: Seydou
Reviews.Content: I  have purchase 15 of these units  wchich i install for my cusstomersthe camera after 9 months won't work wirelesslydo not download new firmware for dlinkD link has the worse support line ever  , do not even think about it

Reviews.Title: Good day/night camera
Reviews.Author: Vladan Bogicevic
Reviews.Content: Only missing thing is that light are visible when camera is activating! It should not be seen, seems somebody would use camera for security purpose!

Reviews.Title: Really great camera.  I paired it with an off-site FTP site for a really cost effective home security system.
Reviews.Author: S. Power
Reviews.Content: I have a few of these camera around the exterior of my house and have them all paired to an off-site FTP site.  They store the images from this camera for 7 days, so I can go back and look at them if I have an issue at my house.  For this purpose, this camera works extremely well.  The service that I use with this camera is CameraFTP dot com.The camera is easy to use, and once set up it stays connected and works consistently with know user involvement.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Oldman
Reviews.Content: I now have 6 cameras for my uncle's home for surveillance while we are away.Only one negative: The power cord is way too short, needs to be at least another 6 Ft longer or expandable

Reviews.Title: Absolutely, positively, DOES NOT WORK.  DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: S J Gilbert
Reviews.Content: If you are interested in hours of frustration and anguish, this is the product for you.  Product support is non-existent, unless you think that a 48-hour email reply to a static question is acceptable.  The product, simply put, does not work.  It is difficult to set up, and then requires a reset from time to time.  What good is that when you are using it to monitor a remote location?  If you could get there to push the reset button or unplug the device, you wouldn't need or buy this product.  These are the sorts of products that makes online buying frustrating.  I would only recommend this product to masochists and those who like to hit their head against the wall on a continual basis.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Goddess Taylor
Reviews.Content: this is exactly what i was looking for. qorks great all the time ecsprcially at night i was shocked at how well the pic was in the dark

Reviews.Title: Tried a lot of different ways but could not connect to my wireless network
Reviews.Author: Hoppaguy
Reviews.Content: I would consider myself somewhat tech savvy so I thought installing this D-link camera would be simple. However, after trying multiple ways and looking online, I still could not connect this camera to my home wireless network. I did give the camera 2 stars since it does have a nice small footprint. Perhaps, I just couldn't figure it out but I would suggest that you be very comfortable with how to configure your wireless router settings before purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Meets or exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: robertm
Reviews.Content: I set this up in about 30 minutes including setting up a mylink account and installing the app on my iPhone. It worked the first time. The picture is very clear day and night. The instruction book-or lack thereof is a negative. I will have to go back and set up the motion detector and mico chip as the quick set up guide made no reference to these features

Reviews.Title: Rarely Works
Reviews.Author: R. Golden
Reviews.Content: Camera works about 10% of the time.  I often have to update the firmware or update my version of Java or reboot my router or unplug the camera.  Often, if I do all of those things, it still doesn't work.UPDATE:  In the rare case where I have gotten this camera to work wirelessly, it stops working within a few hours or a day.  Now, I use it only in wired mode which is frustrating because that's not why I bought a wireless camera.  Plus, I had to buy an ethernet powerline adapter so I can use the camera in a different room from my router.Yesterday, I tried accessing my camera remotely and I got a message about a firmware update.  Silly me, I ran the update.  What a mistake.  Now the camera is not working at all, even in wired mode.Meanwhile, my other camera, a Panasonic, works all the time.

Reviews.Title: They have the worst tech support I've ever experienced
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: If you own a Mac, I would suggest not buying this product.  The setup process is entirely different from microsoft set up.  I finally got the camera to work, but needed help configuring it for wireless.  I waited on hold for 30 minutes.  When I finally reached a person, I could not understand him.  He kept talking in circles and trying to get me to update Java to a version that is not support by my operating system.  After 15 minutes of this, I asked to speak to someone else.  He said,"ok" and then never got anybody and just let me wait for another 10 minutes.  The ironic part of this is that two weeks earlier I had set up another of these cameras and I was able to do it with some help.  All I needed was a reminder of a few of the inputs, but they couldn't help me.The bottom line for me is that if you have a product like this in 2012 and it doesn't function with either microsoft or a mac operating system, you should probably get out of the tech business.  A total Mickey Mouse company.  My guess is that they won't be around long.

Reviews.Title: Buggy Software for D-Link DCS-930L Camera and Solutions
Reviews.Author: George H. Conklin
Reviews.Content: The d-link DCS-930L comes with very buggy software.  I have 4 cameras, and each had a different problem!!!  The last two had the same issue, which meant they would not work until new firmware was downloaded.  The process required a phone call to a number listed on a bright orange insert in the instructions.  I was walked through the process by phone.  First, you insert the supplied CD wizard and use it for several steps.  Then you must download a NEW wizard and the new firmware.  You put the firmware on your desktop and unzip it.  Then you put the camera's url into IE, which you found from the first steps before the original wizard crashes (you had better know the url of your router too).  Then you must find the firmware from the desktop and do several steps to download the firmware to the camera.  The DCS-930L must be hard wired into your computer, which also must be hard wired into the internet.  Then you use the new wizard, not the old one.  You also must choose the hard wired option for the camera.  The option for wireless operation in the new wizard does not work.  So you finish up and you have a camera which is hard wired.  To change it wireless, you must go to settings and answer 3 more questions.  You also need the password for your router, after the program finds it.  As for d-link's knowledge pages, I signed up to ask a question but got an e-mail saying you had to "approved."  Forget that...no approval. And the man helping me set the camera up commented, "Most of our users know how to do this."  Right.  Ha. Ha. Ha.  Even the patches are buggy. How would you know that?Getting the e-mail working took several days of fooling around.  I finally found the solution using Bing.  One man said he took 10 hours to get the e-mail working.  I had to set up a gmail account to send the pictures to my usual e-mail.Conclusions:  A whole lot of work for a $59 camera!!!  And the pictures are only so-so.  But they do work. D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera

Reviews.Title: Does not work with Macs - I should have believed all the reviews here!
Reviews.Author: Bellasera
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Windows product, the setup is on a Windows-only CD. You can download a Mac setup in a beta (!) version for OS 10.5 (!) and, of course, it does not work properly. Interesting enough I could get it to work with an Ethernet cable and I could even get it to work with a D-Link own router but never with my Airport station. Customer service is no help.Added on Dec 2012:Their new setup utility does not work with the new Java update (V 7.10). This means you cannot set an area to be monitored and have the camera send an alarm after a movement is detected.This renders the camera worthless for me, it is now just a regular camera for conversations and nothing more.Interestingly enough their own web page mentions that "For security reasons some functions like video settings might not work".Their customer service is extremely bad.

Reviews.Title: fine product after initial set up struggle...
Reviews.Author: yachtsman
Reviews.Content: After over an hour and a half on the phone with customer support & re-reading the instructions I finally got the unit to properly function wireless. This was the most frustrating set up process of any product I've ever experienced. I initially followed the instructions without success. I then called the 800 number and spent over 1 1/2 hours on the phone. I could only get the unit working while plugged into the modem but not wireless. The CS rep was helpful but not the most knowledgeable. He indicated that I had a problem with my log in to my modem. In fact, he gave me the wrong instructions. I needed to check wireless operation & hit the sync button on the modem which I found out the next morning after I gave it one more try before returning it. Once set up, the camera works well & I can now access via my I phone but as noted in previous reviews, the low light use is marginal. The net/net is that you need to be fairly tech savvy to get the unit working wireless but it is a handy low cost remote web cam.

Reviews.Title: Wireless does not work
Reviews.Author: bozoid
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about poor wireless, but figured I'd be able to get this thing going somehow.  I was wrong.  This camera does *not* work over any of my three wireless networks.  It works fine wired (in both day and night modes), it will FTP pictures to a remote server, and it has all the other stuff you'd expect.  Just don't expect to use it on a wireless network.When I bought this, I was looking for a security camera to place outdoors, and I only wanted to run a single wire (either power or network).  It was a tossup between this camera and a slightly more expensive PoE one.  Sure wish I'd bought something else.

Reviews.Title: Very unreliable wireless
Reviews.Author: HD Rider "HD Rider"
Reviews.Content: If you want to use it as a wired ethernet camera, it works fine. But as a wireless device it is poor and unreliable. It constantly disappears from my network randomly. I tried everything in the setup, including static IP address, etc. I also tried this on two unrelated networks. Since I need a wireless device. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great device, poor software support
Reviews.Author: nomad
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to be a technical marvel, but software support is poor. It was devilish to get support to install it with my Mac, and I have never been able to get it to work wireless.  Support is hard to reach by phone, slow to respond by email, and clearly not provided from US workers.  Could buy it now that it sort of works for 2/3 of what I spent 6 months ago.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera given the price
Reviews.Author: Amit Tomar
Reviews.Content: It is an ok camera, solves the purpose of monitoring the entries.I have it outside under the roof. So kind of covered but not completely.Pros:1. Works when it is pointed outside towards a sunny area, so I can monitor who came to my house.2. Sends a mail with 6 pictures. with 1/2 second interval, so atleast one picture grabs a good quality face image.3. Uploads a couple of pictures to my ftp site, they are not the exact same as the mailed pictures, so additional images for just in case.4. Night vision is also very good. and gets the face clearly (I got the pics of the skunk, opossum, and miscellaneous UFO bugs which came very close to lens attracted by infrared)5. Dlink site support, which helps monitor from somewhere else also.6. motion detection areas which let you configure on non-movable areas (like walls instead or trees) to avoid unnecessary alarms7. Easy configuration8. Sufficiently Good UI9. Works with my Android phone "mydlink Lite"10 lastly audio is there, bit noisy, since it does not filter off the background noises, but better than nothing. I can hear cars whiz by, but very little wind noise.Cons:1. No video upload unlike DCS-1130, which uploads a 10 second video on motion detection2. Bit slow framerate than 942There is a additional software Dcam view but it is very memory intensive, but you can record everything off the camera over it. But then you will have to keep the PC ON all the timethe Dcam view is free, but if you want you can download blue iris for a fee which is supposedly betterI also got the foscam before this, I have put its review also, and returned it of-course. look for my review there under "FI8910W Black 2-pack Pan & Tilt Wireless IP Camera with 9dbi Antennas"-Amit

Reviews.Title: Great!...Finally
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: After reading the mix of high and low ratings here I decided to go with this super cheap camera. I'm using it to check in on our pets while we are away. Anyways, like many folks here I ended up having a hassle setting up the wireless component of this camera. Wired worked perfect and was running within minutes. For those of you complaining and blaming your mac or pc and the bundled software, don't, that has nothing to with it. Its a matter of your router's configuration. After trying a multitude of things in my linksys's control panel, I eventually turned off my wifi security and the camera connected immediately, it also worked great on WEP and WPA, but not WPA2(which I had been using)...UNTIL I changed my encryption from "TKIP or AES" to just AES. Upon saving that setting the camera was golden. The Android app is surprisingly good video feed as well, on 3G and at 640x480 resolution. Now that it works I want some more! Which is viable as cheap as these come.

Reviews.Title: A great alternative to expensive baby monitors
Reviews.Author: Eric Burroughs
Reviews.Content: We've previously had the Summer day/night baby monitor and we loved it, while it worked.  But that was the issue.  About a month in suddenly you had to adjust or re-link the camera and monitor.  By one year the audio was kaput and by 14 months the video died all together.  Thus far with this great little D-Link camera it was easy to set up, you can monitor your child with your existing smart phones (android and ios), and the picture and audio are much clearer.  The only down side is there is no tilt/pan motor so you have to set it up and be happy with how you have it faced.  You can get the more expensive model but it seems a bit pricey for that.  All in all a good product and I would suggest it.  Be aware you need to be near a plug.  It comes with a 3 foot cord so that should be taken into account.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for - Great for apartment living!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: **** Updated - See latest comment at the bottom of this review *****I live in an apartment in a fairly secure neighborhood, but it would seem with the economic downturn, there are more thefts then usual these days.  So I decided to start building a security system.  I must say, after shopping around for several months for security systems and services, this by far is the best and easiest way to go!  My home is all about the internet, so, the decision to go with the wireless N camera was a good choice.  This camera was incredibly easy to set up with the software provided.  While I am a network head, I didn't need to use any brain power at all to get this camera up and running.  The most difficult thing is finding the right place to put the camera!  Once installed, I searched the D-LINK website for the Security Software so that I can record and playback video from my camera on my PC, even set it up to only record when there is motion in front of the camera!  Also, it seems easy to add additional cameras for other areas like the garage, entry way, and more!  Further, I can check on my apartment with video and audio from my Kindle Fire with the D-link app!  So, while I am away, I can check on my place!  Also, I can also go to D-Link's website from any other computer and log in and check that way too ... amazing, and my only initial cost was the camera!The only complaint I have is that the power cord from the wall plug to the camera is only 4 feet long.  So, that means splicing in another wire to get more length to get the camera high enough so its out of the way.  Being an electrician, that's simple, but for others it might not be.  The only other choice would be to mount the camera lower, about halfway up the wall.This was a very good decision and a great way to build up my own security system over time.  Best of all, its professional, and wireless - Living in an apartment never got better!***** this is an update below ******The camera has been working so well, I actually purchased a refurb one from Amazon, and it also worked awesome, and I saved a ton.  For those that are interested, I also have these camera email me when there is motion.  Since I use HOTMAIL, I thought I would post the configuration for them ....Dlink Security Camera - DCS-932LThe camera works with security software from DLINK, but the camera can also email images when there is an even, such as motion.  This is particularly useful when you only have email access and want to check up on your house, or whatever our camera is watching.Dlink Local Camera LoginSetup>EmailSMTP Server Address: smtp.live.comSMTP Server Port: 587 (default of 25 will not work)Sender E-mail Address: ** your email@hotmail.com address **Receiver E-mail Address: ** your email@hotmail.com address **User Name: ** your email@hotmail.com address **Password: ** Your email access password **Use SSL-TLS/STARTTLS  (No)  SSL-TLS  (NO - blank)  STARTTLS  (YES)***** Update 1/15/2014 *****I am now up to four cameras after I purchased a condo and moved out of the apartment.  I still very much like the items.  They are fairly simply to install.  I used to use the full recording software on my PC, but I have since found that letting the cameras email when there is motion is simpler and just as effective.  Further, I have installed battery back up power supplies on all cameras so that if the power goes out, the cameras can still record and email me.  Also, here in Idaho, its gets really cold, and that doesn't seem to affect one camera which I placed under an eve out of the rain overlooking my front door.  Also, I wanted to mention that the camera actually caught someone trying to break into my home about 2 months ago.  The would be burglar gave up when he attempted to enter and noticed by dead bolt locks, but I got some awesome images of him and have forwarded them to the local police which might be helpful in other neighborhood break-ins. The only complain I have is that it would be nice if there was an extension for the power cord available from D-Link.  I did wire my own low voltage power cord extension using speaker wire here on Amazon, but an nice clean extension, from D Link, would not only be profitable for them, but easier for those that don't have wiring experience. Also, there are occasional issues with ActiveX and Java, which are 3rd Party software add ons that are required by D Link to make these cameras 100% functional.  There are work arounds, but again, for those not versed in software work arounds it would be nice to use another platform rather than rely on these other companys.  But even with those small issues, this is by far one of the best purchases I have ever had on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: GREAT little cam
Reviews.Author: D. Erdman
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this cam. I love the fact that I can see my home from anywhere. It works great with my I phone. I now own 5 cameras one of them is an inferred cam that works very well at night. These cams are not weather proof but what I did is set up a few in the inside of my windows to keep an eye on my property. It will also detect movement thru the windows. I can now see what my pets are doing when I away from home. If my house alarm goes off it will call my phone I can now see what's going on (hopefully nothing). The cams are worth the price if you can get it for $70 or less, the inferred for $80 or less. Set up was not hard at all your walked thru it completely.The price goes up and down, just keep checking.

Reviews.Title: Camera works fine - until you upgrade the firmware
Reviews.Author: D. DeGroote "symmetric"
Reviews.Content: I have two of these cameras which worked fine for a year or so.  But last week I needed to change the settings.  I downloaded the app to do this and it told me I had to upgrade the firmware first.  This worked fine for the first camera, but it failed on the second.  It is now totally dead.  D-Link is of no help.  They say it needs to be replaced, but they won't replace it without a receipt, and even if I could find it, it's probably been over a year and out of warranty.  I gave this camera 3 stars because they work, but don't upgrade the firmware or you risk killing and otherwise working product.  Personally I won't be buying any more D-Link products.

Reviews.Title: So easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: K. Seidl "KSeidl"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap indoor IP camera to spy on my dog.  My house is Mac and I have an airport express circa 2009.  I followed the advice from other folks on amazon.  Skip the install disc and go right to mydlink website.  They have a setup wizzard.  I plugged the camera into the ethernet and just hit the wizard and it was up in seconds.  No static IP, port forwarding scariness.  Done.  To get the preferences set up I invested about a half an hour.  You need to navigate into the device via the web after you get an account set up.  I punched in my wireless network info and passwords so got it set up wirelessly right away.  I am uploading via FTP and having jpgs sent to email.  You'll have to do a web search for SMP email account info, but once you get that, easy peasy.  Audio even works over Firefox, which is something that won't work on Macs in many cameras.  I downloaded the app onto my iphone so I can pull up live video in one minute wherever I am.picture quality is just okay, but I didn't expect much from a cheap camera.  It was up and running in minutes, it alerts me when something is going on, I can log in to see live video, and I know when the dog walkers come and that's what I needed.  My only gripe is that the red IR lights stay illuminated, so in the dark my dog just stares at them, and you can't really hide the camera because of it if you wanted to use it for security.

Reviews.Title: Good for its price
Reviews.Author: mcgullen
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by the number of negative reviews, which all seem to be from a while ago.  Perhaps DLink has improved the quality of this product?1.  InstallationI followed the quick installation CD.  Because my router as a "WPS" button, I don't even have to connect the camera to the router via a cable.  Apparently the WPS button allows the camera to automatically connect with the router.  Within minutes I was able to view video stream from both mydlink.com and my android phone.The first time I visit mydlink.com, the website told me that my firmware needed an update.  I clicked yes and waited for a few minutes.  Then I could view the video stream with no problem.2.  SettingsSo don't forget to turn up video resolution by visiting the settings page on mydlink.com.  Advanced users can also setup motion detection alerts there.3.  The problemsFirst, the password for the camera itself (not for the mydlink.com account) cannot be longer than 8 digits.  These was not made clear, and caused me some trouble.Second, mydlink.com relies heavily on java applets.  If you fail to see one of the many confirmation prompts for those applets, you will be confused as to why the video "doesn't work."4.  ConclusionGreat product for fewer than $60.  I'd say it has exceeded my expectation.

Reviews.Title: Simplest to set up
Reviews.Author: Cleveland Hts Ed
Reviews.Content: For the money this is a great internet camera. I have tried three brands now, and by far, the DLink internet cameras are the easiest to set up so that you can view the camera remotely on the internet using a laptop or wireless tablet. Both this 930L model and the 932L model set up easily using the supplied CD and instructions. If you want a basic camera that does not cost a lot of money and really is simple (unlike the ones that say they are and really are not!), try this camera. My only regret is that DLink does not make a cost effective outdoor camera with the MyDLink feature or one that pans, tilts, and zooms. Will try mounting one outdoors and see how it works...For night time you obviously need some local light in the room you are viewing for good results, but this is not an issue.I have used these cameras successfully with an ATT Uverse TuWire cable modem and a more traditional DLink wireless router that is connected to a Time Warner Cable cable modem. No port forwarding or other trickly set ups by you is required. DLink handles it all, and, unlike some systems, the DLink service is free.

Reviews.Title: Great value Easy set up.
Reviews.Author: C. mccormick
Reviews.Content: Works with mac and pc. Easy set up. Black and white in low light and color in daylight. Nice size and easy instructions for set up. Can view from iphone or android. Picture is ok in low light and good in daylight.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good for a Dog, an iPhone 4 and a Windows computer ...
Reviews.Author: Jonathan McCormick
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a professional computer person.  I bought this camera to watch my dog who hangs out at home while I go to work.  I connect using my iPhone 4.This is actually my second camera.  The first one I bought was a Foscam which could pan, tilt zoom and stuff.  But it required a static IP address and it also made this really weird buzzing noise all day long.  The static IP address was really annoying - besides the fact I had to pay AT&T; DSL an extra $15/month, it was hard to set up (took at least 8 hours on the phone with support people), and would stop working when the internet connection was disrupted.  Finally one day I gave up on AT&T; tech support and bought the D-Link 932.The D-Link doesn't require a static IP address, which saves the monthly $15 and pays for itself in less than a year.  BUT, theres a downside to that which is that you can only watch for a 60 second clip, and then it needs to re-connect.  It also needs a pretty good internet connection on both the camera end and the iphone end, which is only about 60% of the time for me. The other down side is that it doesn't pan or tilt, but oh well.Last but not least is the D-Link setup.  Easy, yes, sort-of.  The first time I tried doing it from a Mac and couldn't get it to work after 2 hours of work.  So I called the D-Link support line which was pretty quick to respond and nice as can be from half way around the world, but they couldn't diagnose the problem.  A few google searches later told me that basically it was something to do with enabling Java on the Mac, which I couldn't figure out.  So I gave up and found a Netbook running Windows 7 and it took no more than 15 minutes and was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: D-Link camera works great
Reviews.Author: E. Edward Mena
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 cameras in order to check up on my business if the alarm was tripped (I get a phone call).  These cameras were very easy to set up, and work flawlessly.  The audio has static, but I can check on the business from home.  If I call I can easily hear the phone ring.  For my purposes, they are great!!  In fact,  I'm goin to buy 2 more.  I wish that you could pan the cameras,  but this is the only problem.

Reviews.Title: The camera does what its supposed to, but not impressed with this solution for viewing the feed
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: I picked up one of these cameras to act as a baby monitor for when we're downstairs or outside while the kid is asleep.  To be honest, the camera works well, it clicks over to infrared mode in low light automatically, it picks up amazing detail in pitch dark using only 4 LEDS, and I'm happy with the quality.The setup was not quite as easy as the instructions make it out to be, but the instructions also assume your network is simple, right out of the box.  I've very security minded so I don't broadcast my SSID, I filter my MAC addresses, and I have  a complex password so the WPS configuration did not correctly create the connection to the camera. I had to wind up doing the config manually but to me it isn't a big deal. I had to hard-wire it initially to get it to connect but once I got in the camera the setup was pretty easy and it worked right away.Here is my only complaint with the product thus far.  I'm a Mac user so I had to download a separate installer because the OS X software didn't come with it, not a big deal, BUT....in order to view the feed on my Mac, I had to create an account on mydlink.com and I have to log in to see it.  The camera automatically streams out to the internet, so I have to go out to the internet to view a local feed in my house.  Thats right, I have to go out to come back in.  This is a bad practice since the device is local to my network.  The only way to view it locally is to go through the web interface itself.  As one of the other reviewers stated, it sends the traffic in the clear (HTTP) and I'm not keen on the idea of having a live stream of my house, much less my baby, sent over the net unencrypted.  Theres no option to turn off the feed to mydlink so I blocked all outbound communication from the camera on my router to prevent it from broadcasting.  I like the option of seeing the feed remotely, but security is more important to me so I'll setup an account on dyndns and get to it directly if i have to.What they do not tell you is that the app they have for iphone/ipod/ipad does the same thing, forces you to log into mydlink.  You can't view the feed from the web interface on your iphone/ipod/ipad because the devices don't support activex or java, so I had to purchase a 3d party viewer to watch the stream from the local 192.168.x.x address.In conclusion, the camera works fine, does everything I expected of it, but their solution for viewing the feed (at least on a Mac), while convenient, is NOT secure and does not support local viewing natively.  It would also be nice for them to include an option to stop outbound broadcasts as a security feature.

Reviews.Title: too expensive camera for what really offer
Reviews.Author: nyc
Reviews.Content: Good  view at night but still not panoramic, so you pay too much for a very short section of view. Also when you want to watch through your cell phone, the conection some times and often it's very bad and fell down too much + no good listening.The +: clear video and easy to install, but complecated for install a second camera witch can be connected to your cell phone

Reviews.Title: Great Cat Cam!
Reviews.Author: caR1
Reviews.Content: We now have two of these at home so that we can watch the cats. My wife is on assignment in Japan and it gives her great pleasure to be able to see her herd (4 cats) eating and messing around at home, even at night!  The cameras were fairly easy to set up, although I did have a few minor problems. It is great that she can see the video on her iPhone. Sometimes the refresh rate is slow but I believe that is due to bandwidth.The next one we get will be the model with the speaker capabilities so that she can call out to them!

Reviews.Title: Just The Best at This Price Point
Reviews.Author: All That Jazz
Reviews.Content: A good video review is "Comparison Foscam FI8918W Panasonic BL-C210A and BL-C121A D-link DCS-932L" on you tube [...]It's a close call until the color kicks in on the DCS-932L at that point it is a better image than the Foscam FI8918W.  While it's fun to pan and zoom with the Foscam on such an inexpensive camera I wouldn't trust it on the long haul- and there are several reports of it overheating.  That and it really can defeat the motion sensing if you are setting up "zones"The ease of set up and experience of D-Link really paid off too, no horror stories, well one self inflicted story- mine.  In the set up which is so simple, you are prompted to put in a password for the camera easy eh? yep that's why i put in one of my favorites and went off to the rest of the install.  The camera worked great!  What I couldn't get to was the camera settings ... no matter what I did it kept rejecting my user name and password.  Two days I'm embarrassed to say I tried tinkering with settings, anything I could adjust I did.What it turned out to be and I just got it last night ... the password has to be from six to eight characters ok fair enough but in all my tinkering things it turns out the program will not proceed with fewer than 6 characters but happily continues with more than eight!  But will produce a "user name or password are incorrect" when trying to access the settings ouch!** You can see that I'm verified- basically it means I bought the item I'm reviewing .... but there was a shipping mix up, that actually got the camera to me before the due date, but in doing that I couldn't leave feedback about the packaging and shipping- both were excellent.  Just had to say it- they go through great care.

Reviews.Title: Close to perfect
Reviews.Author: Timothy Eagan
Reviews.Content: This  was much better than I was expecting it to be. Had slight bit of trouble getting it connected to wireless, only because I missed one question. Called DLink support which was equally as good as Apple support and they're great to do business with. They also showed me how to log into the camera from my PC to adjust the camera etc. This little jewel works great. Has beautiful colour in daylight and crystal clear too. I turned all lights off at night and it lit  the room it was in up and especially me when I walked into the room. The room I have it in is at least 30 feet long too. Can unplug it and take it to a diifferent location and the connection stays as well once it's replugged into an outlet. I definitely am buying a second one. Don't really need one really, but I like gadgets so......... I am a Canadian so keep in mind I was talking to Canadian Dlink support and I had absolutely no wait time and the tech was very patient.( I have no experience with US Dlink support) For the money this item costs, it's well worth the money.  I did have to turn the volume down a bit because it was noisey, but hey, the TV was blaring right beside it too. I could hear what was being said on the tv though, through my Iphone. I set the resolution to highest possible to get a perfect picture. At night it is just black and white,which I expected. Still a clear picture.I have always had dlink wireless routers and never had a problem. Ran an entire office off one. And then dlink support was great then as well.I am waiting a couple months to make sure the camera is still working. Then I will buy another. The little program I downloaded into my Iphone works great. I am always showing the guys at the coffee shop how it works.They were amazed.

Reviews.Title: Good day/night video, static in audio, camera settings feature poor
Reviews.Author: 13 "foxytango"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a pet cam for our newly adopted dog. I bought this because it was a network camera at a good price and had day/night vision. It was easy to set up once you have the right router (I had to purchase a new N router). Setting up an account in mydlink.com was simple and is how you would view what your camera sees via the web. However, I noticed a lot of static in the audio. After contacting their customer support, they said to change the audio setting. That was not an easy thing to do as in order to do this, you have to go through your account at mydlink.com to get to your "advance settings" page to get to the audio setting. I was not able to get to my settings page using IE, Chrome or Firefox internet browsers. There was a security certificate problem. I finally got in via Safari. I contacted customer support who told me that they were aware of the problem and was working on it with no estimated time to fix it. Now back to the audio problem. Once I got into my settings page and changed the audio setting down to 30%, the static was still there, i.e. no change.I also wanted to use the FTP feature to send my video to my account at Camiolog.com where I can archive my video for later viewing. That was also a fiasco. The username field in the dLink settings page for FTP was too short to accommodate the long token key used in Camiolog.com which was supposed to be entered into the username field. I again contacted customer support who told me that there was no way around this problem.This camera for the price is OK if you don't need to change the settings for the camera and can tolerate the static. If you need to change your settings, good luck!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for price
Reviews.Author: Gatorred
Reviews.Content: I set up the camera as wired because I could.  In my experience wired connections on most devices are more stable than wireless, easier to set up and faster, so I have no comment on wireless operation. The camera set up quickly and easily. It automatically downloaded and updated a firmware update on connection. It has operated as expected without issue since setup.I use it primarily to check on the house and the cats as my wife and I occasionally both travel overnight. The night vision is good. the camera does tend to go into the night B&W; view in lower light conditions more quickly than I would prefer but the night vision is so good that has not been an issue. I did turn the audio off due to some static on my iPhone connection but as that was not important to me did not do any trouble shooting so if audio is very important you may have to spend some time working with that. That being said the camera has done exactly what I expected simply and reliably. It emails me an image on a schedule I set up. The motion detection feature sent me too many images for my taste so I turned that feature off.Yes the ability to pan and scan might be nice but that would be something else to break. For the money this camera works great. The dlink site for viewing the output and mobile apps are a big plus. My non techie wife happily checks out the home scene regularly on her Motorola phone as I do my iPhone and computer. I wish the image would "slide" on my iphone or monitor instead of just zoom in the center but again that is being picky. I may well buy additional cameras and try the wireless operation in some other locations. I may also try setting it up to record a loop to a hard drive which I have not tried yet.All in all I am very pleased and recommend this item

Reviews.Title: Large streaming data for your mobile!
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I bought one and it works great with the Ipad and Iphone app. One thing people forgot to mention is that the streaming video is encoded in MJPEG only, no other choices. Thus, large data size. I used 640x480 resolution on my iphone, and I burned 90mb from my data plan in just about 10 minutes. So 2 hours of video could easily use up your 2gigabyte data plan for the month. Of course, you can downgrade the resolution to decrease the data even further.A newer model, DCS-942L has better codecs in compressing the video stream. With this new model, you have 3 different choices for the video codecs, lesser data for your mobile for the same resolution.

Reviews.Title: not too bad
Reviews.Author: Craig M. Zacarelli "Woodworker, turner, hitte...
Reviews.Content: not to bad... I dont know why I was expecting more though...lol the sound is terrible so if you are considering this because you need sometyhing that picks up audio as well as video, forget it. All you get is static... Honestly, I have no clue as to why D-Link even bothers including sound as part of this. The video is pretty decent, remember, this is no top of the line security cam, it is probably best suited for use as a baby cam or cam to see whats been eating all the bird food...lol  the motion sensor works very good and it will email you everytime it trips.... EVERY TIME!! Even with the sensitivity set at 5%, Ill get an email everytime ANYTHING trips the cam. Not bad but opening up outlook in the morning and going through over 100 pics of either one of my cats or what ever moved in the yard is a little aggrevating.. but as i said, it works well in that regard. I just wish I could use what ever trips the motion detection for this to trip my DSLR... that would rock!  the live vid is kinda grainy and this cam is not good for distance, its better that it not be more than 10 feet or so from your target. and shooting through glass at night is impossible as all you get is the reflection of the lights on this thing. Im sure there are multiple uses for it but I wouldnt trust the security of my home to this. It doesnt even come with any recording software... at least none that I saw.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera with lousy software
Reviews.Author: Dougie Fresh
Reviews.Content: What didn't work:The very first thing the install CD does is to attempt to download 2 ActiveX controls. I've now spent a couple of hours trying to get past that step in the process, which without you cannot progress further. The troubleshooting steps say to go into IE and enable every setting under ActiveX (which IE and MS Security Essentials complain bitterly about). This had no effect. Next, I checked my AV settings (MS Security Essentials) and as far as I can tell, it is not blocking ActiveX controls. I am also running with admin privs so that's not the issue. Beyond that, there is no handy error message to Google, nothing. And, the wizard won't let you get any further. I downloaded the install CD from the support site thinking it might be out of date but the download behaved no differently.Separately, I downloaded the D-Cam software and tried to give that a go. The "Main Console" software can find the camera but says it cannot connect to it with no explanation given. The camera and the PC are sitting on the same desktop switch. The Main Console software itself it not very useful and takes over the entire desktop -- really bad behavior.What did work:The only way I can access the camera is to go into Windows Explorer, click on Network and then double-click on the camera there. It took some Googling to find that the default username is "admin" and the password is blank (later found this in the manual on page 19). With this, I get a webpage that shows the live camera feed. This page is able to run an ActiveX control but no idea if this is the same ActiveX control needed and not installed by the install CD. There's also an option to run a Java applet but this fails because the page it tries to run is "not trusted" by IE. The same error happens with the Motion Detection setup page. The page "home.htm" is not from a trusted publisher and the control in that page doesn't run. In addition to the live feed, the webpage allows the camera can be configured with user accounts and a password. All kinds of network settings can be made in here as well, like DDNS (for letting the outside world see the camera). I suspect this is what the install wizard would have walked through so it seems I am not missing much by not being able to use the supplied software. The feature set here is very rich and the UI is nice.As for the camera itself, it is very small and lightweight which, while nice, causes an issue once the network cable is attached. Because the cable attaches at the top, it becomes top heavy and difficult to position without it twisting to the whim of the cable or falling over. This can be remedied with a permanent install via the supplied screws but for now I have it propped up with a book until I figure out where it will go. For now, while testing it out, it's looking out into the backyard. Maybe it will spot the flock of turkeys that like to come around or maybe even a moose.The wireless N feature works very well. The setup, using the web UI, was very straightforward. It was able to find my access point and connected without an issue once I supplied the shared key. This is a good solution to the top-heavy cable problem above if you have a good signal. I notice no difference in video quality between the wired and wireless setups.The video feed, once set to 640x480, very high quality, is very good for a 'net camera. I could definitely make out detail in the feed and it would work very well as a surveillance or baby monitor camera. I have not tried the sound since it's looking out a window the sound would not be very useful. However, as a baby monitor I can see how it would be. I definitely wish we'd had something like this when the kids were babies.I haven't tried using the mydlink website and features yet. I am not sure if I will since the big feature, mobile access, isn't available for Windows Phone 7. They have an app for Android and iPhone. Hopefully, there will be a WP7 app in the future.Eventually, if this proves out to be a decent camera, I plan to install this in my garage, peeking out the transom window above the door for using it as a surveillance camera. If I can get the motion detection features working it would be nice to be able to record who comes and goes and/or setup an alert so even while inside the house we know if someone shows up in the driveway which is difficult to see from the main part of the house.[Update]I now have this camera mounted in the transom window above my garage door and I have a nice view of the driveway. The camera works great during the day but, because of the reflections off the glass, the night mode is unusable. This is not the fault of the camera, but something to consider if you need the night mode. You cannot mount it behind glass since the IR reflects off the glass and all you'll see is glare. At night, while in day mode, if the spotlight comes on I can see the driveway very clearly. This camera really works well in low-light conditions.I tried re-installing the D-Cam software and I was able to get it to work. However, the software does something incredibly annoying that cannot be turned off when it starts up. Everytime it comes up, it puts up a dialog telling me that for better performance I need to separate my OS from my data on to two separate physical drives. There is no way to automatically ignore this dialog box or tell it not to tell me again. Given that nearly 100% of off-the-shelf PC systems are configured with a single disk, why would you do this to your customers, 99% of whom are: 1) not going to know what that means and 2) have no clue how to "fix" the issue (non-issue) the software is complaining about. I would also dispute this claim. I have a hard time believing the stream from this camera is going to bottleneck a modern day SATA II or SATA III connection. How is a 70Mb/s connection going to bottleneck a 3Gb/s connection?  Ridiculous. This is just bad design, period, and a completely unnecessary hassle for customers. I immediately uninstalled the software and I'll stick with the view through the built-in webpage.

Reviews.Title: Easy, Simple
Reviews.Author: William G. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I have two of these cameras and found both easy to set up and use. Having My D-Link is a real plus because you can view the cameras from anywhere you have net access. Their best resolution (640x480) is sufficient for most applications and the built-in microphone is a plus for security work. The included software (D-ViewCam) is robust but difficult to understand. I'd prefer something much simpler. The camera itself, with WiFi and an internal server,is easily moved. I wish D-Link offered a model which was designed for outdoor use (or a cheap enclosure) and I wish the image could have time/date/etc. superimposed on it prior to uploading via FTP. But overall, it's a lot of bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Just needs a few minor improvements
Reviews.Author: Book Bear "Bookbear"
Reviews.Content: I got this device working out of the box within 5 minutes with only a brief glance at the instructions.  Within a few more minutes (with a quick internet search) I had it working with Zoneminder camera monitoring system.A few days later I had an issue where it lost all the settings I had entered, but it hasn't happened since.  (Save your settings once you get them the way you want!)You can set it up for motion detection or automatic upload/email of images on a schedule, but it lacks the ability to motion detect on a schedule which would be much handier.  For example: if you had it set up to monitor your main room you could set it to motion detect, but then you would have to turn it off manually when you or your kids got home.  With the ability to motion detect on a schedule you could have it automatically turn on and off to suit your regular schedule.

Reviews.Title: d-link DCS-932L for Mac
Reviews.Author: garden
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras and they arrived 3 Jan 2012.  They are installed on a wireless network with a netgear n600 (WNDR3400) dual band router.  Host computer is an iMac running 10.7.2 (Lion o/s).  Both function well as individual cameras.  No complaints there.I downloaded the mydlink setup utility for mac (ver. 1.0.03) from dlink.  This software package is supposed to work with o/s 10.5 and 10.6 but my experience is that it may not work with o/s 10.7.2.  That is the conclusion I came to after having to manually install the cameras (with good phone support from dlink).  Both work independently over the wireless network but mydlink can't 'see' them and therefore can't configure them to upload images to mydlink.  That can also be done manually if you know the particulars of the host provided video service.My conclusion is that I should have held off on the Lion upgrade.update 1/6/2012:  Downloaded and installed EvoCam (which has been updated and will run on 10.6 and 10.7).  Working with no glitches so far.

Reviews.Title: Where's the firmware update to get wireless working!?
Reviews.Author: F. Mueller
Reviews.Content: I am a happy owner of the predecessor cameras DCS 920 - after now 2 years they all (we have 4 of them) still work flawlessly in wireless mode. The only thing that I don't like is that they don't have motion detection. I thought that I would be safe to simply order two 930L based on my positive experience with the 920s. Bad choice - as others in the review section say - it is impossible to get them working with some (maybe all) wireless network routers. I set up the camera for wireless use while connected via wire to the router and everything worked fine. As soon as it was disconnected, it failed to hook itself up to the wireless network.
