Reviews.Content: My daughter uses two of these for baby monitors to keep an eye on my grandson.  They have sound capabiities too so she hooks them wirelessly to her smart phone and can watch and listen to baby from anywhere.  Has an awesome night vision ability too!

Reviews.Title: Day/Night Camera
Reviews.Author: Nora Loftis
Reviews.Content: I purchased the day/night camera for added home secuity and am fairly well pleased.  I just wish the picture was a little more sharp.  It is a little too pricey for the product compared to some of the other cameras I have in use.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Jaime 1969
Reviews.Content: First I want to say thank you to all of the people who have left reviews of this product.  They were quite helpful in understanding why the setup was difficult.As many reviews pointed out...the firmware on the camera and the sofware on the CD are not up to date.  So to get it to work wirelessly I had to go to the Dlink website to upgrade the firm from 1.00 to 1.09.  Also had to download an updated version of the installation wizard so it could locate my router.  One I performed these functions, I was able to get the camera to work with my wireless router.Definitely not a high quality picture...and has everyone has said the sound quality is very poor.  That being said it works quite well for what I need it to do - a pet moniter.  I sometimes have to leave my dog home alone 10-12 hours.  Now from my laptop or Galaxy S4...I can check on him when I need some piece of mind,  I just ordered a second on for my bedroom...as he likes to crash on my bed on occasion.One last point, seems everyone slams the Dlink support hotline.  My experience was really positive.  They answered in about 4 minutes and walked me through the setup process in about 10 minutes.  Was an out of country support line, but to be expected nowdays.For $35 direclty from Amazon....a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Good but
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: The app only allows a short amount of remote viewing before it times out, getting around it is an annoying process.

Reviews.Title: Typical D-Link
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D. Potter "Ken"
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with the hardware, just the company.  But, the setup disk I received had a star in it and wouldn't run.  I contacted customer service via email.  After a day, they got back to me and gave me a point to a web page that had the setup software on it.  After setup, the product worked just fine.  I went to the My D-Link website, created an account and set up motion detection and email notification.  This is where things started to go really bad.  I started to receive an email every five minutes.  I thought, "well it is just the motion detection being super sensitive".  That night, I turned off the ceiling fan and went to bed.  The next morning there were 123 emails in my inbox.  I went back to My D-Link and shut off motion detection and notifications (yes, I did hit save at the bottom of the page).  This did not stop the torrent of emails.  Then I contacted D-Links support and told them what was happening.  No response.  I went back to My D-Link and double checked the settings.  I reset the motion detector window to nothing.  No help.  Finally, I unplugged the device to stop the torrent of email.  I waited for D-Link to respond to my request for help.  Nothing.  After a couple of days, I sent another request detailing all the above.  Nothing.  I plugged it back in to see if the loss of power to the unit had changed anything.  Torrent of email started right back up.So, typical D-Link - Hardware is just fine, but God help you if you need help, because you sure won't get it from D-Link.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Randy Bordelon
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to watch my dogs when I am away for the night.  It worked so well, I bought another.  Setup is easy and the video is pretty good quality over cell phone internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Setup was Easy using WPS
Reviews.Author: Philip Rafael
Reviews.Content: Setup was easy when I used the WPS button on my router.The picture quality was okay since I'm using it as a baby monitor. I believe the default setting for the picture resolution is 210 but you can change it to 420 and turn off the blinking green led light in front of the camera by changing the settings using the camera's IP address.I can view the video using the DLink app on my Samsung Galaxy Note 2.I'm happy with my purchase and I would recommend this camera to anyone if picture quality isn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the Money
Reviews.Author: William F. Conway "William F. Conway"
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price. Very easy setup. Good quality picture. Color in daytime and black and white at night. Picks up sound clearly.Able to view live feed remotely on PC, ipad and iphone.The only improvement needed is a wider field of view.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: GregJ "gajman"
Reviews.Content: You get a video server, a cloud server and mobile application for a very reasonable price.  The device is a little quirky when you first start to install it.  Given a little time and a couple of resets and it works great.  I now have three that I use to monitor home when I am away.

Reviews.Title: Simple and quick, gives what's needed for remote survelliance
Reviews.Author: Mridul
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for ... It enables me to view my home remotely day/night, whenever I am out for few days/all day I enable the motion detection email notification which works well too.So far no issues... it's been 3 weeks I have it installed

Reviews.Title: CAMERA PREVIOUSLY REGISTERED AS SECOND FLOOR CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Walter L. Geist "REV GEIST"
Reviews.Content: I was unable to clear the memory in the camera so it would have a fresh start. There is nothing in the advertising that this camera is a refurb or had been returned. I am upset that the security of my home network could have been compromised by this product. I am returning the product to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Met Expections
Reviews.Author: Letra
Reviews.Content: This is a simple camera with terrible software instructions.  The camera does not weigh much and can be easily moved once you position it.  Once you connect it to your home network, find the ip address, type that in your browser and use that software.  Avoid the terrible instructions and recommended download software.

Reviews.Title: Broken iOS app
Reviews.Author: BrianSeattle
Reviews.Content: Video works fine, but the sound only works when played through headphones when used with a brand new DCS-932L camera I bought.I tried contacting D-Link’s tech support, but on the their tech support page, the “call us” and “email us” support links were greyed out and inactive, and the chat support button just linked to an unhelpful “virtual agent,” that just threw up an error message after I clicked “none of these answered my question.”  Sad.

Reviews.Title: Highly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Roy V.
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras a couple years ago, and from the very start they were problematic.  First they wouldn't link up to my wireless network, so I got on the phone to D-Link support, and after over two hours on the phone the best they could do was set it up so it would work on my wireless network but not on the internet.  In other words, I could only access the cameras when my pc was hooked up to the same wireless network that the cameras were on, which is basically useless.  After some more wrangling over the next couple months I finally got the cameras to work properly, in the meantime discovering that the audio quality was so poor as to be virtually useless.  If someone was talking in the room I could only hear a garbled sound with no chance of understanding what was being said, and there was more background hiss than there was actual audio.  An then the firmware upgrades began...I had to upgrade the firmware (the website won't let you view the video until you do), which meant uninstalling the camera and power supply and taking them to the wireless router because it requires wired connections between the camera, router, and PC.  While upgrading seemed to go fairly well, the uninstalling and re-installing took time and effort that I really didn't need to be spending.  Then a week later I tried to access the camera over the net, and ANOTHER firmware upgrade had to be done, which meant going through the entire process all over again.  I'm so disgusted with these cameras that I'm going to just throw them away rather than go through the entire upgrading mess all over again--if I'm going re-install my cameras I'd just as soon do it with new ones from a different manufacturer.  I don't recommend these, especially if you want to hear what's going on the room.

Reviews.Title: 942L model
Reviews.Author: DaByuBoy
Reviews.Content: It does exactly what I wanted it too.  I wanted a camera that would email pictures and video when someone walked by in front of the camera. And I also wanted to be able to watch the live feed when away from home.  It is important to get the email with the file rather then it storing it only locally.  What happens if a burglar spots the camera and smashes it up or takes it with them.  The SD card in the camera or a dvr on a desk somewhere will be useless if they take it or break it. You will at least have the emails with the files that were uploaded right as he walked up to the camera. So far it has worked flawlessly.  It has some very handy features, for example you can set the motion detection area.  Currently I have my camera mounted right above my front door.  I do not want it to send me emails if the bushes in front of the house move in the wind and set off the motion sensor. All you have to do is go the the motion detection setup screen.  It gives you a screen shot of what the camera "sees" then you draw on that screen shot any size box or more then one box in the areas you want to monitor for motion.  Then the camera will only record motion that takes place in those defined areas of the view.  It's pretty cool, so I just drew a box over the sidewalk leading straight up to my door and now only when a person walks on the side walk will it trigger the motion detection. While we were away for the holidays I moved the camera inside so we could monitor our dogs and make sure the dog sitter was coming on time, etc.  Plus with the live feed we could check in on them any time. This is when I noticed the only minor draw back.  Compared to our baby monitor camera this camera has a very narrow field of view. This is not a problem when mounted right by the front door but if you want to use it to monitor a very large indoor room you will not get to see as much of that room as you would expect.  The power cord is longer then the one on our baby monitor so that helps you get it up high on the wall so you can kind of get a downward looking view of the room so you can maximize the narrow field of view. All in all I like it very much and will probably get another one. I've logged into the camera on the laptop, phone, and kindle, all with no problems.  Another thing to mention is two way audio, the camera supports two way audio if you use a separate speaker. There is a little headphone jack on the back. I plugged in my computer speakers to that jack when first playing around with it and it does work. It's just odd they didn't put a small built in speaker instead of the jack.  So if you must have two way audio it is possible with an external speaker.  I have only a small 2 gb microsd card in it and the file sizes are so small (even when the setting or on the highest quality) it has plenty of storage room.  In the 10 days we were gone with the dogs setting off the motion sensor many many times a day and recording short video clips of them it barely took up any space.

Reviews.Title: Often needs to have the power cycled.
Reviews.Author: CBE "cbe22"
Reviews.Content: This is a decent quality camera, but the power needs to be cycled often.  I have this in my foyer so it is easy to unplug and plug back in.  If I had installed it anywhere else, I would have taken it out of service by now.

Reviews.Title: A problem with my DCS- 932L
Reviews.Author: maryann mevers
Reviews.Content: This is a fine camera BUT getting it up and running on my iMac and iPad was painful.  I had to hunt, correct and hunt some more to find appropriate software to get the camera and computers to relate to each other.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Roxanne H.
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and access via multiple sources including iPhone and iPad.  Love being able to check in on my dogs when I cannot be at home.

Reviews.Title: Working for a year now
Reviews.Author: P. Krumpter
Reviews.Content: I have had multiple ones of these for over a year, generally they work well. They are inside looking out. I have some floodlights outside. When I tried the ones with infra red night vision, they were blinded by hitting the window. Even minimal outdoor lighting is enough for these to work well at night from inside.

Reviews.Title: Easy camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: Good quality and easy setup.  An attractive camera which fit the bill nicely. Only limiter is the short power cord.

Reviews.Title: Sooo much easier to setup the the Belkin!!!
Reviews.Author: Paxinbel
Reviews.Content: I bought a belkin and it was a pain in the butt to set up.  You have to set up a 3rd party ip redirect, etc etc.  took for ever and a pain.  The d-link was super simple.  Basically put in your email and it set everything up for you on a d-link site.  The picture quality is not great but works fine.  For the price and easy of use it's a great product

Reviews.Title: Average Camera with so-so optics
Reviews.Author: Anthony O.
Reviews.Content: Overall I have not been to pleased with the D Link DCS 932L Camera and will more than likely return it.  Main reason the optics when using the night vision produce a line that pans the screen.  I have played around with the video and image settings but have not been able to get rid of it.  Also the sensor is not sensitive enough to detect light and will place the camera in night mode even though there is enough light.  So to deal with that issue I have to place the camera on a schedule.  Depending on what you are viewing.  I currently have mine in my breezeway.  But before that I had it pointing outside and found the colors to be a bit "grey washed"  The colors were just not that clear.Overall the camera is easy to setup.  The wireless distance works well.  It has many good features.  Motion detection, Mail forwarding, FTP.  Those are the positive points of the camera.I would recommend that for an extra $10 (Current pricing) to go with the D Link DCS 933L.  The optics are a bit better.  You get more features.  Sound detection, video, h-264 compression,

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter
Reviews.Content: D-link cameras are good quality, they offer a range of settings and features. If you are looking into buying an Ip camera, purchase a D-link over the cheap off brand ones. Setup can be confusing, but I figured it out. If you need any help D-link is always glad to help.... This is a good camera, but buy the night vision camera over this one.

Reviews.Title: Too many Compatibility Issues
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Too many compatibility issues related to Java across multiple browsers. I plan to return or exchange my purchase. If you are a teckie and do not mind spending time with Tech support....go for it.

Reviews.Title: Great Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera. I will tell you i am very impressed. I had trouble setting it up. I called dlink technical support. They walked me though it. It has great picture. Dlink website is great too for viewing your camera. Also the app for cell phone works great too. Anyone tells you this camera is not any good. There working for another brand putting this camera down. This is the best thing! ! ! I have seen. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not great.
Reviews.Author: Gower
Reviews.Content: Setup of the camera is pretty simple. If you know how to get to your router admin page to see the IP address of the camera, it's super simple to just go direct to the camera setup pages via it's address. Image quality is good when light is good. Image quality has static/lines when in low light conditions. Infrared doesn't illuminate much. Overall, not bad for a cheap IP camera,

Reviews.Title: Limited use
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: Can't record anything.  Had to buy a different router to set it up.  Yes I am a novice.  Does have good picture.  Micrphone doesn't pick up as well as I would like.  Have a second one and yet to get it connected to the network.  The one button setup not quite that.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up, quality lacking
Reviews.Author: RMC
Reviews.Content: Easy set up and picture seems sufficient. Wish that the picture quality was better. I have it hard wired to the router to avoid any signal loss, but image quality still grainy.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: S. Murphy "captainstevo"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I had no problem setting it up with WPS. I tried putting it in my front window but the 4 red LEDs reflected back at night and washed out the pic. I build a cedar birdhouse and mounted it inside then installed it under the eave of my front porch and it points at my sidewalk. The only issue is that you can see the 4 red LED's inside the bird house at night. Be sure to set up your dLink account because you can really set it up easily. I finally got the settings right by using only 2 lower motion grids left and right and set the sensivity to 10%. It only picks up people walking by my house and it emasls me 6 pics of every action.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: FNik
Reviews.Content: The camera works as advertised. The audio is at times not that good, but good enough when using as a baby monitor to hear if your child is crying or moving about. The video is good and works well in both day and night. I would purchase another one again and will be doing so today - that's what brought me to the product page and to write this review.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with purchase
Reviews.Author: Poncho Wong
Reviews.Content: Does what it's expected to do. It allows to configure things like day or night vision, motion detection, alerts by automatically sending emails, local time/date, admin password, etc. With its software (downloadable from internet) and an ethernet cable (included) connected to the modem or router, you can set it ready to go. This is a static (doesn't tilt or rotate) camera, but it served the purpose which I bought it for.Note: if you don't have physical access to the modem, but you have a computer connected to it via wireless, the camera can be connected too. Just do all the configuration from the computer and using the downloadable software (so I did and worded). Another thing I like to mention is that, if you are a techie or like to explore alternatives, you can skip the dlink account creation, and set the router (if it allows you to) so you can access the camera from anywhere, let's say from your workplace.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Gadget
Reviews.Author: MamaLil
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I've had it for a weeks now, and I've not had any issues. It gives  agreat picture. I am very glad that I bought it.Install was fairly easy. I did not give it 5 stars because it was not easy to set up the day and time. The instructions were not clear enough. I finally figured out that the process was similar to access your router. I had to enter its IP address.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money and more
Reviews.Author: Dave B-35405 "hi sir hi"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the money, easy to setup and looks OK when viewing with the remote software on my Cell Phone. Here is a tip tho.. When you setup this camera use the CD that  comes with the camera. The App that you can download for setup doesn't work as good as the CD that comes with the camera. After useing this camera for two days I bought another one.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Logan Rollo "Logan"
Reviews.Content: Camera connect easily, but drops signal when viewed with an older Android device. I plan to buy a few more.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: David C wehunt
Reviews.Content: Does what I needed.  However instructions are not very clear and need to set up camera separately from internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Adriano
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that I can monitor my home from anywhere and did not have to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera
Reviews.Author: S. Richards
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with this purchase.Pros:Very easy to useDecent video qualityExcellent priceSoftware and app for iPhone is better than I expectedCons:Short AC adapter cord (You'll have to place VERY close to an outlet or use extension cord)no PoE (See above)wish it had a wider viewing angle. (I next bought the Dlink DCS-5020L which does have a wide angle lens, much better!!)

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for dcs 932l

Reviews.Title: Had some issues with this camera too at first like others did.
Reviews.Author: CyberSaver
Reviews.Content: But Amazon came to the rescue, and actually  got a rep on the phone at D-Link while I was on the line with Amazon. Thanks Amazon, kudos! Because I could never get through to them before that! One time I got through, and they put me on hold for over an hour playing that horrible audio tape! I finally hung up and contacted Amazon. OK, after that call, and that day and once I had a reference number with D-Link,  I was magically and luckily able to get through to them and get some  actual help sometimes (there seems to be a trick on what time of day you call them). One time a rep there (in India I guess?) seemed totally clueless of my issues, nor was he much help. The communication on his part was very bad. I then got a female rep there who was a lot more educated on the system and more aware, and nicer. She was the one who helped me get my cameras up and running.  So to make a long story short, the cameras are up and running nicely, (for now).  With a clear picture. Yeah! Hooray! But I don't really want to get excited too soon. Had another maker camera die on me in less than a year! Oh, and I still haven't been able to get the D-Link app on my smart phone. Guess I'll be calling D-Link back again for that matter. Anyway, good luck with your D-Link cameras too buyers.  :>)

Reviews.Content: Can't get it to work with the update Windows 8.1.  Anyone know how to fix?  Do I blame Windows 8.1 or D-Link?

Reviews.Title: works but can't see video outside my home
Reviews.Author: MikeNewark "Mike"
Reviews.Content: It works, when i'm on my local wifi network, but if i try to access via my iphone, can't see video or connect. Setup was difficult.

Reviews.Title: Captures a great picture.
Reviews.Author: W. Shirkey Jr.
Reviews.Content: Easy setup and the phone app allows you to check in on things. I haven't recorded to the cloud - a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: warranty
Reviews.Author: Carlos Garcia
Reviews.Content: Good afternoon, when I was updating the firmware of the camera the process was interrupted, and the camera does not connect, have warranty?

Reviews.Title: good value camera
Reviews.Author: cooper
Reviews.Content: I had difficulty hooking this up wirelessly at first, but then followed the advice offered by others posting reviews for this camera. I logged into my Netgear router and it had a wps button I could push on the computer monitor screen, and then I pushed the one on the camera within 10 seconds and the wifi synced up right away. Wish I had of tried that first. The app works great! I downloaded it on my android phone. I can check in and see what's going on at home anytime I want. The pictures are pretty clear and I can adjust them using the mydink website. I also have the motion detector set so that I receive 6 screen shots by email whenever movement activates the camera. I can adjust when I want these sent. That's pretty handy! I like this camera and ordered a second one.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality u get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Hondagal
Reviews.Content: The quality and sound is very poor and there is no recording optionLike they say you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: Monitor
Reviews.Author: MBurk
Reviews.Content: Needed this to keep track of our dog.  Works wonderfully in both day and night. Would recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless camera works well
Reviews.Author: William Fernihough "billfern"
Reviews.Content: Installed the Camera a week or two after receipt, and it was pretty easy.  I already had another one installed, and this fit nicely into the overall software package and install procedure was much the same.  I like the IPhone app, as I can let the camera sit in the dark in daytime mode, without the red infrared lights blaring, but turn on the night time mode briefly to see what is going on, then turn it off again.  Nice feature. It only shows black and white on my computer in night mode, but that is ok.  I like the colour.  But one thing I really liked is the easy set up and service by D-Link to provide a service to let you look at this one the internet anywhere you are almost.  I have set up other IP cameras and had to go through port forwarding, issues with DDNS servers, but not with this manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Easy hook up.
Reviews.Author: john brandt
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these cameras. They work great. However I have never gotten the 2 way audio to work. Haven't had time to call tech support. Since it is on all of them it can't be the camera. It's me.  I highly recommend them. The only negative is that updates must be with the camera hard wired to the network. You will be nagged until you do the updates.

Reviews.Title: It works!! Easy set up
Reviews.Author: IcarusNYC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this so I could see my office sales floor when I'm out.We are using the wireless not the wired.Pros:It was easy to setup.The picture is clear during the day and I just checked it out during the night and it looks fine.smallCons:The mydlink.com is annoying. It's a known problem with Java where you get a pop up 3 or 4 times to click ok. If you google it you will see others have had it. Big deal, you click it three of four times and you can see your camera.Waiting a week and if it's good buying another.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive camera does its job
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine. The audio quality is less than ideal and it seems to be a issue across many d-link models w/ no solution.Pro:Very easy to setup (had to be wire to the router for the initial setup)Does not require a computer for storage(I set it to upload to online cloud cam storage via ftp)This is probably the cheapest nanny cam solution anyone can find - many others are 3~5x the price.ConsThere's a constant static in the audio feed, especially noticeable when the room is quiet. Doesn't seem to be a defective product, as many online users complained about this and no solution could be found.Wish listWould like to have a even wider viewing angle - I put it to a corner of the room, there's a 20-30 degrees blind spot.There's a LED indicator on the front. It's usually solid green and blinks when I'm viewing live feed on mydlink.com. This is a bit annoying and especially if you want it to be somewhat concealed. I wish there's a way to disable the LED lights (in the end I covered the LED w/ couple layers of stickers).Overall, if you just want to monitor daytime activity in the house (nanny, burglary, etc.) then this will do the job just fine at a fraction of the cost of higher end models.

Even in bright light you can't make out facial features if the camera is set up more than 10 feet or so from the subject matter.  Android app does not appear to work.

Reviews.Content: web site sucks, but when it ds work its really cool. i like my Belkin stuff better for home automation

I think this would be good for like a baby monitor or something where you just want to watch a certain area for a short period of time. Reviews.Author: Cris
Reviews.Content: I set them up with the help of a rep. for the 1st one the did the others myself. We were away and they work really well.

Reviews.Title: Great cameras for the price
Reviews.Author: Elect. Eng.
Reviews.Content: I have three of these cameras linked to the dlink cam view software.  All three function well.  Motion alerts are sent to my email account. One is in Florida monitoring my back door with an indoor/outdoor thermometer in its field of view to keep an eye on my a/c and in house humidity.Two in MA monitor my front and back door with another weather station in the field of view so conditions can be monitored.The system has only been running for 6 months, but so far so good.All cameras are inside with cfl's on 24/7 to provide illumination.  Primitive, but it does what I want.All three cameras are on wireless networks using Linksys 1200 routers.  All three provide motion control.Camera  Firmware Version 1.06 (2012-08-15)Setting up the cameras is needlessly complicated.  Having to use Java to setup motion sensitivity is just plain silly.4 stars because of setup software.

Reviews.Content: Easy set up and the Dlink Cloud management is pretty user friendly. Built in functions are very diverse and useful.

Reviews.Title: Not sure what's better (yet) but this product stinks!
Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this thing is a piece of junk - I unfortunately bought 4.  D-Link is a huge company however they've managed to hire the most inept development team known to mankind.  The web interface is limited and the setup of the cameras takes forever.  I downloaded both their iOS and Android software and both are clunky when they actually work.  There is intermittent connection once setup.  The setup is very slow and frustrating.  Plenty of reviews on their apps so go look the App Stores.I instead use iCam (paid software) so I can get multiple devices showing on a single screen.  With this software (I'm not endorsing this software specifically) you use your Mac/PC as a host to pull in all the camera sources via MJPEG (to connect use http://[IPADDRESS]/video.cgi plus the username/password).  Then you connect to your computer using the mobile app and pull all the streams simultaneously.If you don't use a 3rd-party software, the D-Link software requires you to toggle (read: initiate a reconnect) through cameras which takes forever.  I've heard great things about Dropcam but it literally is 4x the cost of what I paid for one of these.  I guess you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: Good but some probems

Reviews.Content: This product is great but the manual is not in the package, which makes it difficult to setup.  I purchased 2 camera's at tried to set up both at the same time that was not possible.  There were no instructions on how to setup with your wireless router.  I had to download the manual which is not in the FAQ.  Also there is no information on storage on he website it's difficult to find out how the storage works.  I have n iPad and IPhone and an Android tablet, the Dlink app does not work on the apple products but it does work on the android.  The camera itself is great and the change in day time night time is great

The main issue I have is the web management to send alerts when motion is detected will NOT work on any of my computers mac, linux, windows, using ie, safari, firefox, opera, chrome, or seamonkey..If you just want to view, and don't want proactive alerts, this is a decent camera.

Reviews.Title: Three fatal flaws make this unusable
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Despite this being a very inexpensive camera, I expected more from D-LINK. The first issue is the apparent lack of filtering in the line from the CMOS sensor. If you google for "d-link dcs-931 horizontal lines" you will find lots of reports (and sample images) of some really bad horizontal line noise in everyone's pictures. You'll also find a writeup from an electronics tech that opened his camera and discovered that D-LINK's poor design left out a filter capacitor several revisions ago and hasn't resolved the issue since. The technician added a cap to his (voiding his warranty) and it cleared the image right up. I'm not interested in having to modify all my cameras to be right, so, it's on its way back.The next issue is the day/night sensitivity. The camera can be placed in always-day or always-night mode, but that's silly. The camera can also detect day or night conditions and switch appropriately. The benefit there is that you have color during the day, and only switch to black-and-white at night. However, this camera's sensor is poorly calibrated and it thinks it is night time unless it's in direct sunlight. This makes it nearly useless for anything indoors, even though forcing it to day mode yields a perfectly usable image in fairly low light.The final issue is related to the above. This camera has a mechanical IR filter which improves color response during the day time (when the camera thinks it's daytime). However, the filter must be physically moved into and out of position when switching from daytime to night time. On this camera, that results in a loud CLICK sound each time it moves. This is so noisy that I could never put this camera in or near living areas because during the transition from day to night (or, because of the above issue, the transition from direct sun to indirect), the camera makes a click. Sometimes this will click back and forth for a long time until it's finally dark enough to stay dark.Overall, really not impressed by D-LINK's offering here. I have other Foscam cameras already and will continue to expand my system with those. This D-LINK is going back.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Klarice
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the previous reviews, I was actually a little nervous about making this purchase but at $50.00 on Black Friday and Amazon's return policies I couldn't help myself.  Recieved the item two days earlier than originally estimated and in great shape.  Keep in mind I am in no way a tech geek.  Other than my extreme love of gadgets, I have no tech training and my only experience is playing around with my smartphone and tablet.  I had my "Puppy Cam" up and running in about fifteen minutes using the Wizard on a laptop running Windows7.  It performs well and is worth every penny.  I love it so much that I just placed an order for a second "Kitty Cam".

Reviews.Title: All good but Wifi.
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: Good image quality,, easy to mount, worked great wired, Wireless was very dodgy. My older version of this camera the dcs 920 had none of the wireless issues this one did. For my needs it was a big enough issue I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but not for any distance
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This camera would be great in a livingroom or bedroom if you just needed the ability to monitor it.  BUT... it is absolutely not good at monitoring anything through a window or outside on a patio.  It doesn't have the range. The 5010 model with tilt/pan/zoom has a higher resolution and can see WAY further utilizing it's IR lights at night.  Oh, and did I mention that it's cheaper?

Reviews.Title: Simple Day/Night Wi-Fi Camere
Reviews.Author: Glenn Gauvin
Reviews.Content: Video is OK. Night mode is clear. The sound is horrible. The instructions say you need to plug it in to set it up so I did. I noticed it had a WPS button after the setup so I don't know how well that works. I set it up with an Apple Airport Express. Although it is 802.11n, it only supports the 2.4 GHz band not the 5 GHz band. I did not try the MYDLink cloud feature.

Reviews.Title: A bit tricky to setup but works well once it is
Reviews.Author: Matthew C. Grohgans
Reviews.Content: The setup can be a bit tricky. An IP camera viewer application on my android phone was able to connect without issue. An IP camera viewer app on my PC was not able to connect. UPNP is enabled on my router and the port I had chosen (86) was being forwarded via UPNP. There was an additional port (554, RTSP, Real Time Streaming Protocol) that also needed to be manually forwarded in the router. The router is running DD-WRT. I'm not sure why the cameras UPNP did not forward port 554 also. Once added manually the PC app is able to see realtime video.

Reviews.Title: Not made for continous use
Reviews.Author: Seconya
Reviews.Content: This product is good, however after 2 weeks of continuous use it stopped recording the videos then a day after stop working. I had to unplug for 2 days before it would work. I put it down now. I am disappointed. I gave it a 3 because it works well went it is working and for persons who would not require continuous use it would be great.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the price! Woks great on my Nokia Lumia 925 Windows SmartPhone.
Reviews.Author: BenShamil "BenShamil"
Reviews.Content: Great Product for the price! Works great on my network. I am Microsoft user; therefore, it works well on my Windows 7 64Bit Internet Explorer 10 and Windows XP SP3 Internet Explorer 8. I also own Nokia Lumia 925 Windows Smartphone downloaded MyDlink App for my smartphone works great on my smartphone. You also can view camera just inside your browser by putting ip address or domain name.*update having this ip camera for a few days now image quality its not very good but price is very affordableI decided to give people access to my camera for a few days http://24.184.196.121:8181/ username is "nycguest" and password "guest"

Reviews.Title: I SEE YOU!
Reviews.Author: Savvy Shopper "Steph G."
Reviews.Content: This was an inexpensive alternative to other wireless cameras. It came as a recommendation from a friend. Use it to watch the dogs all day log and remotely on our iPhones and computers at work. Simple install. Keeps you signed in. I wish there was more of a rotating mount to put on the wall from behind instead of a post but it works fine just sitting on the window sill.

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive Camera
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: I bought a few DCS-932L cameras for home security. These are great cameras for the price ($49.99). These are very easy to setup. Takes about 10 minutes. If your camera comes with installation software on a CD just ignore it. Go to mydlink.com and download the latest installation software. It's a snap. If after installation you are prompted to update the firmware, be sure to disable your virus protection firewall.On mydlink.com you can manage all of the settings for your cameras eg. motion detection, email alerts with pics for motion activated alerts etc. Also be sure to download mydlink Lite for your smart phone. Let's you view all of your cameras. The only negative I can say about these cameras is that you need to logon to mydlink.com on a PC to turn motion detection on and off. It would be great if you could do this from your smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Buffyisadog
Reviews.Content: This is a great video monitor. I love that we can watch on our desktop computer, or install an app and watch on our tablets and phones. I can even give our info so Grandma can watch too.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Sal Castillo
Reviews.Content: Great for the prize. works great, a few minor glitches on viewing, actually an easy setup.  recommend it .. ..

Reviews.Title: Wish I had gotten night view
Reviews.Author: Charnell Temple "LadyFlyer"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, works in the light only - if it is even semi dark, you will get nothing but sound.

Reviews.Title: Reasonable cam for monitoring pets and home
Reviews.Author: JoWelsh
Reviews.Content: Nice, easy setup and good viewing on the DLink apps (iPHONE, Kindle Fire, PC). The resolution isn't great. I am using it to monitor my new litter of golden retrievers. I was initially disappointed that I could not email or post a link to this as a webcam. However, it does appear than anyone can login to my camera if I give them my user name and password, and multiple people can log in at the same time. That is the only work-around that I found. Since this isn't for security I am OK with it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: jasanpa77
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it's so easy to install and set up and I can use it anytime, anywhere in the world!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not perfect for every application
Reviews.Author: whit1t "Tony"

The camera works just as it's supposed to. However, in order to get a good image of a license plate, the camera would have to be mounted in a position that cannot be attained. So I'll install it at my house to spy on the pets while I'm away all day.

Reviews.Title: Quality
Reviews.Author: Yevangelist
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this as a  surveillance camera, for a baby monitor maybe! Setup took forever and even then it was not working properly with the alerts notifications.

Reviews.Title: Camera - good, installer - bad
Reviews.Author: Charles T Simet
Reviews.Content: Camera work fine... D-Link's install process and "wizard" is almost useless.  The camera will not register with MyDlink portal for remote access like the other 5 cameras did (before they updated the installer).

Reviews.Title: An OK camera
Reviews.Author: R. Traini
Reviews.Content: video is choppy.  And the camera requires a lot of light.  It's not bad,  Just don't expect to stream video from it

Reviews.Title: Not what you expect from reading the specifications.
Reviews.Author: Byers
Reviews.Content: This camera is fine for the basic person. first, It says it will display 640 X 480. That's true, if and only if you are viewing it from your own local network. Other wise if you are logged in somewhere other than your house it will be 320 X 240, which is one sorry resolution. Also, it sets up easy, but don't expect to EVER change anything after the first setup. Does't work with other Apps. I have 4 other cameras that i view with one app, but have to switch to ONLY Dlink app to view this camera. My advice is spend a little more and get a Foscam. You get pan and tilt and MUCH MUCH better resolution. I am sure there is others that work well too. I just have 4 foscams and have had no problems. They are a little harder to set up, but they also do a LOT more cool things..

Reviews.Title: Ok camera, Better than a Trendnet TV-IP110WN
Reviews.Author: Hakan Kisin
Reviews.Content: Good product. Camera set up easily out of the box on my Win7/64 system. The picture quality is also ok with a constant red or blue line that scrolls on screen. Makes it look like a "security camera" and is tolerable.

Reviews.Title: Going to buy more
Reviews.Author: Tim75
Reviews.Content: I got this to play around with. The softwear will suport up to 32 cameras. I am going to buy more for work and around the house.

Reviews.Title: solid little camera but built in lights are too bright
Reviews.Author: S. Pozi "Mac Ny'er"
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for a small easy to use surveillance camera for some time and after all the reviews decided on this one. I was looking to set this camera up facing outdoors while being inside my window protected from the weather. I tested it out during the day and it provided clear quality almost real time video, which was great. However, the night time option isn't so great. Since I was using it as a surveillance style camera the bright lights the camera has built in turn on when it's dark. This takes away from the "surveillance aspect of it unless you're completely ok with everyone noticing that there's a camera since the bright lights attract attention. If you're using it inside it's much better but still the bright lights may prove to be annoying. In terms of the wide angle I have to admit it's not so wide angled as I would have liked. Although, this is a solid little camera it just doesn't suit my needs. I'm going to upgrade to a pan and tilt style camera without bright lights.

Reviews.Title: skip
Reviews.Author: HappyConsumer "justanid"
Reviews.Content: Terrible.  I returned it the next day.terrible wifi range. Terrible server. It can't handle multiple concurrent connections.. no no

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Shobee
Reviews.Content: The motion detection is very sensitive to light. No matter what threshold you set it on. It send many false alarm emails. But the rest is great.

Reviews.Title: Never got it to work.  Required firmware update wouldn't take.
Reviews.Author: Sean C. Carter "LtCarter"
Reviews.Content: I never got this DCS-930L to work.  First off, very disappointed that it did not support 5GHz 802.11n.  I accepted the fact that I would have to run a 2nd 2.4GHz network just for this camera, but in the end it didn't even matter.  To use the camera it required a firmware update which it simply would not perform.  I attempted to run the firmware update from the mydlink.com website on OSX and Windows 7, as well as through the iOS app.  Every time it said it was updating, but nothing would actually happen.  Eventually it froze in a state where it said it was updating.  I reset it several times and even let it sit for over an hour (though it said the update should take less than a minute) and nothing.  I gave up.  Trying to get this thing working was one of the most frustrating new-gadget experiences I've had in years.

Reviews.Title: KITTY-CAM -- LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: young63
Reviews.Content: These are the best -- I have 4 at home to check on my kittens (everyone calls it the kitty-cam) when I am at work or away from home.  Great picture, fair sound and you can view from any computer or smartphone.  The price is so much less than other brands.  I highly recommend these to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing picture quality
Reviews.Author: Toni King
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the quality of the picture and range of the lens.  It made everything seem much farther away than in reality.  Also disappointed that it didn't have an ap for Windows smartphone.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless Survellance Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Leelafry"
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely great for checking the house when I'm gone (used in conjunction with the D-Link Cloud router).  I never could get the software that came with it to work (hence I dropped a star).  Another reviewer suggested using I-Spy software which I am doing. I am planning on asking for a few more for Christmas gifts, and if I don't get them will buy some!  My plan is to position them so I can see what my dogs are barking at while I'm at my computer.  The recording feature of I-spy (with motion detection recording) lets me see what happens all of the time.  The image isn't really sharp enough to identify a face at 20 feet, but that's not really what I'm after.

Reviews.Title: Does not work well on wireless network
Reviews.Author: BC & VP
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to set up. Does not work on my wireless network. So, I had to plug into an ethernet port.I bought the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera and it's way better. The Foscam was easy to setup and it's working great on my wireless network. And the Foscam has two way audio also.

Reviews.Title: Great, simple to setup camera
Reviews.Author: M. J. Klement "mikeklement.com"
Reviews.Content: Already bought and reviewed the dlink pan and tilt version of this. I have been playing with IP cameras for years and the normal IP camera is a long, tedious process to get setup, configured and working. I wanted an IP camera that i dont have to do that anymore, this was it. Worked great, installed, setup my account and had access to it from pc, website, ios and android. Now there is a compromise for this, it runs through their servers, so as long as you dont mind that, def a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: cathya
Reviews.Content: great camera has much better camera range than I expected. very clear pictures. Highly recommend this camera for security indoors

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Humhead74
Reviews.Content: Does what it says it does. If you want an HD image, then buy an HD Camera. Some issues with D-Link and Java, but the camera works great.

Reviews.Title: Setup process needs improvement but overall great camera.
Reviews.Author: Techy Owl "Blaine Miller"
Reviews.Content: This would be an amazing security camera for the low end market if the setup wasn't so impossible for mac and windows 8 users. First they haven't finished getting their mac setup utility programed so it is still on beta and windows 8 didn't work with the installer until i got the one from the mydlink com website instead of using the disc. it literally took 4 hours for someone who is quite experienced in networking and computer software and compatibility and diagnostics. Also the anti flickering setting does not help with the flickering noise of the overall great picture quality granted it is only 480p but it looks quite nice. mydlink is too simple for setup so I went into the cameras settings after assigning it a static ip address on my router. The web portal works if you put java on your mac but for regular monitoring i use a 10 dollar app from the mac app store that works great. Motion alerts are very fast almost instant. The iPhone app is dead simple. Overall it is a great camera for through the window shooting.

Reviews.Title: Didn't get a chance to check it out.
Reviews.Author: SLV
Reviews.Content: I sent it back because the instructions read (This Camera will not work with a WEP secured network).  The software didn't install properly twice.

Reviews.Title: Motion Activated emails sent too often
Reviews.Author: NYGinAUS
Reviews.Content: Overall a good unit and does what it need to do.  Minor feature issue, however: Although one of the screens seems to indicate you can change the gap between sending emails, that field is grayed out.  So i get 10+ emails within seconds of each other when the motion is activated!  Kind of annoying but I accept the tradeoff. Haven't used the sound yet, however.

Reviews.Title: easy to setup!
Reviews.Author: C.S.
Reviews.Content: This was the easiest to setup, I had own several IP cameras, so far this is the simplest to get it working.I'll recommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: Good nanny cam for the price
Reviews.Author: Ruben Dario Hiciano "Music Maven"
Reviews.Content: Good baby monitor CAM. Will send email alerts and take snapshots if configured correctly. The mobile app needs some improvement. I got it for 24.99 and would not pay more than 30.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: heather buchanan
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the camera. It has a very nice picture and easy to set up. Was shocked at how clear the video is.

Reviews.Title: Great substitute for a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Daryn W Trout
Reviews.Content: When our $350 baby monitor died I refused to buy another expensive one, so I got a $40 sound-only cheapo one. It serves the purpose of hearing my baby crying, but I couldn't stand not being able to see him anymore. That meant that he had to cry to get us to come, instead of sitting happily in his crib until we noticed he was awake. Friends of ours recommended this as a subsitute. It's so amazing! Now I can not only see my baby in his room, I can see him on my phone or IPad, even when I'm not at home. The set-up of this device was done by a tech-savvy friend, because the instructions might as well have been written in Greek for us, but it took him about 45 minutes to set it up. You need to have a computer, wireless router, and a phone that can download app's in order for this to work. (You may also need a techy friend to help you set it up.)

Reviews.Title: Blurred Picture
Reviews.Author: Red Beard "Go Green"
Reviews.Content: Slight blur of the video.  Could be lens or optics software not sure.  It meets the needs I have for it's use.

Reviews.Title: Works out of the box easily
Reviews.Author: Drossmill06
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up and looks great.  This model has no night vision which I knew when buying. during the day the images are crisp and of high quality.

Reviews.Title: my security camera
Reviews.Author: Jon E.
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about this security camera. I use it inside my house, at the front door, aimed on my outside porch.Physically, the product is fine. It seems slightly flimsy at the base though - but acceptable.I set it up by using the wps button on my router to wirelessly connect, and that worked very easily.I especially like the option where I set it up so that anytime it detects motion on my porch, it sends me several pictures of what it detected - sent to my email account.One thing I don't like is that in order to change most settings, you need to do this at a computer - even though there's a phone app. The phone app doesn't let you really customize settings - it just lets you see the camera feed. The problem with the computer is that in certain browsers, I can't seem to access the features. I can't seem to use Chrome or IE; but Firefox seems to work. Logging into your MyDlink web account gives you access to the settings - kind of looks like the settings menu on a typical internet router.One issue is that in order to use the phone app to view the camera feed when you are OUTSIDE of your wifi network, it is required for you to use dynamic dns settings (DDNS). It's not that difficult. There's an option in the settings from the MyDlink web account (you'd have to be inside your wifi network to do this) where you can add in information for DDNS. But first, you'd go to a DDNS provider (I use DynDNS - dyn.com) to obtain a dynamic DNS of your choice (mine is $20 per year). This DNS allows you to have a customized IP address which you would input into the MyDlink web account settings to tell the security camera what your router's IP address is (because IP addresses change from time to time - but your DDNS customized IP address won't change, and will always map onto your router's IP address even when the router's IP Address changes).

Reviews.Title: Great Cloud Camera for the price,
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pro: Price is reasonable at around $35 and camera optical quality is adequate ,Con: Setup was a guided wizard that I had to run 5 times to get it right. I am not a computer newbie and this was complicated.  Doable but not easy.  The camera is not compatible with my home security system. (I had dreams of being able to integrate it so that the picture would display on the primary security screen, but alas I can only view it remotely.)Conclusion: Dropped a star for the complicated setup that is required to use the dlink website to view the camera feed.  I would give it the star backi if Dlink allowed you to register the camera manually in case the setup disk is lost or the install wont take on your operating system.

Reviews.Title: Tons of features and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Isaac Lopez
Reviews.Content: I am a network technician so I am pretty familiar with computers, but I like to keep it simple when it comes to my home devices and this is an awesome camera just for that. The software walks you right through the setup and you are able to view your camera from the mydlink.com website in minutes. I also love the ability to send images via email by motion detecting. I have two separate email accounts set up that I keep as kind of an archive that stores pictures every time someone walks through our front door.Also the mydlink app works perfectly on iPhone and Android to view the camera feed while you're on the go.Great camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Picture Good, Sound Bad
Reviews.Author: K@
Reviews.Content: I tried placing this camera in several locations around my house and the sound was always awful.  There was static and feedback noise even when placed far away from other electronics.  Had to return it.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy Mineau
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera strictly because it was on sale, image quality is low and wifi strength is low. only use it close to wifi router or direct connect.

Reviews.Title: very good.
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: very good.  very good.  very good.  very good.  good dollars value.  I got 8 units of it.  D-link, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: D-Link 932L
Reviews.Author: Jehosephat "Jose"
Reviews.Content: Works well as promised, just wish it was easier to configure a downloading system for it. Very good for live view.

Reviews.Title: Simple
Reviews.Author: John Doe "John Doe"
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased with this little camera.  It does what I want it to do.  The motion detection sends me an email when something triggers it at the front door.  My purpose was to avoid the Jehovah Witnesses. I can now look on my phone, ipad or computer to see who is at the door without getting caught peaking out the window.  I get an email when UPS/FEDEX drop a pkg at the door so I know to get it when I get home, also if someone decided to steal it they'd be caught. Home invaders would automatically have their picture taken and emailed to my wife and myself so if we were to loose that battle, they would get caught.  Thinking about getting a second one. I'm attaching a screenshot of the android app.**It was a pain to setup on a mac but with an old PC I had I was able to set it up and get my DLINK account setup properly.

Reviews.Title: Works Very Welll
Reviews.Author: Keith "Keith"
Reviews.Content: Does everything it is supposed to do! Monitors what is going on while we are away from the house. Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: clunker
Reviews.Author: C. Cherry "ed"
Reviews.Content: I bought five.  Four work great.  Number five is still not connecting to my network.  I will be calling for help.

Reviews.Title: Good image for an inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to watch my dogs in the house while at work.Perfect for this use.  For such a reasonably priced camera, it's a perfectly fine picture and motion is pretty decent too (obviously if they run through the room I don't catch it)!I didn't bother w a night vision camera because it wouldn't be useful for me.Sound is somewhat static-y... I just put it on mute...I really don't care about the sound.Love accessing the feed via my iPhone.Set up was pretty easy.  The install CD didn't work for me.  It said I wasn't using IE as my default browser...which I am (and above the minimum version they stated).  May be an issue that I'm using Windows 8 and the documentation says it supports up to Windows 7?But I WAS able to download and run the install from the www.mydlink.com website w no problem.Now I want to get additional cameras so I can check out the other rooms in the house! :)

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and works well
Reviews.Author: Dsinned
Reviews.Content: FOV (field of view) could be better, but otherwise great camera at an affordable price.  I bought 3 for the price of one full feature surveillance IP camera.

Reviews.Title: It would work after tinkering with it
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: You must have a minimum knowledge of networking, especially wireless, to get this thing to work but once you do, you would breeze through the next cameras.  I bought two.  Initially I had to call support (in India) and they walked me through and got the cams to work.  I later forgot the password of one of the cams so I couldn't view it on line; I wasn't able to reset to manufacturer settings.  I gave up but months later downloaded the newer software version, tried again and successfully got it working.  Now I can remotely monitor my house and these cams have audio so you could hear what's going on also.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected.
Reviews.Author: Charles Kwon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a different one on Amazon and the setup, ease of use and quality far surpasses the previous one. It's very easy to setup, has all of the functions I need and exceeds all of my expectations. For it's price, it's one of the best, if not the best IP Wireless surveillance camera on the market.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up but image and sound quality needs improvement
Reviews.Author: MEHRAN BEHDJAT
Reviews.Content: Easy set up but image and sound quality needs improvementWireless set up was very quick and easy, less than 15 minutes.Night vision works well.The image quality is very grainy and from a distance of over 15 ft face recognition is not good.I am now looking for a higher end device with a better resolution.The sound has a static in the background that is very annoying, so for most parts I turn off the sound.

Reviews.Title: Works 99% of the time
Reviews.Author: 2K1Toaster
Reviews.Content: Works most of the time. It has really crappy nighttime vision, i.e. non-existent. But every now and then the camera just shows a green screen for a couple frames, like the image packet just drops and never recovers. This is fine, except these green frames throw off the motion detection causing false triggers. But for the price, I am very happy. I am using it in both wired and wireless modes, I have 4 of them. They all exhibit the same green problem, but then also work almost all of the time. I would buy more if this is what was in the price range.

Reviews.Title: Will not power up
Reviews.Author: JERRY D. BURNETTE
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for 3 months and it will not work. I have tried to call D-Link and been on hold for over 3 hours. The one person I got could not understand English and put me back on hold. The camera did a fair job, but if customer service is this bad why would you want one. I have 3 of these cameras but will be replacing everything that has D-Link on it if this is the way they respond to problems.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: MRJ "MrJ"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It is a little delicate though. The stand broke off an hour. But that doesn't really matter. It does what it says it would do.

Reviews.Title: Image is good for price, was very easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Eli Lilly
Reviews.Content: This was probably the easiest device I've ever installed on my network.  For once, the instructions (3 or 4 simple steps) actually worked.  Once the camera was online, I was able to easily view the output from my Android tablet (Nexus 7), my Windows Phone, or from a regular web browser.  The only setting I changed was logging into mydlink.com to up the image size to 640x480.  The image is much clearer than I expected for a camera at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy setup and install. I like it and easy instruction to guide me setup on my iphone and be able to monitor on my mobile.

Reviews.Title: Great camera easy set up
Reviews.Author: ernest peters
Reviews.Content: Works like a charm. I wish it would store video as well but I see the make a model for that. It gives me what I need

Reviews.Title: Very convenient
Reviews.Author: Ray Cochran "addict"
Reviews.Content: Works very well with Android app (iPhone, too, probably?). Does NOT work very well with web interface on Mac. D-Link does almost all of the video in Java which is extremely unpleasant if you're using Chrome or Firefox on your Mac (or Safari, even, if you've got any sort of security enabled). I just ended up grabbing my wife's Windows laptop to setup the camera.If you're thinking that you will want to use this where it's just sorta dark, don't. Get the better one (with the IR illuminator). This model sees nothing once it starts to get dark. Also, and I haven't verified this, but I believe this only used the 2.4GHz N-band and loses quite a bit of range because of that.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, no schedule for motion detection
Reviews.Author: M. Gordon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an older TP-Link camera that I had bought and stopped working.  The camera is good, the server loads up fast, it's easy to setup and the motion detection works well.  Plus, it's really small, so it's easy to place somewhere and not have a large camera watching.  This is a really good price for this capable of a camera.The one con, which I think could be fixed with a firmware upgrade, is that you can't set a schedule for motion detection.  I only want it to detect motion and send an e-mail during the day, when I'm not at home.  You can't turn that off and it's sending e-mail when we walk around the house too.  If there was a schedule for this camera then I would give it 5 stars.  I really use the motion detection feature a lot and would like to be able to have it automatically on/off.One other minor problem I had with it was that I tried to set the admin password and it would never let me in after I set it.  I tried it twice with 2 different passwords.  I think this is a bug.

Reviews.Title: Terrible software
Reviews.Author: Jason T. Hart "Jason Hart"
Reviews.Content: Why do you need any software to run these things? You should be able to plug them in and then view the streaming content on a web-browser. Fine cameras, terrible software.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Samster
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera after reading the reviews which indicated it was easy to setup and had the features I wanted - wireless connectivity, color, decent resolution and a good price. Camera setup was easy. I mounted it outside and am able to see the scene clearly, take a snapshot and move in and out. I would recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Wendi
Reviews.Content: What a bargain!  I live being able to check in on my household and my dog while I am away. You can see AND hear everything that is going on.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: Douglas Adler "DUG 320"
Reviews.Content: The unit worked well with my Mac but the range is very limited.  The other challenge is mydlink uses java to view the images. Without entering into the huge java debate on OSX;  Apple has disabled Java

Reviews.Title: Java issues - Download JRE (again, and again, and again)
Reviews.Author: J Mhr
Reviews.Content: I have two of the 930's.  D-Link requires Java Runtime Environment, which means it is vulnerable to the performance of the notorious crapware known as Java.  Java sucks.  ALTHOUGH, I have other apps that rely on Java and still manage to function consistently, but I can't DEPEND on this camera because of the software it uses repeatedly failing to just "work."Beyond that, the required version of Java doesn't work with Chrome (blame Chrome, or blame D-Link for not engineering it to be more robust). It doesn't seem to work with Safari either, so I'm using Firefox, and once again, Firefox tells me something is wrong with java.  See below:The Java Runtime Environment cannot be found.You will need to download and install the Java Runtime Environment in order to view your View1.If you ever installed the Java Runtime Environment, you may need to check the Java status in Java Preference setting.For Firefox users, please install the latest version of Java Runtime Environment to continue.I followed the instructions.  And as usual (with Java), it STILL doesn't work and there is nowhere else to go but Google and those troubleshooting forums that soak up hours if you let them.You can't rely on something like this. D-Link's camera is okay when it works but that's of little use at the moment.  To further complicate things, Java is so finicky, quirky, flakey - well, it's just crap.  So installing whatever upgrade it demands is usually a multi-attempt process. Then there's the issue of Java vulnerability to all kinds of bad things, which will probably never be resolved.D-Link is blowing these cameras out now, but they are no bargain at any price if they don't work.

Reviews.Title: short life span
Reviews.Author: Neal
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for only 12 months and it failed. I also had trouble using my Mac to setup and update. It seems that Java does not work to well with Safari. I also did not get good support from dlink. The camera has very low resolution as such the picture was not to useful on my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Paid For
Reviews.Author: FloBoss
Reviews.Content: I really didn't like this camera.Cons- You have to have your own smtp setting to configure the email alert feature. If you don't know what this is then this is not for you.- The motion detection is awful. I pointed it directly at a wall and I got hit with over 50 emails in less than 30 mins even with the sensitivity level set at 10 percent and minimizing the detection area.- The GUI to configure the camera settings appears to be a bit old and looked outdated even after I updated the camera software. You have to enable Jave or Active X on your browser to view the live video if testing from the GUI.-Power cord is very short.- Unless there was some type of backlight the night Vision really sucked.- The phone apps allows you to view the camera and take a snapshot but that is pretty much all you can do. Unable to configure any setting or update anything from it or record video.Audio was not that great as other have stated.- You can't record actual video unless you us a 3rd party app.Pro- You can setup access to an FTP and the images will get saved to the FTP server.- Camera has Audio.

Reviews.Title: Great day/night network surveilance Camera after fixing screen resolution & email setup problems
Reviews.Author: Dr. M. A. Dixon "hyper-observant"
Reviews.Content: Since I love new tech, I thought after reading the description on the D-Link Wireless Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera with mydlink-Enabled, DCS-932L (White) that set-up would be a breeze at 15 minutes.  However, 2 aspects went laboriously long.  This D-Link camera had no problem connecting with my NETGEAR AC1600 Dual Band Wi-Fi Gigabit Router (R6250) with the WPS button.  I put the DLink CD in my PC and chose setup wizard.  Everything set up fine except for email setup so I called my IPS provider to make sure I was entering everything correctly which I was.  The DLink customer service voice answering system said there would be at least a 25 minutes wait; as it was evening, I thought I would wait until morning and hope for shorter wait time.The next morning, the DLink Customer Support said wait time would be in excess of 10 minutes and I thought great BUT a CSR did not come on the phone until an hour plus 10 minutes.  The DLink Customer Support thought it would be easier to just avoid using my ISP email and use my gmail account so we set that up in no time.So now it was set up to email me some still-shot frames every time motion was detected.  I also wanted video to record and in order to do that I had to also download from the DLink website a free camera app for this particular model DCS-932L.  After downloading and installing, every time I clicked on Main Console (the name of the D-link video recording app), it gave me an error message to change my screen resolution.  Following the CSRs advice, we switched around my desktop monitor resolution to various settings but none of them would allow the Main Console to load without the screen resolution error message.  He put me on hold many times to consult with others for over an hour but I figured out how to fix it so their software would load and run on my desktop.  Here is how I fixed it.  Right click on Main Console icon.  Click on properties.  Click on Compatibility.  Scroll to the OS you are using and select.  Check Disable display scaling on high DPI settings.  Click Apply.  Click ok.  Open Main Console software without error message.I like having both the still shot frames from the website and the video recorded through the software.  I found both the website and software kind of clunky and not too intuitive, but I now have very good documents that would stand up in a court of law for surveillance on my property at a very reasonable cost.  I love how technology keeps giving us more options at really reasonable prices.I also downloaded the android DLink app which took a little more time than anticipated because when I searched in the Play Store for DLink app which is what Dlink calls it, I got a selection of things to chose from and had to read the descriptions to figure out the right one for me is currently called DLink Lite.  After signing in with my email and password, it was pretty easy to see live feed whenever I want.I would not hesitate to purchase more of these D-Link Wireless Network Surveillance Cameras and the software as well as mydlink website can handle more cameras.  Now that I got these two setup snaffoos behind me, next time will be a breezy 15minutes or less.  Thank you DLink!

Reviews.Title: Works as it says
Reviews.Author: Danny G.
Reviews.Content: The Camera works the way they advertise it and easy to hook up to your router using the WPS Button on both router and camera but the video quality is not amazing what's so ever. Also make sure USPS doesn't Ship this item to you i had tracked my package since it was shipped and luckily on the day of delivery someone had picked it up in front of my door steps and hold it until i was there, i have lost many packages via USPS.

Reviews.Title: Great little surveillance camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Brenda in TX
Reviews.Content: I ordered this on Friday and it was on my doorstop Monday.  It took me about 20 minutes to set it up and it works like a charm.  We have a little 17 year old dog that sleeps on the couch all the time, and even with the lights off and using the iPhone app, I could see her at 9:30 last night. We are planning on using it outside to see what cats are coming around at night to eat. Love it - definitely worth the $$$.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Wireless Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Abimael
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I received delivery of the cameras. They were in excellent shape and they were easy to install and run from the mydlink website.

Reviews.Title: Good, Great & Cheap
Reviews.Author: NOE PELAYO
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to watch my house when I'm at work and so far so good.  Not expensive. Works great for me.

Reviews.Title: good through internet connection but not through direct link of network
Reviews.Author: ssggbroot
Reviews.Content: could not view directly from my computer, had to go through d-link and I wanted to view from my computer directly

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Monica Upshaw
Reviews.Content: I have several of these cameras they are easy to install and use.  It has a mobile app that allows me to check the cameras, from anywhere. Great reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: kmc
Reviews.Content: Had it up and going in 30 minutes. Worked as stated, like it we were ableto view our home from 500 miles away. Only problem is setting up unit to alert us and couldn't get through to tech support. Maybe later.

Reviews.Title: Very Very easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: Renzo Berardi
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a camera you can watch from the internet, this camera is perfect. I wouldnt use it for anything else though. Very Very easy to set up. To set up, plus it in. Insert disk. And the wizard does the rest in just a few steps. Once its set up, if wireless, all you need to do is supply it power anywhere in the house and it works!

Reviews.Title: Nice security camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Mike Simmons
Reviews.Content: nice camera! If you want to record onto an SD card you need to upgrade to a better model. Picture quality is very good. Will send you emails if you activate motion detection. Allows you to see your home from your smartphone without paying any monthly fees! I recommend this model or any of the models above this one. I have three separate cameras from D link and I love them all.

Reviews.Title: Limited viewing range
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F. Stone "K. Stone"
Reviews.Content: The camera is quite good, but has to be turned to view a particular area and often needs to be readjusted. Perhaps I have become spoiled with the pan and tilt camera.

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: Kamal
Reviews.Content: slow and does not cover my entire room. Missing a lot of features like audio is not clear in my iPhone

Reviews.Title: worked great
Reviews.Author: Matt Falconer
Reviews.Content: easy to configure and upgrade.  Added to mydlink account with existing DCS-932L cameras.  will purchase more for security reasons at local bar/restraurant

Reviews.Title: Simple and effective!
Reviews.Author: Rob Melnick
Reviews.Content: Setup was simple. This is a great way to have quick security system and have motion activated emailed pictures sent to you instantly.

Reviews.Title: D Link Camera
Reviews.Author: L. C. Evans
Reviews.Content: Works greaT. Had a little trouble with set up but has been reliable and works as advertised. Support was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: Donald W. Jacobson
Reviews.Content: It does give me the ability to check on areas of my home, easily when away, the picture is not very clear, but at the same time, the camera was inexpensive, so I guess there is not any reason to complain. It does what it is supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but stopped working
Reviews.Author: SVR
Reviews.Content: Add this to the list of awesome baby products that seem to have a lifespan of roughly 1.5 years.  It's mystifying to me why things are not made to last.  This was a great little camera (bad audio, but decent video) that we had perched above our son's crib.  We got it right when he was born, and it died, for no apparent reason, a few weeks ago.  For the price (which was significantly higher when we purchased it), we expected a bit more longevity.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: albert
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to watch my dogs at home and it works great. However, the next time i will get the one I can speak through so that the dogs can hear me. It was really easy to set up on my I mac and on my i phone. it took about 15 minutes. the camera picks up sound and video. It will play in color on the daylight setting and sometimes in color on the day and night setting, If there is enough light. I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: JuanCS
Reviews.Content: The product is OK. Setting up is really easy as well. I'm able to view the cameras using my android smartphone by using Dlink lite app. The only thing is that I'm not sure if the camera is capable to record, or at least I don't know how to do that.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, But  Odd Setup Issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for it's price.  I use a password manager with my web browser can this caused a ton of problems with setting up the camera through it's web interface. So, if you are using a password manager, I recommend that you turn it off while setting up this camera.  The other thing to be aware of is that you absolutely have to use the setup CD software in order for the camera to be recognized on mydlink.com.
