For the novice user, this will probably not be an issue.  But, for those of us who prefer to set up things manually, this is an unavoidable issue.Also,  the camera does have a motion sensor feature.  However, there does not appear to be a way through the web interface to turn this feature on/off depending on the time of day.  Relaying on the accompanying software may be the way to solve this particular issue.Having said all this, I'm probably going to order another camera or two like this.

Reviews.Title: 10min setup - Works so far
Reviews.Author: tty
Reviews.Content: Wanted something simple to monitor (and motion detect) my front door area.  Setup, I thought, was pretty straightforward (for wireless-N).  You will need Java installed on your PC so that you can configure the motion detection settings.  I have it set to use gmail smtp server (smtp.gmail.com, port 587, with STARTTLS).It's worked pretty well so far (last 2 weeks).  I mount it from inside and thru a window.  It is only for indoor use.The free app (running on my Galaxy S3) works fairly well.Note: I read elsewhere about issues when updating firmware.  I haven't and probably won't as it seems to be work 'as-is'.  Current firmware I have is 1.06 (2012-08-15).

Reviews.Title: Easy Set Up - Good Image
Reviews.Author: Kent L. Weitkamp "kweitkamp"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased three of these and use them around the house both for internal viewing and external viewing out of windows.  The cameras provide a good image and the software is extremely easy to set up and use remotely.  I can check on the house from anywhere via the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for its budget
Reviews.Author: James & Masami Otto
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a wireless IP camera. Have used a Trendnet version before but this is very nice improvement for the cost.It works flawlessly in my garage, and I have it send an email to my Gmail account; and I get a nice ringtone every time somebody passes through the garage.

Reviews.Title: A bit disappointed
Reviews.Author: Deebo
Reviews.Content: The setup process was easy for WPA2 but i have issues using WPS.up to this day. Based on how much i paid for this device the video quality was good. The connection dropped occasionally which can be annoying. However you get what you pay for. It's an ok purchase for the price.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed....
Reviews.Author: Fireman691
Reviews.Content: Got my first D Link wireless camera today. From taking it out of the box, following all the simple instructions, the full setup time was about 10 minutes. And I don't know a lot about electronics. I usually get the 9 year old neighbor kid to set my electronics up. But this was easy....only one minor downfall, is I wish the view was crisp and clear. It looks good but just a bit more clear would be great. Other than that, the price, quick setup, it was a great purchase. I will get another one.

Reviews.Title: Ip camera
Reviews.Author: Moises Paniagua
Reviews.Content: Excelent product....it would be better a the camera with  night vision.I will recomend this item to my friends and partners

Reviews.Title: Good for the money if you don't pay too much
Reviews.Author: Mike Itashiki "M"
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 of these and they work well. Power supply went out on one. Craftsmanship is kind of flimsy, but good enough for indoors. Software somewhat tricky. Initializing the cameras was difficult and had to plug in ethernet directly. When it all works it's good - motion detection emails and uploads pics to my web server offsite. I can view cameras from my smartphone, when I have WIFI.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and works well
Reviews.Author: R. Epstein
Reviews.Content: I set this thing up in minutes.  Had it working on my phone. I downloaded the d-viewcam software which is a little more complicated, but still pretty easy.  The picture quality is pretty darn good for 70 bucks. This was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good, easy to use security camera.
Reviews.Author: phoneguy
Reviews.Content: This was a very low cost camera that works very well.  I set it up in the front window aimed at the front porch and door.  Now I can see everything that approaches the house and even delivery trucks when they pull up in front of the house, all while we are in our basement office.  The web connection and wifi work brilliantly.  Plugs into an Apple usb wall plug, so no batteries to bother with.Good product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: It seems my reviews are always good but this IS a great camera.  The picture is clear.  Even the night vision.  And the motion sensor is a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and reliable
Reviews.Author: Nona J. Podschlne "Noniejean"
Reviews.Content: We use this camera to see our lake house. Only problem is, we did not read far enough and did not realize the night vision does not work at longer distances. We wanted to see our boat from the kitchen and we cannot. I also think there has to be a light source somewhere because we see nothing in the dark. Isnt that what a night vision camera does? Or is it just too far. Otherwise we like the other three we have.

Reviews.Title: Cant beat them for the price
Reviews.Author: Jon Quincy
Reviews.Content: I installed these D-Link cameras in our home. Had issues getting them setup at first, be sure to update their firmware. After I had updated them, they worked like a charm and have been running for over a month without any hickups. I use my I-Phone to monitor them and my wife uses her android and both have no problems.If I would change anything, a wider field of view would be nice, also maybe a heavier base. For the price I cant complain.I am very happy and would purchase these again!

Reviews.Title: Easier to set up than others
Reviews.Author: T.T.
Reviews.Content: The D-Link camera is easier to set up and for the money works better than higher priced cameras which I have used.

Reviews.Title: DCS-942l
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd DCS-942L. Since D-Link released the latest firmware for the camera it has  performed flawlessly. For the price, I don't think it can be beat. I have 32 GB micro SD cards installed in the cameras, and it does great recording video. Works well with my IPhone 5 as well as on the laptop.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money
Reviews.Author: David M. Healey
Reviews.Content: I purchased one of these units from a local store and it was returning just after 4 hours. 4 hours of trying to work with the installation software, the website, and finally their "support" staff. I assume the physical product works, but I wouldn't know that for sure. You have to download their latest install program that never gives you the opportunity to register the product. And if it isn't registered, it will not work. And this is a different registration than the normal product registration, you have to register for an account with D-Link as well. The only available avenue for this account registration at this time is the install software, which can not be accessed in the current version.All that aside, the camera and the router apparently have trouble communicating, even when on the same shelf with no obstructions, only 2 feet apart. It ran through the installation no less than 20 times before it finally decided to communicate. The "support" links on their web site direct you to product specifications. It takes some digging to locate the install download and the manual. The "FAQ" (although I think they left out the most frequently asked question, which would be:"How can you sleep at night after releasing such an abomination of a product?", but I digress)has the least helpful questions and even less helpful answers.Finally, the dreaded call. I'm pretty sure they don't want to speak with you because they make the number difficult to locate. When you call, instead of transferring you to the correct line, you have to write down a different number and call it instead. Once you call the allegedly  correct number, pressing "4" for cameras directs to another department that doesn't handle cameras. After being bounced around, you have a choice of paying an exorbitant amount for "premium support" or going with their plain old "support" who are more interested in collecting your personal information than in resolving an issue with their product and software.D-Link is quite obviously a company whose main revenue streams must be toll support and selling personal information. Their products are sub-par and apparently designed to drive the customer to their main source of income.

Reviews.Title: great little product
Reviews.Author: Housatonic
Reviews.Content: Owns 5 of them, they work very well on wireless, no issues at all, easy to set up and bring online for live feeds. Not great in low light environment but there are other models for that, at a different price obviously, Do recommend.Can watch video feeds on Iphone, iPads, laptop/desktop Mac and PC. Good enough, don't expect HD quality though, not that it is required for such products.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PICTURE QUALITY,GREAT PRICE,LENGHTY SET-UP
Reviews.Author: MUSICMAN
Reviews.Content: I HAVE USED D-LINK PRODUCTS FOR MANY YEARS AND FOR THE MOST PART HAVE BEEN HAPPY WITH THEM.THIS CAMERA WAS ON SALE FOR AROUND 40 BUCKS AND I HAD A GIFT CODE SO I THOUGHT I'D GIVE IT A TRY.HERE ARE MY SUMMATIONS OF THE PRODUCT:PROS- GOOD IMAGE QUALITY, GOOD VALUE FOR THE MONEY, LOTS OF SET-UP OPTIONS AND EXPANDABILITY.CONS- THE FULL SET-UP CAN TAKE SOME TIME, THE POWER CORD COULD HAVE BEEN MUCH LONGER, WEBSITE SUPPORT AND DOCUMENTATION SHOULD BE MORE EXTENSIVE (ESPECIALLY FOR A NOVICE).I GAVE IT 4 STARS AFTER USING IT TO KEEP ON EYE ON MY HOME WHILE ON A WEEKEND TRIP VIA THE WEB INTERFACE AND PHOTO EVENT EMAILING. OVERALL IT WAS A GOOD PURCHASE FOR AN ENTRY LEVEL IP CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Great Value....WIFI or 3G/4G...
Reviews.Author: Clifford D. Main
Reviews.Content: If you have a D-link router with WPS button, this unit configures so easy wireless. The D-Link equipment has impressed me. There is a smart phone application for D-link devices. Alot of creativity in the D-Link software. I can view this camera with the PC shut down, just goes through the D-Link router, it is so cool. I have another security camera with Seedonk, which views my backyard area and it alerts me via iphone with motion detection, at a cost of $6 a month. The D-link camera connection on iphone will time out after awhile, but thats ok. So if my monitored camera sends me an alert, I can view that camera and also bring up the D-link to camera inside of the house. D-link has impressed me so far, with their DIR-605L router and this camera.

Reviews.Title: Greeny_61
Reviews.Author: Scott L. Wren
Reviews.Content: Great for the price.  Easy to set up.  Some previous reviewers had problems, they thought, due to network names with 2 words.....I did not have that problem.  The quality of the picture and sound are acceptable at this price point.  Nightvision is not in color but the daytime view is in color.  I have 2 of these cameras at home and use them to make sure the house is still standing when we are out of town and also to maybe check in on the dogs during a typical day to make sure all is ok with them.  Also have 2 in a vacation home and it is nice to be able to check in there every couple of days to just get a view of what things look like.  We can look on our laptops but 99% of the time we just look on our iPhones.  The free account at D-Link and the iPhone app are really what make this camera a good value.  Four stars due to picture quaility but it is fine for my purposes.  We would buy again fpr sure.

Reviews.Title: Works well.
Reviews.Author: Andy  Washburn
Reviews.Content: Relatively easy installation. Nice features. Looking forward to using it while we're away to check on the pets. Good job.

Reviews.Title: D-Link does not work well with Linksys Routers.
Reviews.Author: K. Houghton "Wisconsin"
Reviews.Content: I tried for three and a half hours to get this camera to connect with my wireless network. No luck. It worked beautiful wired, though, great picture. Called customer support they were fantastic but even though she tried for an hour to get me going she could get by the firewall. She knew nothing of port forwarding.The camera was a little cheap feeling and would easily break if it dropped.Sent them back.Sorry I wouldn't recommend  this camera. I will keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Only 3 of the 4 devices work
Reviews.Author: Jerry Sill
Reviews.Content: I was only able to get 3 of the 4 devices connected.  It obviously connects via the hardwire MUCH better than the wireless.

Reviews.Title: Okay product
Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: It works well when WiFi is available. Doesn't work with 4G at all.  Don't bother with the paid app-use the free one instead.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: A good network camera that has audio.  It has been very easy to use, set up, and customize.  The audio is decent, picture is better.

Reviews.Title: what was described
Reviews.Author: dewayne
Reviews.Content: Item showed up on time and was what I expected. It stinks that there isnt an app for the windows 8 phones. Hoping dlink adds that app to the windows store.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Interested Reader
Reviews.Content: Works great and the price was reasonable.  Feature rich and good quality.  Setup took some time yet this is the nature of this type of product.  It works, simple to use and has good support form Dlink.

Reviews.Title: Price-worthy hardware, crappy software
Reviews.Author: Alexander Tarnowski
Reviews.Content: I'm ambiguous about this product. I perceive the hardware as rather price-worthy. The image is what you would expect it to be for a product in this price range, the night mode works well enough, and so does the audio. All-in-all, I'm very happy with the hardware.BUT... The software is absolute crap! I couldn't get it to work. It didn't find the camera, neither in a wireless setup, nor when directly connected, which is an uttermost failure. Neither does it provide any options for an advanced user. It just doesn't work. Even when the camera was accessible through its web interface and fully working, the software still didn't find it. I might add that I know how to set up networks.I did the rain dance: got the latest version from the site, updated the camera's software, still nothing. Another program from its suite, which seemed to work, started messing with Windows UAC, which is something I don't want as a home user.Regardless of all this, I still think it's a good product. I use it through the web interface and am very happy with it. However, I strongly encourage others to break the software CD in halves, hang it on a string from the ceiling, or use it as a frisbee; just don't put it in your computer.

Reviews.Title: DCS 930L camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Wegner
Reviews.Content: There was difficulty getting the camera to go to Wi-Fi using the CD Wizard. Instructions were not clear as when to use the Ethernet cable. Finally, downloaded the Wizard on line, which is more comprehensive, and it worked. I want to use it to view a thermostat when I am away for the Winter. However am having difficulty being able to read it. Maybe the camera resolution is not good enough.

Reviews.Title: The my Dlink Support was Great!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I bought the 932L Camera and it did not come with the CD wizard so I called Dlink Support. Tech ID AR004630 (May) was great. She went the extra step in logging into my computer and did the whole set up for me. I really appreciate the fact that she ensure that the set up process was fully complete before she got off the phone.

Reviews.Title: When its working...
Reviews.Author: mlandry
Reviews.Content: Works great during daylight hours, at night, I think 15 ft is a bit of a reach. It disconnected from the network, gonna try and reconnect, soon as I have a chance to take it down.

Reviews.Title: best customer service
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: Shelia (AGENT # AR004231) was an amazing customer service rep. She walked me thru and had no hesitation about helping me in any way. I wish that all customer service reps were as helpful as her. She deserves more then 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera
Reviews.Author: B. Muller
Reviews.Content: Have a few of these now. They have worked well for my proposes, never had a glitch.Good bang for the buck...

Reviews.Title: 930L model
Reviews.Author: phylh
Reviews.Content: great product - a little difficult setting it up, but customer service (May AR004630) was amazing. May spent 2 hours working thru all my issues with the set up and orientation of the product. Good to know this company hires well informed, pleasant, and patient techs.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money!
Reviews.Author: Sarena B. Gasbarre
Reviews.Content: This camera has good quality night vision.  For the money it is a great buy.I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: NOT SURE WHY this product is so badly rated.
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: This small network cam works great to serve as a home record. And remote viewer. The setup software is a little unstraightforward but if you are able to set up a router you will be fine. Right now I set it up to send a picture to my home server every two seconds as well as enable it as remote or cloud camera. just to make sure that the landlord will not break into my apartment when I am away from my apartment.

Reviews.Title: Much better with nigth vision
Reviews.Author: FREDDY OBANDO
Reviews.Content: I have the previous model and this is definitely better since you can see very clear at nigth. My only complain is that camara has somehow a narrow view just as the previous model.

Reviews.Title: Setup was difficult for my router
Reviews.Author: Robert E Dodson II
Reviews.Content: Great picture, and easy to use, but it took me over a week to guess at the combination of settings necessary to get it to talk to my wireless network. The range of reception was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: Ok product, but I returned because some setup issue
Reviews.Author: Laminating Carbon Fiber
Reviews.Content: hard to setup, unexpected error, returned but upgrade to D-Link Wireless HD Pan & Tilt Day/Night Network Surveillance Camera,this one a little bit expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Ira L. Melton
Reviews.Content: This is my second D-Link wireless camera.  Installing the software was a problem, what with the dlink software, java, active x, and firmware updates.  As for viewing, it is great especially with my iphone when I am away.  Used the sd card recording feature once, and had problems with it alerting me every 30 minutes , so I stopped the recording. The camera might be too sensitive, or I might need to read the directions on recording again.

Reviews.Title: it works great.. sort of..
Reviews.Author: Adamb18
Reviews.Content: Once you get set it up it works nicely but for me not on chrome or safari (got it to work on firefox).  Setup is not trivial and required tech support help.  The features are nice.  I especially like the e-mail with pictures when detecting movement.  Drawbacks: need to update firmware via cable not wifi, cannot view multiple cameras on one screen.  Have not figured out yet how to limit the number of false positives that generate e-mails.  It would be good if they could get the software to be more seamless and easier to install/use.

Reviews.Title: Works well but older hardware version
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to add to another of the same model that I had purchased elsewhere. This one seems to work fine but I was disappointed to discover that it is an older hardware version.

Reviews.Title: Does what I wanted it to
Reviews.Author: Todd Risser
Reviews.Content: This is nice and simple for the average person. I just needed another security cam for my own home security system I am hooking up.

Reviews.Title: Very easy hook up.
Reviews.Author: vincent jones
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera because it has night vision and it is very clear at night. This camera is very portable.

Reviews.Title: Works great...one caveat
Reviews.Author: G. Singleton
Reviews.Content: The camera works as advertised, though I did have one problem. The install disc that comes with the camera would not load the software properly. It took a bit of internet research to find the solution...download the software directly from D-Link's website.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality picture
Reviews.Author: Joseph Burt
Reviews.Content: This camera was poor in terms of picture quality and sound.  Was hard to also set up.  Could be better!

Reviews.Title: I have 3 cameras
Reviews.Author: Robert E Randall
Reviews.Content: I can watch them on my computer, iPad, and Droid. Wireless means I can put them anywhere and see what is going on day or night.

Reviews.Title: i see  you
Reviews.Author: Carla Sabatino
Reviews.Content: Works like a charm...just wish it wasn't so easy to disconnect and i wish it was easier to record instead of just live feed. Overall..its a good product.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Ian E. Gl "IaNg"
Reviews.Content: I have it in my garage facing out behind a window picking up an image of my driveway. Would get a mix of frame rates from 2fps to 18fps. It would drop the signal now and again but as it's not in the building as the wifi it's to be expected. All was going okay until they forced a firmware update on me last week and now it hardly works. I'm lucky to get an image up for a few seconds every hour.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L mydlink-Enabled Wireless-N Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: Worked fine, and very easy to setup. But the site may down once awhile.It will be nice it can do recording, not just live monitoring.

Reviews.Title: DLINK IP Camera -
Reviews.Author: Vince A.
Reviews.Content: This day/night camera is a good and inexpensive camera to use for a quick setup with basic functionality.  If you follow DLinks instructions, you can get the camera up and running very easily.Unfortunately, you will have to use DLINK.com's website to access your camera which I am not so thrilled about.  Connections to the camera's via Dlink is slow and delayed.  I had and still am having trouble setting up the (2) cameras I purchased by just using a 3rd party app on my droid and by setting up port forwarding optioning in the router.  It was so much simplier with my Cisco camera.My only other gripe is that the email notification optioning is limited.  Either Motion Detection is ON ALL the time or you can set time frames to send you notfications but on a given interval basis only all the time. (ie: every 60 sec, every 300 seconds, etc.).  With my other camera, I can set for Motion Detection during given time frames which this DLINK doesn't offer.  That functionality is useful when you want Motion Detection only during certain times frames such as in the middle of the night when you are asleep or during the week during certain hrs when you are at work.

Reviews.Title: works ok out of the box but not for the long run
Reviews.Author: V. Cortes "fpddragon"
Reviews.Content: has a lot of connectivity issues, with that said the cam douse everything it is supposed to, but after the year mark it started to get very hot as well as drop communications and connection with rougher. this cam gets very hot and i am afraid to leave it on due to fire risk. burnt my thumb on the port on the back it got so hot. i guess you get what you pay for but at 25. bucks it was good for the year.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Roka
Reviews.Content: This is true plug and play. Nice way monitor your home while away.For such an inexpensive item although not HD, it's still clear enough to do the job.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Support
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: Although had I read the model number correctly and used the right connection wizard, I perhaps didn't need to call customer service, but they walked me through the entire set-up and it was very simple! Definitely recommend this product!Re: AR004201

Reviews.Title: needs better quality
Reviews.Author: ashna
Reviews.Content: the picture quality is not very good and the audio comes and goes. I can still see sometimes so I guess its better than not having any camera at all

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Cam
Reviews.Author: ostendo2
Reviews.Content: This camera has been amazing for me! It works very well, my only complaint is that hooking it to my wireless was a pain. I had to call customer service and have a whole process of resetting things done which took a while. Since then I have had no problems and I still enjoy the camera after two years.

Reviews.Title: WORKING AS EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: C. Walsh
Reviews.Content: We'd bought two cameras. Installation was easy with Comcast WPS supporting router. Cameras are working as expected. So far we like them. The only minus is red lights at front of the cameras in the night mode. Therefore, we turned off the night mode to be discreet.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Cloud Camera
Reviews.Author: Solo Vita Consulting
Reviews.Content: Just got tech support to help me with my Camera Case number C6276250. Very cool devise, well worth the money. Tech support was awesome.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price
Reviews.Author: James W. Gerber "Jimmy"
Reviews.Content: This was very inexpensive so it is bare bones. It works fine except that uPNP does not work.  Got blown off by support,

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: joy antony
Reviews.Content: I like the product because a) the night vision is very much useful, b) The recording feature, c) The two way communication, d) Accessing the WLan networks even in low range.The only drawback is cloud network very frequently in down

Reviews.Title: Absoloutely worth the money
Reviews.Author: yesenia florentino
Reviews.Content: after several weeks of research and comparison i finally decided to buy this camera...amazing. and for that prize? even better. it does excatly what it says i wish it were a lil more discreet ( i hit it in a box and put a hole in it but the whole to me seems obvious) the motion detector is awesome maybe a future update will allow for automatic snapshots when movement is sensored :-) overall great picture quality. as far as nightvisioN, it doesnt really work but i can care less about that because i can hear clearly hear what is going on. as far as playback....im still learning how to work with that. overall awesome camera i dont know why the bad reviews. the setup was a breeze

Reviews.Title: Works perfect
Reviews.Author: Richard Lavoie
Reviews.Content: Needed a cam for my business that was reliable and IP based . I have a 930l at home so was familar with the Dlink software and app.Very easy to set up. The microsd card works perfect if i have any question about a transaction I just remove the card and view from my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great camera if you can keep it working!
Reviews.Author: William Oliver
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 cameras and keep having the same problem with both of them. The camera will show about 33% of the time that no memory card is installed when it is and will work on my laptop with an adapter. Also, everytime you unplug the camera to move it you have to reset the date and time. Looks like they would figure a way to have it use the time on your computer to set automatically. Just recently I have been unable to view the recorded video on the card. I shows its ready to play after loading but will not work. Reinstalled everything after resetting to factory default and still would not show video. Too much trouble for something that was supposed to be so simple.  Sorry I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Enough to watch your baby or dog
Reviews.Author: Winston Lee
Reviews.Content: it's very easy to install and it works as it's described.But it cannot record the video. Instead it can take a snap shot as owner's wish.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy unless you have 24hrs to wait on hold to talk to someone.
Reviews.Author: apg
Reviews.Content: The instructions didn't work for the first two cameras, and this is my second call to D-Link. I have been on hold now for 60 mins. for the second camera.  My original plan was to install four cameras on my wireless.  So far only one works.  I just spoke to "Jeff," if that is his real name and he told me I had press the wrong number on the phone and that he only handles old cameras....  I told him I press the exact number that I did with my first call to D-Link but just placed me on hold again !!!  That was 15 min. ago and I'm still holding. I hate them.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price....
Reviews.Author: Christopher T. Cheung "Just4SC"
Reviews.Content: Got this a couple of months ago and waited until I had a chance to really use it before writing this review.  The unit is okay for the price I paid for it.  The setup was pretty straight forward IF you follow the directions.  I have a Foscam and I assumed the setup to be about the same so it took me a little longer to set this up than necessary.  Anyways, I found that after using both the Foscam and this that I really do miss/need the pan and tilt feature so if you think you need that feature you are better off looking for another unit.Here's a list of the pros and cons:PROs:Good network speed (comparing to the Foscam I have) - I get about 15-24 fps (my Foscam is about 2-8 fps)Easy to set upCan turn off LEDMotion sensor - able to select particular area as "trigger"Included software is "intuitive" for meCONs:Sound quality is terribleOnly has one way audio (can only "listen")Short power cord (about 4ft)I'll update this when I have more time to play around with it.  Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Roberts
Reviews.Content: The software for the iPad could be better - but overall it's a good fixed focus camera.Night time viewing is mixed since if you have any light source it bleeds out some of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Wayne Paterson "allpar2"
Reviews.Content: For the $40 it was selling for, a great deal. It takes a while to get it set up properly, and I followed the advice of another Amazon person by hooking it up via Ethernet first, setting it up via the web interface, then moving it out on its own with a pre-set IP address and such. It did not "take" all settings the first time but eventually worked fine. Missing a lot of the features of its more expensive brethren but great for my purpose, which is watching an alarm panel, heater cutoff switch (which people tend to hit by mistake), and, most important, cat food and water. (It's only used when we go away.)

Reviews.Title: Software makes it better on iOS
Reviews.Author: Meddle
Reviews.Content: I have used the Dlink cameras for a little while. I just recently had a son and we use the night/day vision DCS932L camera in the nursery to keep an eye on the little guy.The camera was having issues with staying in "night vision" all the time. Since the firmware upgrade this has improved greatly. In fact, switching to day from night is easy by signing in remotely.The base station is a little light, the nut that the camera head unit swerves around on feels like it could break if I'm not careful.Overall for $50-$70 this camera works and is easy to connect to your network.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Neeland
Reviews.Content: Simple to setup.  Camera pictures are fair.  Digital zoom is not good. Only works in daylight, not for dim light.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camers
Reviews.Author: DMADESIGN
Reviews.Content: Easy set up. decent video and it has audio also.Only negative is the timed link to the camera via DLink website.

Reviews.Title: Working perfectly, except for the software...
Reviews.Author: S. K. Kiser "sandyksk"
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these, and they all work perfectly.  Easy to setup, easy to upgrade the firmware.  I gave 4 stars because the software doesn't work, at least not with my Windows 7 system, but the mobile s/w does, and that's what I needed most.  I use IP CamView app for Windows8 and it finds all the cameras just fine.  So if I could get the D-Link s/w to work, I'd give it 5 stars.  I'll keep trying, and update this, once I try to install it on my Windows 8 computer.  I like to check on my dogs when I'm gone, and it works perfect to look out the window at the dogs, or turn them inside when I leave them inside.  Sound is fine, a bit noisy, but it's not like I need it for recording or anything.  Just hearing there's no barking or crying going on works for me.  :)

Reviews.Title: Not compatible with windows 8 / D View Cam software
Reviews.Author: Johnman
Reviews.Content: Camera worked after minor difficulty wit set up. Tech support calls not answered for over one-half to three-quarterHours. I wanted to use D View Cam software to record on p.c. But was told it's not compatible with Windows 8 which my three p.c.'s have. For that reason and long wait time for tech support , I returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: DCS 932L
Reviews.Author: Vinh Le
Reviews.Content: Just what we need to help monitor the garage door and much better than the DCS-930L.Wireless N Day/Night home network camera, with built-in IR LEDs is what you need if you want to be able to see in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Dusty19
Reviews.Content: Use it to keep track on my dogs. Disappointed with the zooming video and sound quality, but it's great for general use. Could have used a wide angle lense but ok for the price

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Motion Activated Night and Day Camera for Security
Reviews.Author: Gary P., Crispens
Reviews.Content: I bought this to place in my vacation house when we are not there. The camera has both night time infrared and day time picture taking abilities.  The software installation for the camera was easy and only required a laptop and internet connection to program the camera.  There are several options for setting up the camera, that include live viewing on your cell phone.  It will also email me pictures to my cell phone if anyone is in the house and sets off the motion detection. Picture quality is excellent and sound quality is adequate.I would recommend this advanced camera because it is wireless, is easily set up, has night and day picture taking features, and you can program it for viewing and emailing pictures to your cell phone.  All that is needed is wireless or hard wired internet connection and a computer there for the initial setup. The price is more than affordable and you can set up multiple cameras if needed.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: asdfghjkl
Reviews.Content: Cannot speak to reliability as I have only had this a little while, but setup was smooth and thus far works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Nice size camera .
Reviews.Author: Geovana Mercado .thanks
Reviews.Content: It is exactly what I was looking and more I can leave my house and see what is going on my house kids dogs I would deftly recommended

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: MavRick "MrMav"
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what some of you people are doing? How can you have problems installing this camera? It is the Simplest  installation I have ever experienced. I have two installed in my home and they work flawlessly and connected instantly. I highly recommend! Honestly, how could you screw this up :-)

Reviews.Title: not a bad camera
Reviews.Author: handheld
Reviews.Content: set up no problem but really one got it to go with the D-Link Whole-Home Router 1000 for fast and easy  set up but returned it because of  router problem and wouldn't record

Reviews.Title: D-Link 932
Reviews.Author: madavis76
Reviews.Content: This is my second camera. It is really easy and provides a great live view. Good Product for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good product, better than expected
Reviews.Author: mmc223
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this product, I was a little skeptical about purchasing. I found this camera on sale (on Amazon) and decided to take a chance. I am thrilled that I took the chance! I was most worried about setting up the camera and connecting it to the network. I found this to be a simple, straight-forward process. Within 10 minutes of taking the camera out of the box, it was set up on my network. The only reason I'm knocking off 1 star is for the video quality. This is of course not a Dropcam in terms of video quality and extra features, but this is a great lower-cost alternative.

Reviews.Title: D-Link 932L Wireless Internet Camera
Reviews.Author: Penny B. Ericksen
Reviews.Content: I have three of these cameras located in two different states. I can view all three cameras from my desktop and iPad applications, and other than the response time being a little slow on my PC, I have had absolutely no problems. The camera resolution is good, although the motion detection can be a little touchy which means a few more emails than I would like.The set-up is remarkable easy compared to my last camera which was a Panasonic and for the price, you can't go wrong. I'm in the process of buying a third D-Link which I will install outside with a protective housing. Buy one, you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Stephane Richard
Reviews.Content: I have 3 of these cameras. 2 of them are this model and the other has night vision. I've had them for well over a year now. They work pretty well. The video quality is so-so. Similar to that of a webcam. The audio isn't very good and cuts out a lot. It wouldn't work well to listen to conversations but does that job to hear a screaming/crying kid. Set up was easy however I can't for the life of me get it to work with a static ip. Keeping it on dynamic does the trick but I'd prefer to give it a static ip address. The Android software (mydlink app) again isn't great but is functional. I prefer to use icam to view the cameras. That way I can see all my cameras at once + webcams too. Overall I think this is a great camera FOR THE PRICE. At 50-60$, you get your money's worth. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Saved hundreds of dollars.
Reviews.Author: Gerald R. Tietz
Reviews.Content: The camera was focused on an indoor thermometer while on winter vacation. A week into the vacation the furnace failed and I was able to tell by drop in temp, in house, via the camera, that we had a serious problem. Without the camera we would have experienced frozen and broken pipes causing who knows how much damage.  Thank God I bought and installed the camera.

Reviews.Title: D-Link 932L
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Worked well at first but now its very unreliable. Works about 1 out of 20 times. I would not buy another one.

Reviews.Title: It does what is says it will do!
Reviews.Author: Tech Prof "Tech Prof"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this and married it to my DIR605L cloud router and they work. The camera works OK in low light and nicely in strong light. It is not a perfect camera but it does what it should do, lets me see and hear what is going on.

Reviews.Title: Super buy and a real good little camera.
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Haltermon
Reviews.Content: I wanted this to monitor my weather station console on line and it works very well.  Had to work on the lighting for night time use but no problem.  The software is great and I use it on both the internet as well as the intranet behind my firewall.  Can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Setups A PAIN!
Reviews.Author: Nemesis77
Reviews.Content: After a decade shopping at Amazon, having bought many products, this is the first time I have ever had to write this type of review.First, for context, I am a graduate Electronics Engineer and have built and fixed all kinds of problems dealing with routers, Wi-Fi, UPnP, port forwarding, and other relevant networking concepts. Second, I'm only trying to follow the simple installation instructions that came with the camera.The software for this device is terrible! I have had nothing but problems trying to load the necessary active x files needed. Modified my Internet Explorer Active X settings as suggested and disabled my Norton's Antivirus to ensure the my Windows 7  or Norton's was not blocking Active X installation. Nothing helped. The camera was ok as the green light was on and as I had a Cat5 direct connection to my modem/wireless router; the router did see the camera in the wired mode. Also, I have an absolutely vanilla network with WPA2 authentication.Issues:1. Went to Dlink's support site and I could not even register this camera. Do not know if this is automatically done when you run the wizard or not; its anybodies guess on that one. Also, the support sites I looked at provided absolutely no other helpful trouble shooting information.2. The Wizard appears to be the only way to create a connection for the camera to my PC. Tech support seems to be nonexistent.3. After several hours of hopeless guess work I got a RMA from Amazon to send the unit back.I hate to give up so I did some last minute research on the internet and found a comment in one of the Lorex users reviews about knowing the IP that was assigned to his camera. OK. so I went back and ran the wizard (after cleaning up any instances of Dlink on my computer)  I hooked my camera by Cat5 to my modem and LOL and behold the wizard worked! I still had no idea if the camera would display anything. Out of frustration I clicked on the internet IP address shown on the last page of the wizard and HEY! got a video browser.It makes me wonder how difficult it would have been for DLink to have put a simple instruction in that last page telling the user how to bring up the internet video browser!I will wait for a while and see if any further problems crop up before sending the unit back to Amazon. I can only give this product a 3 stars because of the very poor step-by- step instructions provided. Further edits to this review may follow.

Reviews.Title: Ipad app always crashes after about 20 seconds
Reviews.Author: aye4
Reviews.Content: It's done the job for us but could use major improvements. Never got the wireless option to work. Had to hardware it into our network. Also, the ipad app, which costs $1.99 always crashes after about 20 seconds so is useless if you want to use it more than that. The free iPhone app works fine.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Cameras Work!
Reviews.Author: William Watkins
Reviews.Content: I own three of these cameras.  The computer interface is good.  The smartphone interface is excellent.  The cameras have been up for six months, I am able to view them from as far as Asia and Europe.  They keep me in touch with my home and property while I'm away.  I recommend them highly.  Setup is easy.

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Gale Ann "sheltieroses"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to check in on my dogs and home while away.  They work great.  I use the iPhone app.

Reviews.Title: A poor product for the price
Reviews.Author: sspaceman "sspaceman"
Reviews.Content: Although the video quality is OK, the motion detection didn't work.  The instructions are not very well written. I figured out the basic set-up but when I tried to set up the motion detection, I got a perpetual eror message <Error. Click for details> and clicking gave me the highly informative NoClassDefFoundError. Technical support was a 35+ minute wait - no doubt other frustrated customers.  This product is useless to me if I can't configure the motion detection and alert features advertised.  I'll update this review when I make more progress with the set-up, or with D-link technical support.

Reviews.Title: PIR motion detection worth the extra money
Reviews.Author: AS
Reviews.Content: I finaly was able to enable only the PIR by itself and motion detection works better than ever! Previously was unable to select just PIR, it appears now I can, I know lots of other people had a similar issue. Its tested indoors, outdoor testing pending.Night vision is relatively decent considering.You can setup continuous recording options such as dumping files via FTP or download Dlink software to run on a PC. Also software such as Blue Iris is available.Note I had difficulty saving settings, but when I navigated to the IP camera by direct local IP address, settings saved successfully.In comparision on also tried the new HD Dropcam, setup is literally plug and play, video quality is impressive even in standard quality mode, however the night vision on the Dropcam is totally useless due to the dark plastic housing that reduces its otherwise powerful effectiveness (has a boat load of LED's seen when activated, entire ring around camera), its a shame because it could have been great. The Dropcam other advantage is a very wide viewing angle, ther are certain advantages and disadvantages that that brings, user preference.

Reviews.Title: Terrible for wireless
Reviews.Author: Crompton
Reviews.Content: FRUSTRATING. Firmware updates were not working, wireless settings were a disaster. I couldn't get dlink to add the device...gosh, what a nightmare. I'm computer savvy and have set up plenty of wireless networks, devices and cameras, and this was the worst experience I've ever had. It arrived five hours ago and after four hours of cursing, yelling and frustration, I'm packin' it up and sending it back!  Trying to use the wireless on these cameras was impossible--maybe others have had better luck hardwired, but these weren't for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera if you want to check in on the home while away
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did not want to review this product until I had used it for a few months. I bought 2 as I wanted a way to check in on the home front when I am traveling. I mainly use it to check in on my three dogs when I am away from home and missing them. I found them easy to setup however I did use the camera based login setup and not the easy setup disc. I found them easy to setup. I like the email feature because you can set them up to email you a picture at your desired time frames and hours. The emails allow me to see that all is okay all thru the day. I have not had a problem connecting to the cameras thru both the I-Phone App and Android App on 3G networks which I thought I might not get a picture all the time when on 3G. I think that it is good product if want to be able to check in on the home when not at home.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: kajoad05
Reviews.Content: Works pretty good with my iphone,thinking on buying a second camera for extra protection, easy to install.Definitely a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: Dale M. G
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up and operate.  This was my second camera and I use them to monitor the temperature in my home and to view the rear door.

Reviews.Title: works pretty good
Reviews.Author: vic
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to watch my wife and kids while I was at work, it does just that. I love the motion detection feature, it sends me a bunch of e mail pics when it detects movement in the area(when you activate it). It's mostly just pics of me or my kids walking in the house coming back from the store or school.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, but missing one feature
Reviews.Author: Kaz
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a very good product, but it's missing one feature, which is scheduling of motion detection. I want to turn it on only during day time and turn it off at night...

Reviews.Title: Just What I Was Looking For
Reviews.Author: Lonni Curry
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up and works great!You do not have to be a rocket scientist to set this up.  I had it going in just a matter of a few minutes.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing for the Price
Reviews.Author: J. Julian
Reviews.Content: This device disappointed me.  It is low quality, low resolution, and the D-Link portal is low quality too.  If I had it to do over, I would buy something else.  I regret making this purchase.  Way over priced for what one gets.

Reviews.Title: Fair camera for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Mason
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new one but I think it had been used.  I had to reset the sys admin password.  On new ones there are no passwords.  Also this one resets itself more that the 932L.

Reviews.Title: junk products
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It took several calls to tech service and 4 hours on the phone to get it to partially work, never got the motion detector to work.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Arson 91
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras last month, it seemed to work 'okay', so I orderdd 2 more. The 2 newest cameras never connected to my wifi and even when I connected ethernet hard wired, the cameras were unable to be added to my D-Link account with error messages always popping up. After almost 4 hours of trying a variety of different setups I decided it was time to pack them up and send them back. I have since ordered a different camera.

Reviews.Title: wireless bad
Reviews.Author: terry disheroon
Reviews.Content: wireless will not work two rooms a way from router had to run wire to room to make it work

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: flyfishNS
Reviews.Content: I tried the 930L on four different computers - three Macs and finally a Windows machine (because the tech support guy said he "couldn't help" with a Mac). The thing did not ever get installed. D-Link's solution was, after an hour on the phone, for me to take it back and get another one.So, in summary - I paid almost $90 to purchase a camera that cost me three or four hours of headache trying to get it set up, and then an hour with tech support, to finally be told "guess it doesn't work".Sorry - I'll take it back, but this is the fourth d-link product I've purchased in the last two years, and I have now learned my lesson, as I've been on tech support for every single one of those devices, and three out of the four didn't work (two right from the start and one after working for 2 weeks.) The rest of my electronic world works very nicely - and will continue you to as long as I repeat the mantra - "Don't buy a D-link product, don't buy a D-link procduct" !What a piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Chad Nuzum
Reviews.Content: Bought this to put in our nursery for when our son is born.  It works great in night mode.  Only complaint is you cannot switch from night mode to day time mode on your iPhone or iPad.  You have to log in online to do so.  As long as you have computer and Internet access you're fine.I will be buying a few more of these cameras to install in other areas of the house.

Reviews.Title: This wireless webcam meets the need of monitoring my puppy!
Reviews.Author: Zhengxin Tong "jzt"
Reviews.Content: Before buying this webcam, I was in nightmare. My new puppy is housebreaking and we put his crate and exercise pen in a separate room. Every time he made some sound, we wanted to know what was happening, desperately hoping it was not a potty accident; on the other hand, to prevent him from future whining when left alone, we tried not to directly go to him when he whines, so a camera that tells us what he is doing meets my requirement.Got it 3 days ago, the setup is very easy, no cable needed. Just hook the power cable on, press and hold the button and the back for 6 seconds, then respond by pressing the WAP button on my wireless router, it's working!!The camera send the video directly to MyDLink and I could view the puppy from everywhere.About quality of the video, as a big fan of HD, it is not very good for this camera. However, the camera is using home wireless network (with limited bandwidth) to transfer data, the video quality is understandable and reasonable. There maybe 1 second of delay (i here my puppy barking and 1 second later, it broadcasts from my speaker).About sound quality, there are a lot of background noise that you can hear, but for my use, it doesn't really matter.Overall, this is a very good wireless webcam to monitor you pet or even baby. If you need a surveillance camera which enables you to recognize human face, I don't think this will work.

Reviews.Title: D link Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Rufo
Reviews.Content: Once the unit is hooked to WIFI it works greatIf you lose power it automatically resets , so thats a good feature

Reviews.Title: uses outdated certificates = worthless
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: seems easy enough to set upbut unfortunately the certificates are outdated and deemed dangerous so I get warnings about thatalso it is completely impossible to get motion detection setup working since the image never loadsDo not buy this product. Look for something else that is actually working to set up and use as is advertised (motion detection)

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-942L
Reviews.Author: Broggs
Reviews.Content: It triggers too many false times by light variations, (clouds passing by).Could do with a new software that can detect peoples form rather than motion of light.This was set up looking outside from inside using motion rather than PIR.  (PIR doesn't work through glass)Needs some tweeking.Over all, great concept and product, but seems to be running on some very very dated software.

Reviews.Title: good camera.
Reviews.Author: alfredo rivero
Reviews.Content: I lite bit difficult to setup but is really good camera.The sound is a little bit with static but I recommend to anyone .Go to YouTube and you will find some videos instructional .

Reviews.Title: Resolution and mobile compatibility
Reviews.Author: Norman Fung
Reviews.Content: I set this up on a PC.  It worked ok when using Chrome to view on my laptop, but had trouble with Firefox.Had trouble with the Mydlink Android App to view it on my Android phone (Virgin Mobile, LG Optimus Slider).Gave up after this since the resolution did not meet my requirements, anyway.Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: Worked at first, then white-out
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: 1. Setup was easy, based on several good posts here:- setup using direct network connection- no not use the dlink install wizard software- no not use the dlink install wizard software- log into the unit and fill in the forms- disconect the network cable and wifi connects- works great on my Kindle Fire HD using the free tinyCam monitor app- setup port forwarding on your router for remote access (portforward.com has step by step for most routers)- setup a dynamic dns service (my router uses dyndns.com)- login remotely using the provided url (mine is ~ "name-dyndns.com")2. Worked fine for about 2 weeks, then video suddenly became extremely bright/washed out. I have spotted two other posts here with the same issue. I am guessing the automatic gain control circuit went south. It was never pointed at the sun or bright lights.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: Works just the way it is supposed to work.  Can monitor it from smart phone or computer. Took about 30 min. to set up.

Reviews.Title: Good,
Reviews.Author: HUMBERTOA0
Reviews.Content: the remote conexion is a litle slow, but if the conexion is local is very fast. in general is a good produt

Reviews.Title: perfect, but took a while to setup with FTP &email;, port mapping etc.
Reviews.Author: nvjames
Reviews.Content: Out of the box this camera sets up pretty quickly if all you want is streaming video that you can view through your laptop or PC. However, documentation begins to fall short when it comes time to use the more advanced features such as email, ftp and port mapping to a public domain. mydlink.com makes it easier and fast but you don't have advanced control of the camera outside of your local network unless the port is mapped from your ISP IP and doing this could cary by router vendor. The motion detection is sensitive to sunlight so as the sun moves around your house sometimes you will get false positives based on the amount of sunlight in the detection area. I found a 60% sensitivity works pretty well except for at sunrise and sunset. The hardware is excellent and I would give this 4.5 stars if D-Link made the advanced features easier to setup or at least explained them in more detail in English. The manual is awful. Great value for price though and I'd most likely buy another. The iPhone (iOS) is awesome!

Reviews.Title: A good quality wireless camera with IR illuminators
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Younger
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality camera with wireless capability. The IR illumination works well. I have one inside an owl-box and one in the house to watch over the dogs when we're gone. Basic configuration is simple if your router has the auto-config capability. Otherwise, some knowledge of IP networking would be helpful. This was my second of these; the first purchased about a year ago. This one does NOT have the same range as the older one. Compared side-by-side, the new one did not work until I'd moved it about 50 feet closer to the router. The old one still worked fine at the longer range. I had to buy a Netgear wireless extender to get the new one to work at the distance.  Though not weatherproof, it has worked inside an owl-box for an entire year. The auto setting for day-night works well. I would recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Can't get started
Reviews.Author: wbw
Reviews.Content: I'd be frustrated if the software in the setup program couldn't see the camera ... but it can't even see that my computer has a network connection.  In fact, I have both wired and wireless connections in my home, and I've used both and tried both with this Dlink software.  No luck.  The Dlink camera might be fine, but if I can't get it configured, it is a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: No support for Windows 8 phones
Reviews.Author: Thomas W Shinder
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from iPhone to Windows 8 phones. I have seven of these devices and expected support for Win8 phones. When is there going to be support? #DlinkFAIL

Reviews.Title: Excellent simple camera
Reviews.Author: Bronson Goddard "NewEnglander"
Reviews.Content: I've had one for almost a year and a half. I use it to remotely monitor a property. No problem setting it up.  It has been remarkably reliable.  The My-dlink site works well and I use both the Ios and Android apps (free!) daily.I use it wirelessly with no issues (I've recently changed from a Belkin router/wireless access point to the excellent ASUS RT-N66U router and it has performed flawlessly with both.Low light performance is not particularly good, but for the price this camera, with the supporting MyD-Link site/apps is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Only half the features work if you have a Mac
Reviews.Author: mikem1555
Reviews.Content: The software that records and detects motion only runs on a PC, it doesn't run on a Mac. This means that only the live view through their website or apps works if you have a Mac.

Reviews.Title: decent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: briehl
Reviews.Content: This camera does not work like they claim. Easy to setup, but having only the white color is a huge dissapointment. Also, the app for the IPHONE seems to work ONLY if you are connected to wifi and in your own home. They claim it will work with 3g, and it does for about 6 seconds, then freezes up. Also, will not connect to wifi if you are out of your home.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: i bought these cams to keep watch around my house perfect day/night cams audio works fine! i would have given this product 5stars but its not pull it out the box set up and ready to go.....ready to go no where for a couple hrs messing around with router settings to link up cams! besides that lil hassle these cams are amazing and to be able to view every cam where ever you are in the world (as long as you have internet service) from any cell phone, tablet, desktop or laptop is amazing!!! i can check my house while i'm at work,theres nothing better in this world than piece of mind!! dlink is amazing!!! fast timely delivery i would do business again in the future,matter of fact ordering 2 more cams tomorrow lol

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use, Reliable Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob Ashenbrenner
Reviews.Content: Grabbed one of these when I only had a few hours to set it up before leaving house.  Set up was easy, and camera has worked reliably.  It delivers "typical" security camera images.  Good color, good enough images to see what is going on.  Currently use 2, facing out through some windows.Has infrared LEDs for use in the dark.  These work great in that there is no visible light, and the camera still delivers a "good" B&W; image.  Note that this doesn't work through a window - the infrared LEDs illuminate the Window and all you'll see is the reflection of the camera.Software has abundant features allowing you to view remotely (Android app works great), set-up specific areas of screen for Motion detect, email alerts, etc.Microphone is poor in my 2 samples.  One can't pick up voices clearly unless the speaker is close to the camera.  Other mic includes some static.Pros:+ Works well as a security camera+ Sets up on Wireless (or LAN) network easily - no need for a PC to be running+ Has night vision capabilities+ D-Link control software is versatile - clearly designed to support the remote security camera function+ Has been reliable - even after power and internet interruption, it comes back on+ Remote browser and Android App viewing works well.Cons:- Microphone quality- Images are typical security camera images - good enough to see what is going on, that's it

Reviews.Title: amazing gift
Reviews.Author: Antonio
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my first grandson and my daughter loved it, she has been using it to try it out an the baby isn't born yet, jajaja

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor
Reviews.Author: N. HIGHLAND
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this as a baby monitor.  It works great at night, and we can see the baby very clearly.  We have a very old laptop that we have converted into a permanent baby-monitor, so any time we wake up during the night, we can glance over at it and see how the baby is doing.If you're technically inclined, setup is rather simple, though I have to admit, I did not follow the included instructions.  It must be set up using ethernet, even if you intend to use it wirelessly - so plan to set it up near your router.There are a number of down-sides.  The audio is really quite terrible.  It is filled with static and frequent pops.  It picks up noises well, but it is really obnoxious if you're going to leave it running all the time.  The other downside is that the software it comes with is awful.  It is extremely limited.  The IOS app is fine, though it does not include many of the features of the PC software.  The Android app is awful - it is delayed by perhaps 30 seconds.  When you connect to Android or via the dlink online website, it will time out after a certain period of time, and will need to be reconnected.In order to use it with our old laptop as a full-time baby monitor, I wrote a custom HTML file for it, based on the dlink network page.  It does not time out, because it connects to the camera directly over your in-home network.  If you're interested in doing something similar, the html code I used is in the first comment.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive wi-fi camera for basic monitoring
Reviews.Author: J. Puzio
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive, wi-fi enabled, internet enabled, simple camera to monitor my house. I know D-Link tends to be stronger in the home router/switch arena, so I was a little hesitant to get a D-Link camera.The set-up claims to be simple, and perhaps since I'm in the computer networking field, maybe I over-simplified it at times. The interface of the camera itself is pretty basic, but limited as well. Don't the advertisement of offloading video to a NAS device fool you! You need a full-time running computer to receive the video and archive it, not just a NAS device. The software that runs on the PC is VERY confusing and frustrating. However, in the camera configuration itself (built-in web page on the device), you can activate motion control and have it sent still-shots to an email address when motion is detected (prior to motion detected and a few shots of the motion). You can also set the motion sensitivity and zones within the camera field of vision.Night-vision works well on the device, and you can set a schedule by day and time when night vision comes on and off.Video quality for both day-time and night-vision is basic, 640x480 max resolution. Not terrific, but good enough.The device supports sound, which you can hear when using the built-in camera web configuration app, or while using the mobile device (remote monitoring) app. You will hear a little static when the room is quiet. Speaking of the mobile device app, that is very quick and convenient for being anywhere and wanting to check on your camera.All in all, the camera does what I need it to do at a basic level. If you need a camera to support constant video recording and/or prosecution evidence, you should look towards a more professional system. To just keep an eye on your house or small office every once in a while with some motion sensors and night-vision, this will do the job.

Reviews.Title: Great device but install & configure was difficult
Reviews.Author: Angel Castillo
Reviews.Content: I now have the device working as I want. I love the mydlink app on iphone as I can see live video of the camera from anywhere I am, plus audio too.I also have set it to automatically email pictures of the viewed area to a special address. I could FTP them too but email is fine for now.So the device is great, but getting it to work properly, specially registering to mydlink was painful. The install CD had trouble with the wireless configuration a few times and them crashed when trying to register to mydlink. I eventually ignore the wireless wizard on the CD and connected to the device's own little web server to set up wireless. After that I went back to the wizard and skipped the wireless setup to register the device to mydlink. I wish there was another way to register devices to mydlink as I was concern the process for registering them from the CD would fail as the wireless setup had. But it didn't so that's good.So for about $60 I have live video from the camera, plus picture every 10 minutes. I'm definitely going to buy more. It's a great tool to have video from the office perimeter before I arrive to make sure it's all ok.However if you don't have networking knowledge I suggest getting a friend who knows so you can set it up for home or office monitoring as you could get frustrated. Well if you do get frustrated, please sell it to me :-)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: I had one of these models previously purchased and liked it's ease of use as a stand-alone IP camera. I set it up to email on motion and worked great. Adding two more to expand monitored areas. The PC software from D-Link could be better if it would load in a window and not as a full-screen, non-resizable windows. The monitoring screen and the review screens look almost the same.

Reviews.Title: Much better than a video infant monitor
Reviews.Author: overbybr
Reviews.Content: Video infant monitors are great, but they are way overpriced and you can't share the camera feed with the family without shelling out hundreds of dollars. This little camera has day/night function and you can set it up with usernames and passwords to allow grandma and grandpa or aunts and uncles the chance to watch baby in the crib. It also works well for mobile platforms, and I frequently check on my kid while at work. It's just fun to see her rolling around and cooing in her crib!

Reviews.Title: good surveillance camera
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Andrade
Reviews.Content: It met the requirements for my needs. I was able to install this d-link camera in just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Great for remote monitoring of property
Reviews.Author: Johnny Nimmons
Reviews.Content: Smooth and simple installation with easy plug & play set up.  Easy access by smart phone or computer and provides both video and audio.

Reviews.Title: Works now
Reviews.Author: Paul S. Emus "e-man"
Reviews.Content: Sends e-mails of FEDEX and mail delivery guys now.  Had to adjust motion sensitivity.  Had to download Java and Firefox to get the settings screen after being on the phone with tech support.  Also can view live on my iPhone.  Have it under an eve by the garage door and front door, where I can monitor my RV van that keeps getting its door tried that I know from the three honks of security system.  Also my Radio Shack alarm calls my phone and I can listen in, but before I had to call a neighbor to see that everything is O.K.  If you have WiFi on all the time, then this is great.  I also have a webcam on my mac mini in the living room that works with iCam app on iPhone.  But can't get Dlink to work with this free app, because support is limited.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Jerry Ottinger
Reviews.Content: the camera works fine wirelessy only in close proximity to the router. ihad to hard wire the camera I placed in a remote location fron the router.

Reviews.Title: Fairly decent IP Cam, with shortcomings
Reviews.Author: Thomas Simmons "Big Ugly Guy"
Reviews.Content: PROS:Easy to set up. Included wizard is intuitiveGood Rangeworks well with Ispy (Freeware)Dlink also has a "Cloud" viewerEASILY fits in small places. like between curtain and windowCONSvery poor night time viewing (Common to many IP cams)resolution of image lags other cams in this Price rangeSurprisingly narrow field of view at VGA resolutionI bought this to view my front door/walkway. I placed it in the front window, and it's small enough to be behind the curtain. It was important the camera had no onboard light, as the reflections would blind the camera at night. During the day, this camera will show anybody approaching and the motion sensor has activated each time. At night, one would need to have a 60 watt bulb in the porch light. It's easy to find a motion detector that screws into the porch light and then accepts standar bulbs (ccfl, etc) so the light wouldn't be on all night.. I found that this camera's field of view isn't as wide as I hoped, so will likely place this where the narrower angle and low light issues are mitigated.Bear in mind, this is a low cost IP camera. It would work GREAT for a baby monitor or places where a very wide field of view isn't required, more than the 90 degrees or so of this one.All in all, I would buy this camera again. While it has shortcomings FOR MY APPLICATION it would be a great cam for others.

Reviews.Title: D link home Camera need to be banned  | No  Customer serv after purchase
Reviews.Author: Seydou
Reviews.Content: I hate to be the one to say this after using this product line for over 3 years and spent over $4000 these camerasI run business , and dlink was the only product i sold to my customersNow these year , any all my dcs 930 l has stop working wirelessly  .I ve purchased 3 dcs 932L , and i hav installed them fine , but every time the camera loose power or the router loose power , i loose the configuration within the camera along with everyting .So i have to start all overI have spend 45 min on Hold using Dlink support line  . no one comes on the phoneMy customers depends on me , now i have no support , the product is defectif

Reviews.Title: not bad, but frame rate to low.
Reviews.Author: rgarza83
Reviews.Content: I didn't get this camera from amazon but just letting you know my experience. I think its an easy setup camera. The frame rate are at .5 at best, it should be way higher than that, even when its hard wired frame rate pretty slow. I can see the camera on my android phone which is good and you can even setup motion sensor, that sends u an email when it picks up something. <<well that feature is very sensitive mine picked up shadows from the time changing from the outside light so it works too well. You can also disable the LED light on there so no one know there a camera there. The microphone very good picks up everything. even on the phone view you can take screenshots and it saves on the phone.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: j lopez
Reviews.Content: works great!! just as the description.  this is my 5th camera and they continue to work great.  I also have the ir night one. it work great as well

Reviews.Title: Problem with installation
Reviews.Author: Ken Trammell
Reviews.Content: I could not get this camera to work in the wireless mode. So, I returned it. Obviously, I wasn't very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, webserver not secure. 930 and 932L
Reviews.Author: Durgesh B. Kalya "dbworks"
Reviews.Content: This camera has excellent quality and night vision is very impressive. I was very happy with it for almost a month untill last night when I was trying to put this camera feed on my website, I was shocked when I discovered on the HTML Source code coming from the Camera's webserver that the feed did not have any security. If you did a port forward using your router to this camera and tried to access this camera using Java controls ( Part of the code in the supposidly secure page of D-Links webserver or webadmin), wooola! I was able to see the live feed, without entering any credentials. So, if you happen to port forward and thinking that this is a secure camera then there is a security flaw in the webserver that makes this camera vulnerable to web attacks. If you would like to know my discovery and need the code to investigate futher then please contact me. If you are D-Link, please address this issue asap. Thank you.DK

Reviews.Title: DON'T DO THE FIRMWARE UPDATE!
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to monitor outside my house while I am away for the winter in florida.I placed the camera in a window looking outside.the set up was very easy and I had it working in about 30 minutes.the picture quality is pretty good.Not hd by any stretch but on the hole pretty good.the problems started when I did the sujested firmware up grade.while on line I was prompted to do a firmware update by the manufacturerer which I did.the camera has not worked properly since.After several hours on the phone with their tech support they were unable to fix the problem.I had to send the camera back for a full refund.the firmware on my camera was 1.03 when I went to 1.06 the problems started.moral of the story is I guess if you have a camera with firmware of 1.03 DON'T DO THE UP DATE! I have since purchased another d-link dcs 930l camera with 1.03 firmware and its worked perfectly for 30 days.I have refused to do the sujested update on this one.

Reviews.Title: odd software
Reviews.Author: R.Tillery "R.Tillery"
Reviews.Content: still haven't gott'n a good bead on how to navigate through the last software update, support isn't ...well, isn't. Pretty good vid. record quality.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: AndyD
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for use at work to monitor the front door when the receptionst is out of the office.  Simply wanted to hook it up to our existing network.  The ip address generated can not be accessed nor "pinged".  Contacted customer service and no one has bothered to respond.  Returned it yesterday to the store where purchased.Andy

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: I actually was surprised how great the picture is on this. No its not a 400 or 4000 dollar camera,but it really works great and maintains stable connection. It's easy to setup and easy to manage. The motion detector works great and sends great pics to your email of the motion. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but...
Reviews.Author: Ricky
Reviews.Content: The camera works great, and I am completely happy with it. As others have pointed out, the D-Link site could use some work.  The setup was not as difficult as some have said (it took about an hour to get through everything).  My main beef with the website is it will not let you see the video feed in full screen.  If D-Link would give a full screen viewing option this would be perfect.  It lets me keep an eye on the dog while I'm at work (I suppose this isn't a good thing, though, as I get to watch him eat part of the couch without being able to do anything about it).

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: humberto oliva
Reviews.Content: excellent camera!! works great with the WiFi connection, makes surveillance easy and affordable. Now I can check out my stores from my phone!

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: UN
Reviews.Content: Good:Reliable and consistentSmall enoughD-link IOS App for remote viewing.InexpensiveGood ValueNot So Good:Too lightRequired full bright day light for color videoCord is not long enoughBad:Audio qualityVideo delayRecommendation:Better than Foscam FI8910W.Trust worthy company.3.5 Stars.  I am not completely negative about this product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Fisher
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my home. The wireless disconnects occasionally, but you just need to be sure you have the camera within a reasonable distance from your wireless router. For the "budget" model, it's very nice. I appreciate that D-Link even makes a model like this, without the auto pan/zoom and night vision for example, for those of us not wanting to spend an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: Good value and easy set-up
Reviews.Author: backwoodsguy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to monitor my boat that is parked at my cottage for the winter and it does exactly what it advertizes. It is a simple and low quality audio and video device with some fairly primitive but effective software.The configuration worked great. It took me about 20 minutes to configure the system to work in wireless mode with my wireless router, another 10 minutes to configure for remote web based viewing and about 20 minutes to set up the scheduled email so I would get several emails per day. I think the reason I was able to configure so quickly is because I had already done this previously with my Panasonic camera and knew all the settings for the incoming and outgoing mail server and wireless setup. If you have all this information in advance it should go quickly.The physical setup was not quite as fast. The unit has no screw down points on the base and since the unit is thin plastic it is very light and will not stand on it's own because even the weight of the power cord is enough to pull it over. I made a wooden base and a simple clamping system with a few screws and washers to pinch the base of the camera to the wood. There is a limited range azimuth and elevation adjustment and that made it easy to point.The software is fairly limited and will only let you set up either scheduled emails or motion sensing but not both at once.
