My simple Panasonic BLC1 camera is about the same price range can do both and has much more feature rich software with multiple event possibilities so you may want to look into that option.The pictures are fairly low resolution but in this price range I would say perfectly acceptable.The website has always worked fine for remote viewing but will time out after about 10 minutes and you have to log in again. You can change the settings of the camera remotely which I find useful.I tried pulling the plug to see what would happen to the camera and I found that it lost the clock setting so this will present a problem if you are relying on scheduled emails.I have had the unit set up for a month now and the temperature has dropped to -5C (23F) and it is still working well.

Reviews.Title: never worked
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera brand new as a security device as we just moved into a new area tried with both our computers even my moms own and the camera does not work, due to our location we were unable to return so we are out of pocket $95.00 which sucks.  The the camera is practically brand new.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: Josh B. Bloom "movie guy"
Reviews.Content: I wish the field of view was bigger, but I can see what the camera sees from anywhere on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Installation nightmare
Reviews.Author: Dunlapr1
Reviews.Content: I was excited to receive this network camera, but when I went to insert the Installation CD, I noticed it was cracked.  Then I went to the Dlink site to download the installation program.  The download was fine and I started to go through the installation process.  It seems quite complex and not very intuitive.  I have been working on this for about 2 hours and could only get a connection to the camera with both the laptop and camera connected to the router with a network cable.  (if I wanted to be tethered, I would just use a simple webcam).  Anyway, I finally was able to link the camera to my dlink account, but when tried to access it, the firmware needed updated.  After multiple attempts to update the firmware, which resulted in "Your DCS-932L is offline", I am writing this review.  Dlink - DON'T send out cracked CDs and DON'T send out devices with defective firmware. It took me a while to even try out one of your products after being screwed by a ethernet to USB converter a few years back.  I probably won'r be buying anything from you again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Gregg Blankenship
Reviews.Content: We have 2 of these, they install easy, if you follow the instructons.  Can check on our house from anywhere that we can get an internet connection. Color pictures, and night vision is great, and we can pull the picture up on a computer or our smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Be Careful. It's INDOOR only
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: This is Ok for indoor ONLY. It covers a very small area. It also required additional equipment to connect with wifi.

Reviews.Title: easy to install
Reviews.Author: cebuboy
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this unit and it took me around 20minutes to install, so easy. I don't have WPS so I installed it manually. The secret is connect it first with wire and NOT WIRELESS yet, then until you will be able to watch yourself or finished the installation...then insert again the CD disk, do everything from the start and then you can connect using wireless method, it is easy because your computer can easily locate your item...its easy and working great..

Reviews.Title: Will not sync up with router, had to go to a Forscam camera which worked fine
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, wish it would have been able to sync up with my Linksys router, this is the 2nd D-Link I tried, both had the same issue.  They worked fine if connected to a drop cable but would not work with wireless router.  I have two Forscam cameras and they connect to the router fine.

Reviews.Title: Can't figure out how to operate it
Reviews.Author: Barb G
Reviews.Content: I have tried and tried to get it up and running but still have not been able to get it to workSo I'll have to call in to get the details looks like a nice piece of equipment if I ever get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Great Product...but....
Reviews.Author: S. Urquhart
Reviews.Content: Very, very easy to setup and use - had it up in just a few minutes...; immediately had to do a firmware upgrade which was also painless....  Used advanced settings to examine the motion sensors - after the firmware upgrade the motion sensors page fails to load with an error..Pretty interesting settings and utility and overall I think worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Web Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dan the Man
Reviews.Content: I have a total of 18 D-Link cameras that I use for my home security surveillance system.  I have everything from the old DCS-900 to the DCS-5300.  I now have added 5 DCS-930L cameras and I am very happy with the performance these units have for the money.  The upgraded software that comes with these cameras makes the configuration process a breeze.  Total time to confirgure the camera takes about 5 minutes.  The MyDLink Lite app on my IPhone is a great tool for quickly checking watching (and listening) to each of the DCS-930L cameras.  The color quality of these cameras are as good as some more expensive brands out on the market.  The only complaint I have would be the low light sensitivity is not as good as the older DCS-900.  I have mounted some of the DCS-930's outside under the eve of my roof and they hold up well to the outside weather here in Dallas Tx.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive way to have web accessible cameras to purchase the DCS-930L.

Reviews.Title: Not a reliable wireless connection, short life on the camera.
Reviews.Author: Reality
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up for wireless using WPA2, the WPS didn't work. The video quality wasn't bad for the price. However, the wireless connection dropped quite often and I would have to reset (power off and on) the camera. It was even more unreliable than my Foscam cameras, which I don't like either. After a few months the camera's video would get saturated (show a completely light screen) under fairly bright lighting conditions (inside, but the sun shinning in the house). Made in China, so you get what you pay for I guess. I would call mine a 4 month disposable wireless camera. I was disappointed that a company like D-link would put their name on such a product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup after a little bit of research
Reviews.Author: Steve Page
Reviews.Content: I have already setup a camera before on my home Verizon network, so it just took a bit of digging around to get these cameras to work with wireless. (I bought 3 of them)Steps to setup:1) plug in the camera with Ethernet cable2) run install from CD and choose wired3) Log into your mydlink account in a web browser4) select the camera and then click on "settings"5) click on "Advanced setting"6) click on "setup" and then "wireless setup"7) Click "enable"8) Click on "Site Survey"9) Choose your network and enter the password in the Key 1 field below. You may have to change the Encryption mode to 64 or 128 accordingly10) Click "Save Settings"11) Disconnect Ethernet cable and you should be ready to rock

Reviews.Title: Not what i expected
Reviews.Author: Solar User
Reviews.Content: Works ok, there's an app you can use to view it, but what i feel is missing:- Motion detection and recording & alerts- Wider field of view- Wireless?

Reviews.Title: Wireless signal is very weak
Reviews.Author: Ben Meek
Reviews.Content: I tried to like this product, I really did. The setup went smoothly, software and other tools (android app) worked nicely, but the wireless signal strength is just horrible. I had this camera one floor above my router and the signal was around 15%. Right next to my router it was 30%. Signal would drop out constantly where I wanted it. If I could have done an ethernet connection, I would have kept it, but instead it went back to Amazon, and replaced with a Foscam knockoff.

Reviews.Title: Best baby monitor on the market!!!
Reviews.Author: marchiemama
Reviews.Content: I seriously love this camera! We got it because all of the traditional video baby monitors crashed our wireless internet. After a little research, I found this camera and am absolutely stoked at what I stumbled on to. We have had it for about 6 months now and I can't even imagine not having it. It was half the price of the baby video monitors, works way better, can be viewed on our smart phones and ipad no matter how far away from home we are, and has great quality. My one complaint is that the software seems to be having issues with the new iOS 6 (it closes out of the app after a minute or two rather than keeping it open) but it still works great. We have also bought this same camera as baby gifts for family and friends, it seems to be catching on like a wild fire now! All we needed was to buy a $10 sound monitor to work at night so we don't have to keep the phone or ipad on the whole time, and then just pull up the camera when my daughter makes a sound so we can see what has been going on.My best advice to any parent is to forgo the expensive, traditional baby video monitors and get this one instead. It's cheaper, better quality, and more easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: Like it, have had many other brands.
Reviews.Author: buenhec
Reviews.Content: I have had many other brands (airlink, foscam, panasonic) and this is my favorite so far. The setup is easy enough even on my MAC. After about 9 months they are still working fine and the internet setup for viewing works well eliminating the need to set up a dns or configure your router. I just updated with the latest firmware and did two cameras in 10 minutes.  I will be buying others. The 932l works way better at night than the 930.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - poor remote access
Reviews.Author: Frederick M. Adams "The Sandman"
Reviews.Content: I have two of these DCS-942L cameras, one at home and one at the cottage.  Wanted security surveillance.  Good image quality, good control, easy installation.  BUT - I have spent nearly three hours on the phone to the techs trying to get internet access to the remote camera using a Windows 7 computer.  I have 3 Windows 7 computers, and the same problem on them all - I can access the local camera, but not the remote one, regardless of which site I am trying from.  If I go to an outside site such as our local public library then I cannot access either camera since they both have then become "remote".  I get a black rectangle instead of the remote image.  I have upgraded the firmware to V 1.12 on both cameras. Now here's the weird part -- I can access everything just fine from an old Vista-based laptop PC sytem, also great from my wife's Android-based Galaxy SIII, my IOS 6-based iPod Touch and my old IOS 5-based iPad 1.  My trouble call has been upgraded two levels at Dlinks' tech support, but no-one has offered any kind of resolution.  Be clear on this - I will be ordering yet another camera for a third location since I can access from my secondary peripherals, but I really, really want to access them over Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: I tried to install the software for this camera on 2 different computers and it wouldn't do it.  I returned it.  I have a different D-Link model that installed easily and works nicely.

Reviews.Title: slow internet, still works
Reviews.Author: mommy loves
Reviews.Content: We have possibly the worst internet ever so I was worried about getting this camera.  Even with our poor internet, it still works fairly well!  It loses connection maybe once a day, but quickly turns back on.  Set up was very easy...you put the CD in, run the wizard and that is it!  The picture quality is ok (you see what you need to see).  We use it as a baby monitor and it does really well.  The only reason why it is 4 stars and not 5 is because the cord is only about 4ft long for the camera!  When you want to mount a camera (it even comes with mounting equipment), you typically mount it up high... unless you have 4ft ceilings, it isn't going anywhere.  That has been slightly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Admin Password change warning
Reviews.Author: Jack Azout
Reviews.Content: The DCS-930L works as advertised, but if you want to set it up manually using your browser instead of the wizard please note that if you attempt to change the admin password using the browser you will NOT be able to log in again and will need to reset the camera.  I went through this 3 times, thinking I had fat-fingered the password, but it turns out that the web interface has a bug.  If you use Windows, you can simply run the wizard from the included CD, change the admin password and then use the web interface for everything else.  If you use OS X, you need to download and run D-Link's MacUtility, which is found at [...].  Again, once you change the admin password via the utility, you can then do everything else via the web interface.  Besides that minor yet frustrating issue, the camera worked well for me, and I realize that most people will be unaffected since they will use the wizard.  Also keep in mind that you do not need to use the mydlink setup; if you know a bit about networking you can set the DCS-930L up manually for outside access via port forwarding.

Reviews.Title: Has a great Motion Detection
Reviews.Author: Chito Pono "Stay CazuaL"
Reviews.Content: I bought another unit because this unit has the capability to select portion of the screen to detect motion. This is a great feature because there are always motions on some parts of the image you want to detect not necessarily the entire image.

Reviews.Title: Works but has its issues
Reviews.Author: bsg2004
Reviews.Content: The box includes the camera (in a protective see-through bag), an ethernet cable, the power adapter, mounting screws, and the installation disc and quick starting guide pamphlets. The power adapter plays nice with power strips, it only occupies one position.Installation============I installed it twice for testing and practical purposes. First I installed it with a wireless connection by pressing the button on the camera (blue light blinking on the back) and then adjusting the settings on the router. I don't remember if it was the router button or the router web settings that did it, but it connected, and the light on the back of the camera turned to solid blue.After the installation completes, you are prompted to create a mydlink.com account, so you can remotely monitor the video feed using the mydlink.com website.You can optionally install the desktop software management console from the included disk. On Windows 7 this software wants to completely turn off User Account Control (UAC) and reboot in order to complete the installation. This is an on-going requirement, not just a temporary change for installation. Disabling UAC is not a good idea unless you know what you are doing and why you are doing it.After the initial installation, it wanted to upgrade to the latest firmware. This required a wired (network cable) connection. So I run the installation software again and connected with wired ethernet and the firmware was updated successfully.The default video feed is 320x240 in black and white with audio. If you go in the Advanced Settings, you can change it to 640x480 or 160x120.I only installed this on Windows 7. I did not try any other operating systems.Operation==========The camera heats up within a few minutes. When the camera is facing straight forward (perpendicular to the ground), it can easily tip forward if you hit it from behind, so you may want to make the necessarily adjustments if it is in the way or if there are pets or kids that may bump into it.This seems to work best in smaller rooms with relatively even lightning. Perhaps best suited for apartments or small rooms.The Apps========The free MyDlink app worked successfully on the iPod, Kindle Fire, and Google Play devices (smartphone and tablet). The app basically logs on to your mydlink.com account and picks up the video from there.Mydlink offers a basic app for free (lite app) and a 99c app with presumably more features. Charging for an app for a specialty hardware device that a consumer purchases is a rather cheap thing to do and does not reflect well on the manufacturer of the product. Minus one star for this nickle-diming. By looking at the Google Play stats, under 10,000 people bought the 99c app, so it's not like it is a big money maker they need to protect.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good!
Reviews.Author: Susan C. Carpenter
Reviews.Content: I bought and installed this for my stepdaughter and grandson who was born last week (Yayyyyy!!!).  We converted our upstairs to a suite and my office into a nursery.  The nice thing about that is that my office was set up for wired internet with the LAN plug right where my stepdaughter placed the crib!(I know, right?).  It found my network, and with the provided CD, walked me straight through a firmware upgrade for the camera, a java updates for the PC which included creating a name (email address) and password on dlink's website.  The video of the crib popped right up on my stepdaughter's PC which has Chrome, Firefox and IE9 (worked on all 3 browsers).  Next, I took our android phones and went to Play Store and downloaded mydlink lite.  Once again, after the name and password, we have video!  On the downside, the audio is very poor, with an audible buzz on the mobile phones (but not the PC).This is my stepdaughter's first child (and my first grandson, thank-you-very-much), and she is somewhat hyper-vigilant regarding any separation from him which I think is pretty normal.  This camera has provided her some comfort in that area as she can check him online as she does chores, cooks, etc.  For what we paid for this unit, we are very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: This is good network camera because I can look at my dogs when they stay at home without any person.All features are working good. Only I can't save motion detection images on my computer which in the same LAN. This is working only with FTP server.

Reviews.Title: Seems good enuff ...
Reviews.Author: Bisdak SysOp
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these for a friend, for her small shop's cheap security. Setting up the 2nd one now, via its ethernet port (haven't tried wireless tho). Seems a breeze to install even if done manually (no need to go Wizards). I like how you can control Brightness/Contrast/Saturation. Set up an FTP service so I could test its FTP-upload functionality, seems to work. ++ on the frequency of uploads (e.g. interval of seconds), and the ability to create folders/subfolders and date/timestamp filenames, then set it up on an NTP service so it could update its time. Power is 110-220V auto (this matters to me) so you could plug it on wherever continent you are ;-) There's other features but the ones I mentioned are the ones I needed so I can't comment on them.Default firmware was 1.03. Updated it to 1.06. Screen says takes 140s (are they fans of the twitter-140-char-limit?:-p) to do so, and did exactly that.My only qualm is the images do not contain the date and timestamps but you can do away w/ this w/ their YYMMDDTIMESTAMP folder/subfolder/filename scheme.Happy w/ it ;-)

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Set up was so easy. I am comcast customer, so my router had a WPS button. I don't think it took me longer than 3 minutes and I was able to easy to get it set up and test it. I think I am going to buy ateast one more. I am kicking myself for not buying one of these sooner. Awesome purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Tyler "behscientist"
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a baby monitor that we could use with our mac/ipad/iphones and check on our little one when we are away at the office or in another part of the house.This camera is perfect. I can move it anywhere in the house where the baby is and watch him from anywhere I am. I was shocked at how well the night vision is for it. I am really excited to use this once he goes in to a crib in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Good item so far
Reviews.Author: Romans134
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to use as a security device for our home while we are away. For the price, it does what I need it to do. Unfortunately, it is not outdoor rated so it limits where you can place it but it definitely does the job.The PLUG AND PLAY, ZERO CONFIG feature is NOT up to par. I spent about one hour with the free tech support trying to get this up and running. The instructions say that all you really need to do is hit the WEP on your router and the link button on the camera itself and you're good to go. WRONG! I ended up having to install/reinstall the CD about 5 times and TECH support had to help me set up IP address's so the camera would 'talk' to the router. I am not an expert on these things but I think I'm pretty competent but this was way too complicated for something that states it is user friendly. Of course the TECH support is a call center with reps that barely speak English so that was fun.It is a decent item for my needs especially since you can download the free iPhone/iPad app and monitor it away from home. You can also view the camera feed on any web browser once you set up your account. Some reviewers mentioned no audio but I can get audio on the web and my App.  Just be prepared to spend a lot of quality phone time with TECH support to install it properly.

Reviews.Title: This is OK.
Reviews.Author: skp
Reviews.Content: This is OK for this price, there is no sound. It doesn't work when there is no light or it is dark.. ....

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thevee
Reviews.Content: This camera was easy to set up and work just fine  voice not good  I'm far from a computer wiz

Reviews.Title: D-link
Reviews.Author: tish126
Reviews.Content: This is the best wireless camera....the furthest I have been is about 50 miles away from the base and it works the same as if I were next to it.  My only problem is there is a "time limit" when I am a certain distance away...I can keep resetting which is annoying it but it doesnt happen when I am nearby?? I cant seem to resolve this issue, it wasnt presented to me when I purchased it. However, I still think it is a very good item.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Martin-Maxime Vaillancourt
Reviews.Content: Set up was not simple but it was worth it. Had to put the software on a usb key in order for it to work. Great night vision and decent resolution. Will buy some more.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and does the job.
Reviews.Author: Elpablo
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd D-link wireless camera I have purchased. I set one up for my parents and the other 2 at my house. One looking out into the front of my house thru the glass panel of my garage door. I did not use the IR camera because the IR reflects back on glass panel and blinds the camera. The second, night vision capable, is installed in the backyard under my porch.Easy to install and setup to send me pics via email when motion is detected. Read some of the reviews by others and it helped greatly with setup. Will be adding cameras inside the house once baby arrives instead of buying a baby monitor since it transmits sound too.Would give 5 stars if it was weatherproof, so 4 stars for now.

Reviews.Title: Great little IP camera
Reviews.Author: John F "Interested Investor"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as my initial entry into IP cams.  It has a good picture and was easy to set up.  For what it is and the price it really a good camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Genova "D"
Reviews.Content: easy set-up, good picture, I can access picture from my Android phone, so far so good. Would definately recommend. Would get the night vision version if I needed it, but this one is good enough for my needs

Reviews.Title: A lot of IP camera for a little money
Reviews.Author: pbug56 "Photobug"
Reviews.Content: Now keep in mind that this is not an expensive product.  It has its limits.  And it is a BIT of a pain to setup.  Hey - I spent about an hour getting it going.  I'll start with the bad;1. WPS setup did not work; I had to first get it online via wired Ethernet and connect to it with a browser to setup the wifi.  Shouldn't be, but I've never had much luck with WPS anyway.  No big deal.2. Default audio settings are VERY LOUD.  BEWARE the loud feedback and noise.  Easily dealt with by going into audio setup either via mydlink.com or direct control or the android program.3. It's not what you call hi res.  Nor did I expect it to be.  It is standard VGA.  You want more - pay more.4. Doc's aren't the best; but on the other hand I've seen a lot worse.  Just have some patience.5. Couldn't find anything in the docs on the android program that goes with it.  Again, no big deal; type in dlink, check the FREE ones that come up. One will be right and it will list this unit as compatible.I have not yet tried in in low light, will when I can.  I also intend to use it remotely when away from home.What I like!1. Really not hard to setup.2. A decent image for what it is.3. Once you get Java, etc. installed, pretty easy to use both on mydlink.com and on a local browser and on the android software.4. Exactly what I want maybe inside the house when I'm away, or looking out the driveway when home and I need to see what's going on outside.5. The built in web server is rather cool and easy to use once you get Java working.  Active X doesn't seem to work; probably blocked in the browser.6. I like the idea that it can be set as a security camera to detect motion and send emails to get your attention.I'm still exploring it, will eventually update this review.

Reviews.Title: Motion Detection Didn't Work at first
Reviews.Author: tbarkermn
Reviews.Content: The main reason I bought this camera was for the motion detection feature.  Unfortunately, that feature does not work.  Everything else seems to work fine.  I was able to configure the motion detection settings in the advanced configuration however the camera itself doesn't seem to respond to motion, even with sensitivity setting cranked up.  Junk!UPDATE:  Shortly after posting this review the motion detection started working magically.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Checking in on the Little Ones
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn F. Milke
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. It was super easy to install. I set up 2 with a screaming 9 month old, how's that for awesome? I use this camera to check in on my son when he is at home with someone other than myself. While I'm at work, it's great to pop by and see him playing or napping. It's also great being able to check to see what he is doing before I come home; it put an end to waking him up from naptime with the groceries!Sound is OK. You will hear them cry without a doubt. If your goal is to hear a conversation perfectly, this is not your camera. Image quality is great in both day and night.

Reviews.Title: Video is good, but sound is horrible
Reviews.Author: Rosemary J White
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a nanny cam and so far it's serving its purpose. It was a breeze to set up and the video quality is decedent. There is a slight delay sometimes but it could be my wifi hookup. The sound is terrible though, you can't hear anything but static, so if you are hoping for good sound quality, consider another camera.

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Jenofcali
Reviews.Content: I use this as a video monitor for my twins, so I bought 3.  The cameras are easy to set up and move around to different locations.  I like using the software from my dlink as others don't always work.  And now that they added sound to the iPad app I like the cameras better.  The picture is good day or night, the only negative is that you can't move the camera remotely like some others.  But all in all I'm happy

Reviews.Title: Easy plug and play camera
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything as advertised.  Easy to setup over wired or wireless and easy to access with either the mobile app or over the web through [...] .  There are only two minor negatives with the camera.  1:  The night vision switch is too sensitive (as commented already from another person earlier).  2:  The motion detection is not working quite right.  You can set it up to email you a 10 second clip every time motion is detected but I've been getting emails all day long when nothing is even on the screen.  I probably need to fine tune the settings a little more since there are a lot of options.Other than these two cons this camera is great.  I have showed it to several other people and they were quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: UPDATED changed my mind
Reviews.Author: RedDevil
Reviews.Content: 10/22/2013 updated review:Never could get a total of 4 cameras to work in my small home. Also, the D-Link software is horrible. Had my ISP folks out testing and found the camera (1 or 3, didn't matter), pulled 3/4 of my internet service. They continually booted up my internet service and whatever it was, this software pulled 3/4 of the service. You can imagine how useless a service can be with that much dedicated to one system. No surfing the net. No game stations. Bah-humbug. I emailed the techs and they told me 'D-Link software is what it is'. However, the 3 cameras I use work wonderfully.12/2012 updated review:Added 3 cameras.Very good image. Video a bit clunky, but could be my internet too slow. With Dview software I've used the motion sensing, email, scheduling (motion and constant video) all without problem. Still no valuable sound. Mine is just static at any volume setting. I installed 3 cameras for my daughter and her sound works fine. Perhaps it is hit-n-miss with the 930-L?8/2012 original review:As long as the user is familiar with how to access their router admin site to activate the wireless search for the camera (most have a default IP & password of 'admin'-check your documentation), the camera fires right up as easily as advertised. I've only just gotten it so have pecked around with the advanced features (motion, email, etc.) very little and they seem to work fine. Maybe I need to work more with the sound feature (although there is only a volume function), but the sound is completely worthless. It's not an issue for my use, but isn't a feature to brag about. I've ordered 3 more. Also, setting up mydlink.com for viewing online was a piece of cake.

Reviews.Title: I wish it would work the way it should be...
Reviews.Author: T. Lyczko
Reviews.Content: I wish it would work the way it should be... the product seems to be great but.. if it worked. Despite the negative reviews I've decided to purchase this item to watch over my baby and our nanny. It kinda worked ok on my iphone when connected to WIFI.. 3G service  could not handle the camera. I had to reboot every 60 seconds, audio barely worked video kept on freeze on me. Good idea if it work.

Reviews.Title: Good Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: I bought a DLink 930 model first to enable me to view the house while at work. The 930 did a decent job with ample light, but fell short in low light conditions.  So I purchased the 932 to use at my doorway and the 930 in another location.  The 932 and 930 are comparable in situations with ample lighting (edge in clarity to the 932), but the 932 is much better - as expected - in low light situations. The low light viewing is pretty clear in black/white - I can easily distinguish all objects and pets.Setup was easy.  I had this camera operating on my wireless network within 5 minutes of powering it on. There is no need to use the DLink software to configure the camera. Simply attach the camera to your wired network and power it on, find the IP address that it pulled from your router/firewall/AP and then use your web browser to connect to it.  (As a side note, the 930 was also very easy to setup) The GUI is very straight-forward and simple to use.  Also, I you don't HAVE to use the DLink cloud or whatever to view the video from the camera.  You can use port-forwarding on your router/firewall to connect directly to the camera from the Internet.  This may not be feasible for everyone, but it is possible if you are so inclined.Pros:Pretty good video quality. Not crystal clear, but not fuzzy eitherDecent good night video (again good, not great)Easy setupSupports "N" wireless. Some of the cameras only support B/G wirelessPriced rightCons:I would like a little bit better video quality, but for $89 it is very acceptableSummary:If you are looking for a decent wireless camera that has night video capability, this is a very good option.

Reviews.Title: Reboot often
Reviews.Author: rejedejo
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a year and if I haven't rebooted it recently it probably isn't working.  I have it set up to FTP to my d-link dns 323, which works pretty good when it works.  But then it needs rebooting so often, and I can't get the NTP service to work so everytime it reboots it makes another 1/10/10 folder, unless I set the date manually.  I also can't get it to email out, probably because I can't run it, don't know enough to set it up....  This on doesn't have any lighting, IR or otherwise and in dim conditions the pictures are worthless.  This one is less troublesome than some other 'big name' brands that I've tried, so in general, it's okay, I'll buy another., I would give it 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4.

Reviews.Title: Can't Stream Well via WIFI
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the wireless streaming, however it will not stream continuously over WiFi.  I had software monitoring the video feed and it would drop out intermittently. It works much better when wired, but if it's wired you can probably find a better camera too.

Reviews.Title: Easy!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A. Coulter "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera a few weeks before our second child was born to monitor her during sleep time. I had no issue whatsoever setting it up with my Apple Time Capsule and then moving it into their room wirelessly (minus the power plug which is needed to power the device). It has been a real blessing to have this, as we can check on our daughter on our computer, iphone or ipad. The picture is clear and the sound is great. This is well worth the money, in fact we are thinking about getting another for an additional angle in their bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Worth it.
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: Received the camera on 7/12/12. It wasn't as easy to set up as it states! I called tech support twice and they couldnt get the camera set up. I was determined to get it to work so I was up all night until finally I did get it to work! Night vision is awesome, you can see everything clearly in black/white format. Day vision is also great, if camera is in a much lighted room the view is in color form. Like others have stated, the sound is static riden, but you can hear better if the background noises are loud it then blocks out the static. I do hate the short cord I had to add an extension cord. I have great connection to view from my android galaxy s phone,no freeze and no issues so far.I'm not certain if the 932L has motion detection or email alerts, if so, I'm not certain how to connect them. I do wish it ran on batteries and that it had a wider view range. But all in all its a great camera to have and works great. When I can afford to, I plan to purchase two more of them.

Reviews.Title: Works well, a bit of a challenge to setup the wireless connection
Reviews.Author: M. Katona "mkjava"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to get this after all of the issues I've read in the reviews, but decided to go for it any way as it's not very expensive.  I have a Mac and downloaded the beta Mac setup program from the D-Link site, and it worked like a charm to setup the camera.  The camera had to be plugged into the router for the setup, I could not do this wirelessly.  Once I got it running with a wired connection, I wanted to set it up wirelessly.  My Verizon FIOS router does not have a WPS button, so I couldn't configure it via that method.  I went into the advanced settings of the camera configuration where it allowed me to search for my wireless network and input the access key.  I encountered a problem where my network used a 10 character WEP key and the camera insisted on a 13 character key.  The only workaround I could find was to change the security method on the router to WPA instead (which is more secure anyway).  After that, I was able to enter the WPA key in the camera settings and the wireless connection worked like a charm.  Of course I then had to change the wireless key settings on all my devices, but not too big of a deal.  All in all the camera is working exactly the way I wanted it, an easy way to check in on the house while I'm away.  A little effort on the wireless setup, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great...needs some improvements
Reviews.Author: Z. Johnson "musician_from_cal"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for about a month now to keep tabs on my pets.  I notice the price has increased almost 10% in just the last month.  Honestly I don't think I would've bought it at the new current price level.  Anyway here's what I've found with this cam so far:PROS:  *Infra-red night vision feature works great..lights up whole room even in total darkness  *Very clear, sharp video.CONS:  *DLINK forces you to rely on their mydlink.com website in order to view the cam.  Often  times their site is slowwwwww, disconnects without reason, or just won't connect at all at random times.  *Audio is HORRIBLE!  Dirty, static-filled sound, sort of like an old vinyl LP that's badly scratched all over the place...it sort of works sometimes, but DLINK clearly didn't give a crap about making the mic and audio sound quality something which reproduces a good clear sound...it truly sucks.  *Installation was NOT as easy as they like to lead you to believe it will be.  I had to call  their tech support for help in order to get it to work.  They stepped me through a few configuration changes and now it works fine, but it certainly wasn't the simple plug-and-play installation I thought it would be based on all their literature.  *I-phone app is TERRIBLE!  Keeps disconnecting after 60 seconds and forces me to reconnect again and again and again...very frustrating & not what I expected for a camera at this price level.BOTTOM LINE:  It's good, but not great.  It will likely do what you need it to do, but at the current higher price level I would seriously suggest looking at the competition.  For that much money the problems I mentioned above shouldn't exist.

Reviews.Title: Love it ...just ordered another one
Reviews.Author: C. Mason
Reviews.Content: My neighbor had them first.  He showed me how they worked.  I bought mine from Amazon, cheapest price I could fine.  But the price keeps going up.  I just purchased a used one that cost more than the new one I bought a month ago.  Amazon is the fullfillment vendor.  Stay tuned will keep you posted.Also it doesn't say it has sound in the description but it does.  I use it to watch my dog during the day.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: ThunderDre
Reviews.Content: Difficult to set up. Most features worked, but I never could get the motion detection to work. Customer service was not any help. Do yourself a favor and buy something else! Trust me, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Big disappoinment! Will not recommend to others...
Reviews.Author: skiebax
Reviews.Content: Very bad audio, static most of the time. Poor connectivity on iphone or android, takes too long and lots of time out before accessing cam and will only show you 1 minute of coverage then ask you to reconnect again ( good luck on that!).

Reviews.Title: Great setup but mediocre camera
Reviews.Author: E. D. Light "sleight42"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a local shop because I had an immediate need for an night-capable IP camera.  The 932L was fairly easy to set up once I figured out how to get WPS (wireless protected setup) to work with Apple wifi hardware (hint: download Airport Utility 5.6 for Lion because 6.0 actually has less capability including missing WPS support!).The daytime video appears to be solid.However, the infrared night video is subject to streaking.  For an example, see [...].I recently purchased a Agasio m105i [...].  While it was a pain to set up (see my review), it's picture is infinitely better at night and overall a better value.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough for small area with my 8 watt led light (40 watt equivalent)
Reviews.Author: Riky
Reviews.Content: Bought one from Frys tried for 2 days and returned it cause Amazon is way cheaper and Amazon was not on their list to beat internet prices,Ordered 2 so this is the third time setting it up but could not set it up using "wps" on my Dlink DIR-605L router. Patience is the name of the game here. Followed the instruction on the manual and installed both for half a day. Why? Im using Comodo Internet Security and Malwarebytes and it seems they prevent me from finishing the installation and no pop up whatsoever to let you know what's going on.I tried with my other computer with other Antivirus and same thing so i stopped all my  antivirus,firewall,etc,and everything works. Same set-up for both cameras and i use gmail account for notification since the manual used gmail as an example make sure one email address per cam or only one cam would send a notification. I tried mydlink inside and outside my network with Pc,Ipod touch and Galaxy tab 2 7inch no problem at all.I'm using Ip Cam viewer basic mostly on my Galaxy tab within my network cause i can see both cams at the same time but no sound with this free app and almost no lag compare to mydlink, i havent tried outside my network yet.This is the easiest set up for me compared to my other dlink dcs-2100+ that i used 6 years ago plus extra monthly to access camera outside my network.Update:So far so good>>I bought this to monitor our apartment while we're on vacation to Reno,use the hotel internet and i was able to see whats goin on in our apartment pretty cool.I forgot to mention when setting up your dlink camera be careful not point it in your face the wall would be better.I forgot to reset the one i bought from Frys and somebody bought it and i can see his face showed up on my email alert while he was setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Works well with proper illumination
Reviews.Author: The Mighty Quinn
Reviews.Content: The camera has pretty good range even through structures. We've had good luck with distances up to around 100 feet. With enough daylight or artificial light, picture quality is good. For the price this is good value, and I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-932L Day/Night Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: My expectations were on high for the D-Link DCS-932L after owning 2 older D-link Cameras, I must say I was correct; note I still am using one of the older cameras along with the new onesI have purchased 3 of these cameras and all have worked as intended, The ability to view the cameras from your Android device via Wi-Fi or 3G works well, can't do that with the older camera, also being alerted by email when motion is detected is great if you need that feature. The night mode is also worth it and provides a pretty clear picture to look at.I was up and running in no time! You do need to plug it into an Ethernet port initially like the instructions say. After initial set up, you can change it to wireless. The mylink setup to find the camera was a little tricky with the first camera, but the others were no problemWhen you are viewing the camera from your local network or using the mydlink app, the video and audio comes in very quickly. When you are outside of your own network, be patient. It can take a little time for the video to start.I also setup the security software so I can watch all the cameras on one screen at the same timeI would like to see a battery power system so you could mount the camera in any location also a camera that could be used outside

Reviews.Title: Nice video quality and quick setup
Reviews.Author: X
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I was nervous about purchasing this camera. I decided to go for it, and couldn't be happier. Installation and setup was complete in about 15 minutes. My camera is now running wirelessly, I can view it on my PC and on my iPhone. My router doesn't have the WPS button, but that wasn't a problem at all. I was able to set it up very quickly and easily. I'm no genius either. All it took was the correct router password and following the guide on the setup CD that came in the box. I'd highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Works good and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: jimjim84
Reviews.Content: This product had all the features I needed and was easy to set up. I'm no computer wiz but the only thing I needed to learn is how to set up an ftp server for the motion detector file transfer (image and video) which was easy enough. Everything else I could find was either out of my price range, had complicated setup for remote viewing or was some cheap chineese stuff.

Reviews.Title: Using as a baby monitor, very convienent!
Reviews.Author: Erin Calabria "11eleven"
Reviews.Content: We got this camera because it had good night vision, and mostly because you can remotely view it via iPhone or iPad from anywhere. We were using the Motorola MBP36 Remote Wireless Video Baby Monitor with Infrared Night Vision and Zoom, 3.5 Inch, but I was hoping I could return it for this much cheaper camera. Unfortunately, the biggest problem with the D-Link camera is the sound. Its very static-y and loud and annoying. Its like having a white noise machine on if you want to listen to that all the time! I also didn't want to leave my phone on as a monitor every time he was sleeping. The D-Link app was killing my battery and made my phone really hot. So we ended up keeping both.We use the Motorola at home, and my husband, myself, and grandma and grandpa can log into the app from anywhere (usually from work) and check on the baby. His grandparents recently got iPhones and absolutely love looking at him when they aren't able to see him for awhile. We have had no issues at all using the (free) D-Link app on our phones with sound or picture. The app for the iPad is $1.99, and we use that and have had no problems with it either. As a working mother, I sometimes have to work when my son is going to bed, and I love being able to log in and look at his sweet face when I miss him!Also I should mention, the camera was incredibly easy to set up and program, I did it myself in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Never stay connect
Reviews.Author: H. Le "TheInvestor"
Reviews.Content: Quality of the camera is fine but the unite never stay connected to WiFi and very difficult to have it connect.  I had the 932L model it is a breezy.  Not recommend this model.  Don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: Cameras do the trick.
Reviews.Author: G. Green
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to monitor our primary home in Texas while we spend the summers in Colorado.  I was skeptical of the cameras because of the price.  They arrived two days before we left and I had no idea of the time factor for installing them.  I placed one camera on our patio to monitor the rear of our house and the other to monitor the living room.  Both cameras connected wirelessly to our router without problems. In Colorado, we are able to monitor our home by computer and iPhone.  The quality of the images is very good and several of my Colorado friends, who also flee the Texas heat in the summer, are planning to purchase Dlink cameras to monitor their primary homes.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised - so far so good!
Reviews.Author: S. Reynoso "bitwise"
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a simple to set up and use surveillance camera that I could install on my home network.I settled on this D-Link camera because it seems to have the best documentation available online.Just finished installing it and am happy to report it WORKED on the first try, right out of the box.  It even prompted me to upgrade the firmware, which I did nervously, and it completed successfully!  You need to be patient though as it takes about 5 minutes and does not display a progress bar.I should point out that I went with an ethernet-based installation (as opposed to wifi).  The wifi setup experience may be completely different (probably more complicated I'm guessing).Also, I have not tried viewing from outside my private network.Based on what I have seen so far, I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: cdixon
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these camera they work great for checking up on your house when away.  I will say they are hard to set up at first but once they are you are good to go.  You can use a Dlink app to see live feeds from your iphone or ipad. I plan on buying more in the future to cover more of my house.  Great cheap camera with good quality picture.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the Foscam
Reviews.Author: dketchel1
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera before the Foscam because it is Wireless-N Compatible. Got it and it was pretty buggy along with the mydlink app. There was a good 30 second delay with not acceptable considering I would have been using it as a baby monitor.Go with the Foscam. The newer model ****10w is much better. It has better Infared and it has tilt, pan, 2 way audio, and only a 1-2 sec lag, all of which the D-link does not have, for only 20-30 dollars more.

Reviews.Title: Greate Product for the price
Reviews.Author: gigi
Reviews.Content: We have being using this camera for 1 week and we love it! At the beginning I thought the only way to setup the wireless was using WPS but once I inserted the setup CD the wizard will give the option to setup the wireless configuration by first connecting the camera into the wired lan and then setting the wireless configuration.The motion detection system works great! We have 2 dogs so we use the motion detection triggered exclusively to the frame that hast the dog door so we get a mail every time one of our dogs leaves / enters the house.  The web app and the phone app work great.If you are using 3G / 4G network the connection to the camera will reset after 1 min which is ok as you probably don't want to have the camera all the time on the phone. The web interface will not get disconnected which works great for us since we can monitor the house from the office for extended periods or on the road with the phone app.The night vision works great! We love that feature. The setup is very easy to follow so you won't have any issues and we are considering getting a couple more of this in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: David Y
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting forever for the Foscam FI8910W to drop from $109, and saw that the 932L was on sale for $87 with a free $10 Amazon Gift Card. I already have the 930L and just wanted a decent cam with Night Vision, so I decided why not stick with the same brand of cams. Only problem I had was setting up the wireless for Verizon Fios. The part in the Wireless Setup where you unplug the cam from your router, and it does a 60sec thing to find the cam. Mine kept coming back saying it couldn't be found or something like that, but the cam worked fine when plugged in. What I had to do was go into my router, and delete the 932L from my Network. I then ran the wireless setup again, and it found it in 2sec. I like the night vision it has a range that I can ID anyone walking up the driveway. If you have the cam pointed out a window, the Night Vision works best if you push you cam against it, so the IR isn't blinding it. The blinking light is a good deterent if your using them as security cameras. Anyone thinking of breaking into your home will know that you have a Security System of some kind, and might move on since they don't know what other cams they didn't see. Now I need to find an iPad app to be able to view 2 live cams at once. Don't buy the D-Link+ App unless you only want one Live Cam, and just a pic of your last live image of your others. The 932L has a good image, and a good price.Update: I found the App uCamPro HD that works with a bunch of differen't brand of Cams. It allows you to run multiple live cams at once not just one live, and a still image of another. You have to buy an in app purchase to get the multiple cam function, but the app works great. Total cost for the app/plus multi is $10. I also just purchased the Foscam so having the multi brand compatibilty is great. D-Link sound isn't supported at the moment, but they keep updating the app so hopefully soon. Foscam sound is supported though.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't network properly
Reviews.Author: Ernie Sharp
Reviews.Content: The camera will not connect wirelessly, using WPS, or any other method. I tried it with three different routers. It only connects by hardwire. The software requires the use of ActiveX controls, and the wizard could not install them. This means that the camera is worthless. Do not buy. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. It works great. I bought 2 of them. Since they don't swivel, I bought 1 to cover each entry point of my home.

Reviews.Title: Firmware update required!
Reviews.Author: rteder "rteder"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera that "just works," keep looking.The biggest shortcoming of the device is that it will periodically demand of you; "firmware upgrade required!"  I foolishly did so the first time, which turned it into a brick.  D Link, after much cajoling, did replace this, but you are still out the hour plus of time such events always consume. We cannot rule out that I did something wrong, but I am an electrical engineer who develops products with firmware for a living, so I doubt it.So, not every time I log on it nags me: "Firmware Update Required!", but I click "Remind Me Lator", as I do not want to turn it into a brick.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: S. vonPfahl "von Pfahl"
Reviews.Content: This cam worked very well for our family.  The baby was clearly visable both day and night. In addition the picture quality was good and the sound was good. We are very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but......
Reviews.Author: mizzoutiger
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera mainly because it is fairly inconspicuous looking. And secondly, because it has a zoom feature.  Well, one out of two isn't bad.  The zoom feature is pretty useless, but perhaps I expected too much for the price. Setup for the camera was pretty easy.  I don't think the monitoring software is very user friendly (too many steps involved). However, I am able to monitor the camera using the existing app on my android phone and that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: Once its up and running its great
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I had a bit of trouble getting this camera setup. I'm using Mac which is supported, says so on the box too. The disc/software it comes with, is for windows only, it should have both on it. I had to go to the website and download drivers which were a beta version. Once I started getting the software setup, the software popped up saying I couldn't use the software and its needs an update. Why didn't they have the most current on the main link on their site?So, once I had the correct install software, the camera was found and I went ahead and then added my dlink account. You'll get an email to verify things before you can go any further. The windows disc may have had the instructions on how to make the cam wireless but, once again, I had to track it down on the website. Something that could have taken 30 minutes to install and configure took me 2 hours to finish. This is in my opinion, because of the lack of proper instructions included with the box. It had a disc and a 2 sided quick install guide that was again for windows only. Once i found the pdf with the instructions to make the cam wireless, it worked flawlessly. I have it setup nice and high and it covers 3 rooms. The cam has an ok wide angle lens so this helped.I easily downloaded the iPhone app and have tried it far from home and the speed was quick. I do have a fast internet connection at home and this i'm sure makes a difference. One issue I did notice is that the cam seems to stay black and white. I think it is because of where i have the cam hidden is slightly dark, so it measures ambient light near itself which would make it think its dark when the actual room isn't. The iPad app is called mydlink+ for $.99. You can use the free iPhone app too but the + version has a horizontal layout and you can view multiple cams at once.The cam Itself very light weight and found that if you don't have it situated correctly, and move the power cord, it will knock over. I did not use the screws to fasten it in place as it will be moved in the near future unless i just buy an additional cam. The resolution is pretty good, you have the option of making the sizes from small, medium and large. There's a 160x120, 320x240 and a 640x480. the default was 320x240 so i left it there. The sound is just ok, its got a sensitive mike so you'll hear a lot of hiss. There is an option to lower the sensitivity. There's motion detection where you can set it to send you images to your email as soon as it detects motion. This is great for when you are away and aren't checking your live feed.I picked this over the linksys because of the iPhone/ipad app. I think I made the right choice. The only issue was that the instructions and setup for mac are terrible.

Reviews.Title: For the money its not a bad buy
Reviews.Author: Scooter Kat "Scooter"
Reviews.Content: For the money its not a bad buy . Like others have said the camera resolution is not the best .Turning up the resolution gives you a decent picture quality . If your home router has a  WPS button installation is a breeze . Took me about 20 minutes to get two cameras online .

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: GWG
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras to keep an eye on the office and house while traveling.I had to call customer support on both cameras for the set up.The cameras will not track a person walking across the room when they are connected via wifi.The cameras need a lot of light to be useful. Lamp light from another room that you can see to walk around by will not do the job.For the price they are good.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: Very nice product. It works very well and the configuration is easy. Works in the day and at the night very usefull for my home.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-932L
Reviews.Author: Theodore M. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I bought these to lookin on our nanay from time to time TRhey work good  BUT the cord on the powersupply is way to short its about 3' and should be 6' or so. I think this is a good product and was realyn easy to setup even remote viewing on IOS IPHONE. Ted

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price. The image is clear and the nigh vision works well too. The static and motion jpeg images are available by directly typing in the camera's web address. its also available through the dlink mydlink site and app.I have it set up as a static IP on my network, with port forwarding to the camera. I can access it over the internet by typing in my dyndns address. If i want, i can also use the app on my phone to see the video. The dlink app is decent. it seems to work and i haven't had much problems with it.I noticed a few bad things though. The mydlink site has to be setup on a computer with the cd program. The camera also has a problem with upnp. If you don't have upnp you don't get sound on the app and it only works for 60 seconds. If you leave upnp on, the camera takes over port 80 and 443 (ssl) which can screw up other devices that you may have on your network (other types of cameras in my case). I hope they fix the firmware for this soon.Overall a great camera for the price. Its easy to set up if you have some knowledge of networks and the like.

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up. Motion detection isn't perfect.
Reviews.Author: PLH
Reviews.Content: Camera was easy to set up using the WPS on my Trendnet router.  Just push the button on the camera and the button on the router and it was connected.  Purchased the camera with the purpose of emailing photos when motion is detected.  Setting up the email is fairly easy, but finding motion detection settings that work during daylight hours and night(with plenty of lighting) is impossible.  I have to either turn on and off the email function, or change the sensitivity twice a day. Many purchasers have requested a software mod that would allow the email function to be turned on and off based on the time of day, but it hasn't happened.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: AmazonGuy
Reviews.Content: The wireless range is terrible. Totally unusable inside the house 15-20 feet away(different rooms). The setup is really easy and the camera is very easy to use. The image quality at its best is still pretty bad... 2 starts for a low quality camera but yet easy to use

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: TechShopper1 "TechShopper1"
Reviews.Content: Writing this review after 3 months of use. We bought this product to watch our baby sleep at night & it's been a great tool in helping reduce our anxiety level. Love the flexibility of watching our baby from our laptops, iPhone, Android & iPad. The recording streamed to NAS is wonderful in capturing precious moments (ie 1st roll) & figuring out baby's sleep patterns at night. We highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Momma is Watching ...
Reviews.Author: CocoThe Slug
Reviews.Content: We use this as a nanny cam/ baby monitor and it works great! We had no problem setting it up and now we watch it on our iPhone, iPad, Kindle Fire, and Droid phone. I cannot tell you how much I enjoy watching the streaming video, it's an obsession. The audio isn't great, there's a lot of static, but the image is fabulous. The night vision feature is a MUST. I move the camera into different rooms depending on what I want to watch while I'm away. I'm having a plumber do some work while I'm out and I feel comfortable having him there alone because I can watch his every move. This camera is must-have for working people who want to keep an eye on their household.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel P Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera to view a robins nest in my backyard. It's located under an eave, so it's protected from the elements. The camera is mounted about 6 inches from the nest and I am very satisfied. The camera is located about 30 feet from my wireless router, and there is a 16" think stone wall, plus 2 windows between them. The camera streams live continuously. There are occasional pauses in the stream for buffering. The audio is acceptable. I can hear planes flying overhead, and birds chirping. It's not hifi, but acceptable for the price point. It's not a rugged device, and is designed for indoors. It only works in daylight, and the mydlink portal works great.

Reviews.Title: Does nothing it says it does.
Reviews.Author: Ruth "Urth81"
Reviews.Content: Its supposed to connect on your wireless network with just the push of a button, but it never would.  Even when I followed the more complex instructions I came up short.  I'm not a computer guru, but I know my way around a keyboard and finally just had to find a place that had a ethernet cord.As for the video feed, I have an iPhone and an iPad and both aps just shut down every 1-3 minutes for no reason.  I've done updates, I've re-installed and it will not work.  So then I try to go online to use their site.  There it tells me that a java update needs to happen to see video, even after I've just updated everything like they asked.  I can not get a working video from the darn thing.Spend a few extra bucks and get something that is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn good!
Reviews.Author: Faster Than You
Reviews.Content: Most of the time I complain about stuff I buy on amazon, but this day/night ip cam is actually pretty fantastic. I' have a bunch of d-link cams, and this is the only one that actually works as promised. The refresh rate is around 20-30fps and it sees in the dark. Perfect, and works well with icam for the iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Overall excellent camera
Reviews.Author: TB "TB"
Reviews.Content: I have 5 of these cameras - some connected wirelessly and some wired.  The day time and night time pictures are excellent.  And they work with the popular Blue Iris camera software.  The DviewCam software that is bundled with these cameras is ok but it only works with Dlink cameras so if you have other brands on your network, you need to use something else.The only big negative for me is if you set motion detection on the camera itself and have it email you photos when motion is detected, you will get a lot of emails between the transition from day time to night time.  The reason is when the IR sensors kick in for night vision, it sets off the motion detection in the camera. The only workaround to this is to either set a schedule for when motion detection happens (not acceptable to me as I need motion detection all the time) or set the camera to night mode all the time.  This essentially keeps the IR sensors on so there is no transition.  The bad part of that is you will always get black and white type images even in the day time.The Blue Iris software is an overall better workaround to this problem.  Simply don't turn on motion detection on the camera but rather have Blue Iris do the detection.  This solves the problem.  But of course requires the purchase of additional software which is why this gets 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Poor Wireless
Reviews.Author: rgyulee
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 DSC-920 Camera for a few years now, both running 24/7 outside and they have been great.  So I wanted to add a few new cameras and have the ability to monitor them with my smartphone and the MyDlink app. So I ordered 2 DSC-930L and have run them (indoors) for about 3 months and they have been fine.  Today I decided to move one to my closed in porch to replace one of my 920's.  Well the 930L would not connect to my wireless system.  I tried both of my 930L cameras and neither would connect.  I had them setting right next to the connected 920 camera.  I checked the wireless strength on the 920 and had 66%, I connected a network cable to the new 930L so I could check its wireless strength and it as 10%.  Now I am not pushing it with distance here, this camera is only 25 feet from my wireless router.So if you expect to use wireless to connect to your camera and your more than 20 foot away from your router/access point don't bother with theses 930L models (or the 932L which also does have any distance).  My older DSC-920 cameras are about the same size as the newer 930L, but the older 920's have a 3 inch antenna on them where the 930L does not.  While the HTML interface on both the 920 and the 930L looks the same, the MyDlink Site will not recognize my two 920's.I have been a faithful user of DLink products for years, but I am disappointed with the new 930L and 932L cameras.

Reviews.Title: Awful audio, great video.
Reviews.Author: R. Powell
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a baby monitor. The video is great, the audio has AWFUL static/pops/hisses. After doing research, apparently DLINK is aware but refuses to address the issue. I cannot recommend as a baby monitor for this reason.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Silver M "mhk1999"
Reviews.Content: Got two of these to watch my deteriorating dog while I was at work and while on vacation when a sitter watched my dog. It was comforting to be able to physically see the dog and be sure he was safe. The camera was relatively easy to set up wirelessly and works perfectly. As the view gets farther from the camera it blurs up a little but is still viewable. When our power went out, the camera came back up automatically after the power was restored.

Reviews.Title: Not so easy to install
Reviews.Author: D. Casey
Reviews.Content: They claim the setup is easy.  When trying to connect it to my router, it shut it down and reset my router settings.  Once I contacted Cisco regarding my router and got it back up online I tried loading the software that came on the CD with the camera and the software won't even come up properly, I keep getting some 'script error'.  You can only email support and their reply was to update the firmware and one of the steps to do that is to type in the IP address of my camera into the web browser with no explanation of what that means or how I find out what the IP address is.  I wouldn't bother unless you have a networking degree.If I ever get it up and running, I'll update.UPDATE:  Ok, it turned out it was my computer.  We think the virus software was causing the software to not load properly.  I do have it working now but I also had to update the firmware which the average joe just can't do.  And it did turn out they had an 800 number to help but its not easily found.  THe bottom line is for some it will be as easy as 1,2,3 to get it working but for others, if your computer, router, etc. is not the latest and greatest you probably will have issues and will have to work on it for several hours.

Reviews.Title: Works great and REALLY easy to connect.
Reviews.Author: Luis D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I had one of this camera already in use at my home and needed an extra one for the back porch, I bough a second one. Easy to install and picture is not too big but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: software terrible
Reviews.Author: kahalstead
Reviews.Content: computer- hp with intel i3 and windows 7 64bit.The camera was easy to set up. Mydlink works fine, again easy.Video is good both night and day.dview cam software doesn't work for recording, main reason i want such a camera. Tried several installations, downloaded latest version from d-link, etc. Started hanging up and i could not close the program without going to task mangager.I have never had success with any d-link product, there record continues.

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy. Installed in 10 minutes
Reviews.Author: JT
Reviews.Content: A fun and easy-to-install camera with a sharp, black and white video in low light and color image during daylight.  The included install CD walks you through the quick process from setting up the camera to registering on their website to be able to remotely view the camera.  Some of the other reviews are accurate as there is interference with the audio at times.  Upon registering I did have to hit refresh 3x for their website to detect my camera.  It installed an update and I was on my way.  Overall, the device serves its purpose for us as a pet cam we can access when traveling.

Reviews.Title: good but does have some issues
Reviews.Author: Jacob S. "Suade907"
Reviews.Content: I gotta say I'm kind of impressed. In a bright room the image quality is fantastic. In low light it's just so so. On mine audio was disabled by default and the resolution was set to 320x240, but it's easy enough to sign in to the IP address and tweak the settings.  I did notice however the audio is pretty bad, it's crackly and cuts in and out on most of my devices. Also the android app is pretty bad. The free app only gets you 60 seconds of video at a time and crashes often. There is a pay version but reviews state it's buggier than the free version although I have not tried it yet. For the money I'd buy a couple more if I had the change.Edit: 5-21-2012. I bought two more cameras over the weekend. They are all setup now. I have to say the camera mounts are pretty nice. I was able to mount one under my kitchen cabinets with no trouble whatsoever. The mount comes apart and has a spot for small screws and then you can just flip the camera if mounting upside down. The camera pc configuration while painless does take a little while. But it's so well done I have no complaints. Once again I had to go in and crank the video up to 640x480, no biggie though.I bought the android pay app. For my tablet it's a great app giving you multiple camera views but with only one active at a time. It works very well and you can even take snapshots. On my phone though the pay app needs some work. I cannot go full screen, it fills half the screen and then fills the other half with your other cameras. They need to fix that. You should be able to go full screen. But overall I'm very happy and have a easy way to check in on my kids while they are being watched by their grandma.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: kellyh
Reviews.Content: I have really been enjoying my d link. For the price it works great. I like the phone app. Cannot get it to work wirelessly though. But may be user error.

Reviews.Title: NOT RECORD AT ALL ...
Reviews.Author: Man M H
Reviews.Content: Poor picture resolution , advance set up only for computer expert , good for baby or pet remote view .No graba video ,mal sonido , mala resolucion de la imagen , muy dificil de configurar , solo un experto en computacion lo puede hacer . Solo es buena para vigilar al bebe o al perro. D-link DCS 932-L.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: darthstallion
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera on 3/28 and it arrived to my house on 3/29. Didn't even pay for 1 day shipping! Thanks Amazon!! Anyways, It literally took 5 Mins out of the box to set it up. I plugged in the power, pressed a button on the back of the camera, pressed a button on my router, and Presto!!! It was set up. The set up wizard for D link is very easy too. I installed this camera with the mounting screws it came with and use it as a baby Monitor. Its Perfect! I can see Great in the dark with it. Wouldn't even know the light was off in the babies room. I used my I phone set into my I Home alarm clock to listen and view my baby through the night. It does have a little static sound but if you turn the volume down a little bit you can hardly notice it. The Camera Pics up sound very well so it does not need to be set that high anyways. I also love the snap shot feature. You can take pics of the little one sleeping even in the dark. I would Recommend this as a baby monitor to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought Two Works Only One
Reviews.Author: Soprano "Tony"
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm not a computer expert.  I installed and configured the cameras and both were working well.  Very soon in my laptop, both ask me to update the firmware.  Once both were updated, one of them was working and the other one went blink.  I had tried to start from the beginning, and nothing, even tried to reset the camera, and nothing worked.  I wrote d-link to advise me what else to do, and they said that was my fault because I, "for sure", interrupted the update of the camera and that was the action that damage it, and this was not under the warranty.  They assumed inmediatelly that I did it and that was my fault, even without prompt me for more solutions. I have rated with two stars only because the only one that is working, I can see it from my iPhone everywhere, but I lost $90

Reviews.Title: disappointed by this product
Reviews.Author: The V reader
Reviews.Content: Well, I was excited to have purchased this, and here were my reasons:1. I wanted a product that can be managed in a network environment wireless/wired2. Ability to remote access it through smartphone or just an online location3. Capable of capturing images instead of video all the time4. Night vision5. design was pretty nice - I personally don't like the ones with antennas...However, I immediately started realizing it is not a great product as advertised or described.Here are some of the problems I faced (some right off the bat and others through my testing):1. The installation doesn't work - the software on the CD just does not detect the camera.  Without it, you cannot register your product with myDlink.com and access it remotely and through a Smartphone - this was a major reason for me to purchase this product...2. If you open a browser and have multiple tabs with one being the camera's IP address, then if your session expires, trying to access the camera will crash your browser.  You need to always close all tabs, and reopen the browser so it doesn't crash.3. When setting up an email notifications based on motion detection, they do not allow you to control the number of pictures per email... only 1 image/email or 6.  And there is a lag of 4-5 seconds between sets of email, so when I was testing it, I was walking normal speed, so I see myself walking then I disappear from the second set, unless I move slowly and allow it to lag between sets of 6 pictures.4. Motion detection is very sensitive, and it takes a trial-and-error type of setup to adjust to your proper setting that allows just the right amount of activity to trigger screen captures.5. I was never able to test a server setup (FTP feature).6. The camera clicks every once in a while (similar to a shutter in a photography camera) which I think when it switches between nightvision and day time.7. The night vision seems to always be on when in auto mode, even when it is bright outside - resorted to setting up a schedule8. Audio had a lot of static - I tried to turn off the audio but didn't work until I upgraded the FW on it... therefore, audio is not something I can make use of.All that said, I want to provide a few positives:1. Screen captures (despite of what I wrote above) are actually quite decent.  I linked to my gmail account and I was able to receive all the motion detected.2. Once you obtain access to the Camera (through your router's assigned IP) then you are able to control the camera.3. The wireless works fine, and wired works good.4. Night vision is actually pretty good to show details (black and white of couse).I purchased it with a lot of anticipation but the product fell short of my expectations and of what was described about its capabilities.  I could've spent hours and probably days investigating how to get the camera registered, but I felt that a product that requires so much work is not worth keeping.I returned it!

Reviews.Title: DLink Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Louis J. Perna "Lou"
Reviews.Content: Camera was a dissappoint in it's lack of pan & tilt and poor picture resolution. The remote viewing software & DLink site did not work well for me. The camera also picked up too much glass (window) reflections. When I purchased it I knew it lacked pan & tilt but thought I could live with it for the cost and the remote viewing capability. But the remote view did not work well for me and the poor picture resolution plus the lack of pan & tilt led me to return the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Easy Installation
Reviews.Author: Miss Kitty "Biker Chick"
