Reviews.Content: I was worried when I purchased this product after reading previous reviews.  This product fell in my price range and came highly recommended by several blogger friends of ours.  We had no issues with installation and had the camera installed in less than 20 minutes, and the wireless set up was even easier.  The night vision clicks on when the camera is in low light, which we didn't feel was an issue.  The audio is also super clear for us.  We are really glad we purchased this.

Reviews.Title: Uverse and setup - it works but what a hassle
Reviews.Author: TXGREG
Reviews.Content: Why we want a camera like this to:- monitor our home as we travel frequently- monitor outside so we can see who is at our front door or creeping around the garage driveway- monitor at nighttime as well as daytimeCameras bought to date - 1Thinking of buying in total - 3 or 4Overall impressions after 18 hours of useSetup - worried that it took my whole network down, otherwise straight forwardGood live feed to both laptop and android appNighttime feed looks goodEmail/FTP of images is quick, almost instantWould I prefer video clips to be used instead of images? Sure, but not a deal killer at the moment. (I use Camtasia to convert to video)See example of medium jpeg quality. [Is this link allowed?)[...]3/14/12I'm writing this during set up mode as I'm waiting for the camera's firmware to be updated.I have a Uverse internet connection with an integrated wireless router.I follow instructions to use the Ethernet cable as opposed to WPS (which I have never used with this Uverse box and I don't want another learning curve)Guess what happens? It takes my whole network down. What device does that? So I have a run around to reset the network. Anyway in the end the camera is connected through wireless, the MyDlink account is created and activated and I can see a picture from the camera. Great! I finish the setup unplug the camera, position it where I want it to be, plug it in, there it is on the network. I go to MyDlink and ... it needs a new version of java. I shut down IE8, Chrome, Firefox and wait for java to install. Done that? Good, lets watch the camera. Open up Firefox, log into MyDlink and ... no picture because it has to update the camera's firmware. Why couldn't it have done this in setup? I dismount the camera, bring it back upstairs, attach the Ethernet cable, I check my router devices, there it is and I click 'update'. 10 minutes later it's still updating.update 3/15/12The first firmware update failed, I took note of the manual link, but tried once more with the auto update and this time it worked.Settings:Even though the 'connect to internet' failed on the initial setup I had no problems setting my email and FTP to receive images.I connected the date/time to the Dlink server, but it is showing Central time, not Central Daylight Savings Time, so all the timestamps are an hour behind.Motion detection. Very sensitive, I'm experimenting with the sensitivity levels. It's good how you can select areas of the camera which can detect motion.Watch through web browser or android app?On the web browser I can zoom, but cannot mute the sound. Here you would have access to all your other cameras which is very convenient.I much prefer the android app (Dlink Lite). You can zoom, mute the sound, watch in full screen. it's very responsive.First camera review,indoors, subject: bearded dragon in it's cage.The camera has what seems to be a decent enough wide angle. For indoors the zoom seems pointless and it appears very pixelated.We used this in both day and night settings. (BTW The dragon sleeps at night, all we saw were the live crickets wondering around the cage. There was no direct lighting, only indirect light from the streetlamp outside and our family room lights.).Next tests:- zero light at night- use outdoors

Reviews.Title: Comments
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: It a very good device and can help you in a easily way to monitor anything you want. Easy config and run.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - but check your router first.
Reviews.Author: Chip Lohman
Reviews.Content: March 8, 2012: I've worked with D-Link since October. In late January the issue was finally escalated to 3rd tier support. After 4 weeks of sending them config files from my cameras and router, they decided the cameras can't work with the FIOS router and recommended I buy the D-Link DIR 655 router, raising concerns of how FOIS will act. While the instructions claim all that is needed is a router that supports UPnP (which the FIOS Router does), there are apparently issues with the way the FIOS ports are dynamically assigned. All this means that with my ActiveX FIOS Router, I get only intermittent access through my Android phone.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Abhilash Kushwaha
Reviews.Content: I was actually impressed by how easy and painless the setup was. All I had to was pop in the CD and everything worked fine. I was actually able to set it up using wireless, which was a pleasant surprise since most of products I have seen usually need wired connection set up. I use it with Blue Iris software to record the stream to my PC and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Great value Easy set up.
Reviews.Author: C. mccormick
Reviews.Content: I bought mine at Staples for $110.00 with tax. It was easy to set up and gives a nice picture. In low light the picture is gray scale and color with high light. You can view the camera from your Android or Iphone, Mac or PC. The sound is horrible with lots of static. You can take snap shots, have motion activated pictures emailed to your phone or computer, zoom. and several other options. You can turn off the led night vision lights.I mounted mine inside a vintage transistor radio to use as a nanny cam.

Reviews.Title: Easy Set-up
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This was really easy to set-up.  I initially configured the camera wired and then set-it up using my wifi.  It isnt the best quality video but I only needed it for an overview of the house.  The ability to view via a cell phone or computer was excellent and easy and the audio is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: Good quality picture. Setup should be improved
Reviews.Author: erakauf
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to monitor my kids room during night hours.While installing the camera using the provided disk, it took me few 2-3 hours to understand product wifi doesn't support Channel-12... apparently this was my wifi configuration, which I had to modify.MyDlink iPhone app working very nice and fast.Medium sound quality, yet do the job.night vision works very good.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: H.T.
Reviews.Content: i've researched online to see which brand to purchase for an ip camera. i've purchased to check up on my dogs while we're away. It has colors when there's lights. It shows black and white when it's dark. My only problem with the ip camera is the quality of the images. I watch it through my iphone 4s. It's not that bad but it's just that i can see the pixels rather than a smooth image. but over all you can see clear of where is where. i mean by you can tell you're looking at a desk in the image. I can also see my dogs walking around. another cool thing is I can take pictures at the moment. the d-link app works well too. im not really good at setting these kind of things, dont have much knowledge in that area but i was still able to set it up. so i give a 4 star for because it is a good product. I didnt give 5 stars because of the image quality. but i would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Cannot set motion sensor alert on a schedule
Reviews.Author: Office User
Reviews.Content: I got this IP camera for home security when I am at work. Unfortunately its firmware does not support setting a schedule for its motion sensor alert feature. You have a choice of either motion sensor on at all times (even while you are at home), or send you pictures on a schedule at fixed intervals (when nothing is going on.) They need to marry the 2 features together so the unit can be of some real use.Besides that major shortcoming, the unit works great and easy to access with Android, Iphone and PCs.

Reviews.Title: Maybe for a dark room
Reviews.Author: Saltman
Reviews.Content: This camera practically blanks out all details if you have a combination of light and dark.  If for example you try to get images of a room with a door or a window in teh frame, forget  it - the window will become a white square, and everything around it will be too dark to disceren.Rteurned it to the store I purchased it from - Tripplenet Pricing - and they were amazing - dedicated, fast and caring customer care.  I will definitely try to get more stuff from them.

Reviews.Title: Make sure to use a Windows XP computer for setup
Reviews.Author: DWF
Reviews.Content: Good camera overall, 1 caveat with setup though. Windows 7 won't (easily) allow the user (admin or not) to lower security settings low enough to for the d-link software to install its activeX controls to complete the camera setup. I tried 3 different Windows 7 PCs (1 32-bit, 2 64-bit) all with the same problem. As soon as I instead used my older Windows XP laptop for install, it was up and running in less than 5 minutes. Camera itself is very clear, very small delay between capture and display over the internet or Android/iOS app. No port forwarding settings required for internet access.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.. once it's set up...
Reviews.Author: Matthew A. Sutton "The Godfather"
Reviews.Content: 1st: Once I set this thing up, it's awesomeness came through. It can see in the low light wonderfully, has a solid microphone and it has a better video refresh/frame rate than webcams. Very quick viewing. I love that it taps in to my wireless network and is the perfect baby monitor for the 21st Century.2nd: Setup was a pain. I don't have a CD-rom on my laptop, so I downloaded the software from the website. The thing would install the required activeX controls to complete the initial setup. However, once I used one of my towers and a direct ethernet connection, installation was a snap. My recommendation is that once you get it, connect it to your network with the ethernet cable and run the CD setup. It'll hook into your wireless connection very easily afterwards and all should be well.4 Stars for the install headaches I dealt with, but otherwise, a great product. I plan to buy several more to create my own personal surveillance system for my house.

Reviews.Title: 932 L
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: I like this camera but my 932L is not in real-time. I like the convenience of accessing it from my iPhone but I wish it were in real time, it seems it is delayed when I walk in front of it. It worked perfectly when I got it a month ago but it no longer is.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: This is a great entry to mid level camera.Picture quality: 8/10Ease of initial set up: 9/10Monitoring live view: 10/10Recording set up: 8/10Setting preferences and customizing: 8.5/10Reviewing footage: 9/10When you factor in the price, it's easily a 9/10 overall. No drawbacks at all. If you are afraid of computers, you'll still be able to get this set up and running. If you are proficient on the computer, this camera will be even better. There are a ton of available settings and customizations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Terrible customer service !! (unable to view from iPhone)
Reviews.Author: San Diego Customer
Reviews.Content: Cameras themselves work pretty well, but D-Link is supposed to send an email to confirm an account to view remotely (i.e., iphone).  THEY DON'T SEND THE EMAILS!  I've spent 2 weeks trying to get more than an automated, cut-and-paste answer from their tech support.  No luck!  So, decent product but the remote feature is unproven and D-link doesn't care!

Reviews.Title: Easy setup - Droid App results Spotty
Reviews.Author: Kevin White "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: I found this easy to set up and get working on the network (I hard -wired it).  It looked great on the computer, but I really wanted to use it on my Droid phone.  The results were so so over 3G.  Sometimes it was OK but sometimes it just showed a blank screen.  I would say it is fine for using as a camera to view from a computer, but perhaps not ready for prime time on a Droid yet - may have been due to cell coverage though so may work better for you.

Reviews.Title: Horrible service, makes me think horrible company.
Reviews.Author: August
Reviews.Content: So I just bought this camera.  After a little trouble I was able to get it to connect via a wireless connection to my home network and see video on my PC.  Could never get it to work remotely, either by setting up a D-Link account or using port forwarding.  This was the whole reason I bought the cam.There is absolutely no reason I should have had to waste 2 hours of my time on the phone with an under qualified support person.  I'll do my best to never buy a D-Link product again, and this cam is going back to the store tomorrow whether or not I can get a refund.I think the high point was that after explaining I had a desktop computer and the camera was connected to my home network via a wireless connection, I had to emphasize that no, my desktop did not have to have a wireless connection even though the camera was communicating using wireless technology.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...Not so great setup...
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these 8 months ago and setup was a breeze and performance has been flawless.  Bought two more and had a great deal of difficulty in getting them to work wirelessly.  Finally figured out that they had to be set up as wired and then changed to wireless in the Advanced settings on MyDlink.com...not difficult, but maybe more than the average non-techie would be comfortable with.Buy accordingly.Update (12/25/2012): We now have seven of these around our Lakehouse. Rarely have any trouble with connectivity...however, updating the firmware is a pain because they have to be done manually one at a time...from a wired connection.Also, we have two of them outside under the eaves of the house...never had any difficulty with them being exposed to the heat and cold.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work at first, but it worked later
Reviews.Author: Hello
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat tech savvy person, but I had issues with this camera.Auto-magically, the issues were gone and it works now, and I love it.Cons - The setup is bit confusing. I connected the camera to my router and went to the web address and it worked in wired mode. I configured the wireless while it was connected and it didn't work once i unplug the Ethernet from back of the camera. So I popped in the CD, and went through the setup, and same thing, it worked wired, but not wireless. after about 4 or 5 setup runs it worked. Not really sure what happened. I have Fios wireless router, that may have been issue. not sure.The final steps to make it work - i re-started the process, reset the camera from the back (there is a tiny button, hold it with a safety-pin till it goes from green to red and resets it self) Popped the CD, followed the steps. manually went to the ip address of the camera and created the wireless setup there. unplugged it from the router and it power cycle and it worked. I'm not really sure what didn't work earlier and what worked later.- I did sign up for [...] and checked it out and it works.- Also, have it on the iPhone app, $4.99 which is ridicules. It's a tiny picture, can't use the whole screen of the iPhone to view the picture. there may be a way to do it, I haven't found it yet. Also, ATT 3G is very slow, so unless you've got wifi the video is more like blur images. over the wifi, it works good. Don't waste the money, just sign up for free mydlink and you'll be able to log in from any pc, haven't tried on iphone that way yet.- this is my 2nd wireless camera, i have the older linksys wireless g camera, the picture quality is better in this one. i don't use my linksys anymore, i only used that for about 2 weeks.- I haven't tired the other features yet. For now it's got video, and i can log-in and see what's going on.Cons - the setup could have been simpler. when i first installed my Linksys, there was a chat button and they walked me through, it was nice. I wish D-link would do the same. I still don't know why it didn't work the first time.Pro - so far I like it a lot. it does what i need it to do. I will need 1 or 2 more, and I may buy the same or the newer/higher models in future. Night vision is not needed for this setup, but for the next one I may need to go for a higher model for night vision.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Easy setup
Reviews.Author: R. Martin
Reviews.Content: This camera is well built and has good functionality. It is easy to get set up and working. I have this one and the night vision version.

Reviews.Title: Sleepless nights
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Poteet "Rockdweller"
Reviews.Content: I usually limit my electronic devices to one sleepless night.  I think of my self as average savvy when it comes to electronics but this little critter is a nightmare.  The setup disc is pretty straight forward but it only goes so far.  I had a video stream within just a few moments but it turned out to be not much more than a web cam.  No wireless to my router.  No settings of any kind on dlink. No motion detection.  Nothing.  So all I can say is take these reviews like a grain of salt and take your chances but just beware that a lot of us do have problems.  If the setup disc worked as advertized than this would be a breeze but believe me it didn't work that way.  It's on it's way back today and I'm sure I'll be cautious of any security camera after this experience.  I'll stick to game cameras for my security.I must admit that I never tried to get any support from the company on this but than why should you have to go thru someone else to set up something that should be simple enough anyway.  And I understand that you have to pay for air time on product support?  That's a bummer!I actually feel bad to give products a bad rating but at the same time I don't like to see people throw their money out there for products that aren't as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: SM
Reviews.Content: Very good product for this price, except for the night mode is not supported.I still do not understand how to set up a motion detector.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Mack69pa
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product a week ago and it works great. I found it was easy to get hooked up. I believe the bad reviews are mostly because of who was setting them up. LOL Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great value security camera
Reviews.Author: Rainforest biker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I was very pleased with the DCS-930 but needed the infrared (night time) capability. These are great little cameras, easy to hook up, relatively decent support including periodic firmware and software updates. Overall, a great value and highly recommended. And- get the iPad and iPhone apps!

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson "Carlos"
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this product overall.  It's simple to set up and simple to use.  The motion sensitivity settings are a little touchy, but I'll figure it out.  The free Android app for my Thunderbolt works great.

Reviews.Title: Affordable and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: PDot4
Reviews.Content: An affordable wireless security cam. Setting up the WIFI and on-line viewing is simple.  I am very pleased with the first one and may purchase a few more for the entire house.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I purchased a few of these to monitor a pet during the day, and they work great, both with the computer and the iphone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. I love that it works with smartphones as well and that d-link is even making improvements to the app on a semi-regular basis. It's easy to setup and troubleshoot and after it's setup, it's just plug & go wherever you want around the house!!!

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: JaimeH
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this!  My husband and I are constantly traveling.  When one of us is home the other one is typically gone.  We have a 5 month old daughter at home and we were missing see here.  We purchased this and now can just can log into the dlink app on our IPhone and see her.  It's perfect and makes it feel like you are at home a little bit!  Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: W. TIMMONS
Reviews.Content: Excellent for keeping an eye on your home or business, without having to buy expensive equipment. Works good in daylight or dark.

Reviews.Title: Worst Web Cameral I have used. Never buy D-Link again
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: I saw the D-Link CS-932L in Staples in there Home Automation display and thought it was a good small camera at a decent price. I was excited to try it and ordered online.  When I received it , it took me about 15 minutes to setup as a wired camera. The video wasn't as I expected and had delayed movements even at 25 MBPS FIOS speed.  I literally wasted an entire day trying to setup the wireless feature and could not get it to work no mater what I did. I downloaded the latest firmware, reset to factory defaults 6 times still with no luck. This is my 3rd xperience with D-Link products and will never purchase a D-Link again. All three I either sent back or threw out. I sent it back and purchased a Cisco/Linksys WVC2300 webcam. Far superior camera and easy to setup right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup, but lousy picture
Reviews.Author: MrFunPants
Reviews.Content: The picture is absolutely lousy on this thing.  I got mine from the warehouse and I assume it was a return item, so I don't know if all of them are this way or if mine is just faulty.  About the only good thing I can say is it's easy to setup.

Reviews.Title: Great price and great for what I needed
Reviews.Author: ctendell
Reviews.Content: I needed cameras to have some added security during the day. I bought these retail at a local store. Setup is a breeze and if you have your own website or a free FTP server this is the perfect setup fo home monitoring. The audio works well and the email feature works like a champ. I only wish I could set the motion detection on a schedule so its only on during the day and I dont have to turn it on and off when Im at work.

Reviews.Title: Great for baby monitor
Reviews.Author: If not Now, then when? If not you, then who? ...
Reviews.Content: i got this to keep an eye on my two year old twins as they jump in their beds when they should be asleep.Pros: good night vision. good quality video. IPHONE APP!!!! Setup took about 5 min and was super easy.CONS: So far, not many. the Audio has a lot of static but volume is fine. I just need it to hear them cry.UPDATE: after a >1 yr of use, I still like this camera and bought a second one. That said, don't expect high quality images or sound. I just use this to see what the kids are doing without sticking my head in the room, which can distract them from falling asleep. Access to the camera via computer, ipad, iphone, is great.

Reviews.Title: The best you can get for the price.
Reviews.Author: Rafael Sang "niQue"
Reviews.Content: The best you can get for the price. Theres no other network camera at this price even remotely close to being this good. If this is your budget, go for it. Nightvision is very sharp, audio works great (with a little static but not as loud as people say it is) and it allows you to do many things via myDlink website.

Reviews.Title: Once setup - its not bad
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A.
Reviews.Content: I had quite a bit of difficulty setting this up, even following the directions explicitly AND using a D-link Branded router. Tech Support was able to make some online changes and it finally connected. Once setup it works fine. The picture is better than expected but still not perfect. I mainly used it to keep an eye on some new puppies and also will use it when using a pet sitter that is not my regular one, just to ensure I know when they come and go.Cheap plastic, so be careful with it.

Reviews.Title: Good, not great, device for the money.
Reviews.Author: The Count "Computers/Tools/Guns/Knives"
Reviews.Content: Got this cam instead of a Foscam which was just impossible to get to send out emails when the motion detector trips. This device is pretty nice looking and does not have an antenna sticking out. I use Macs and I had no real trouble getting the Dlink setup using their 'wizard' which essentially lets you view live video through the mydlink.com website. If you are not experienced with network settings thats the ONLY way to go. However, I just wanted to test that approach and then manually configure the cam so I can log in directly from the internet using a little used port (something like 8089). I did get the mailer to send emails though my Gmail account, which some other cams cannot do. Here is the setting that worked for me: SMTP Server Address  SMTP.GMAIL.COM SMTP Server Port: 587 Sender and Receiver email address: Your gmail address Your gmail user name and password Select STARTTTLSYou will probably have to open port 587 on your router to the cams internal IP address! I think the default is 192.168.0.20Not giving more than 3 stars because the video quality could be better. In low light the picture looks B/W, no colors. Anything further than 5 feet from the cam is slightly blurry.

Reviews.Title: 2 And Done
Reviews.Author: Dale Morella
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first one and the camera would not automatically switch between day and night vision.  It stayed on night vision only.  The only way I could get it to switch was to do it manually through the cumbursome IP Address setup screen, but it still would not change automatically.  I called D-Link and they said they'd replace it.  Litle did I know that I actually had to fill out all the paperwork.  It wasn't that big of a deal, but painful when I just gave them all the information.  Shouldn't a technology company have the technology to click "Create RMA"?  Anyways, I got a new monitor in the mail, and this one won't attach to my wireless network.  To pour salt on the wound, D-Link is making me pay for the shipping!!  What a crock!  You have a bad, defective product and you're making your customers pay to return it to you so you can "fix" it?  Well, out of principle, I returned the wireless router (D-Link).  If they don't want to take care of their customers, then I don't want to be a customer of theirs.  Oh yeah, this network camera sucks!

Reviews.Title: It does keep an eye on your home
Reviews.Author: GEM
Reviews.Content: Giving it 4/5 despite some features not working as expected because I was able to do what I wanted: keep an eye on my home while on vacation.- I was able to easily set it up w/o dlink account  after reading several helpful reviews on this board and google.  That's because of privacy concerns, but it is very possible that the emails with picture attachments still reach me via the dlink servers. Couldn't figure out if that's the case.- I was able to remotely login via the browser on my iPhone and watch the "live video" and change settings.- Not really live video because the iPhone doesn't have java or activex. Just refresh the browser but that's all I needed.- For the same reason, no audio.- Both movie and audio work on a Mac though since you can enable java (grainy and static).- Night mode works fine.- Motion activation and email works fine.  Looks like it is triggered by comparison of successive snapshots (rather that infrared like the standard motion detectors). That's good since it kept sending emails when my timers switched the light on/off.  On the other hand, it kept sending hundreds of emails during storms or cloudy days as the room would suddenly go dark.  I had to remotely disable emails at times.  Also, I had to set the sensitivity to 50 rather than original 90 because it was flooding me with emails for no reason (no motion or change in luminosity).- WEIRD.  When setting up the mail, I had to leave the sendmail password empty, because the server wouldn't accept it. I have the same email account set on several computers and devices, and sending mail always requires my password!!!- BAD.  Wireless does not work. I had to hook it to the router. Maybe because the network password was too long and complicated, but I was not willing to weaken security because of the weakest link.

Reviews.Title: Unable to setup with OSX Lion (Updater needs an update)
Reviews.Author: D. Yamaguchi
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera today. Downloaded installer from d-link. The updater tells me to update the wizard. There is no update. Lion has been available for over a month with betas available for months before the official launch.Why isn't there even a status description of the updater? Not very reassuring.I now have LED-lit $90 paperweight.Will update review once the updater is updated.I purchased the 932 because I love the 930, but wished for better lowlight imaging. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic at first
Reviews.Author: Amber Nicole Steward "Nickiemay"
Reviews.Content: We have had the camera for a few weeks now, and we placed it in the nursery to keep an eye on our daughter while she sleeps. We can see her so well we can even monitor her breathing at night! We can check on her while we're away and we have family babysitting her because it's compatible with our android phones. Set up was a bit of a pain because we wanted it wireless, but after we finally got it set up it worked perfect. The audio is great, however it does crackle a little over our computer. It's crystal clear when she's crying or talking, so the crackling isn't a big issue. We even used our phones to see where the camera was aiming to get it aimed perfect. Wouldn't recommend another camera.UPDATE: We've had this camera for a while now, and unfortunately our opinions have changed drastically. This camera causes major networking issues, and conflicts with many other things on our network. After a few problems, the camera simply stopped syncing, and now we can't even use the D-Link program on the phone or computer - we have to view it directly from the web or other programs. We called D-Link and they said the problem is only fixed by replacing the camera all together :( So, unfortunately, it was great until it started arguing with our network, and now we have replaced it with a different brand that doesn't rely on the internet at all. Very disappointed that it turned out so poorly.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable
Reviews.Author: JamesGH "itzhak37"
Reviews.Content: Camera would send pictures to my e-mail account when it sensed motion, but it would not stream live - on my Chrome, Firefox, Safari or iPhone app, inside or outside the same wireless network, and I could not wirelessly access the camera settings. When I disconnected and reconnected the power supply, the problem would be solved for another 5 minutes. This problem existed both before and after I updated the firmware.I cannot imagine the issue was distance from the router, as the camera and router were fewer than 5 feet apart, with no obstructions.I suppose I could try all the work around measures mentioned in the D-Link forums, but I bought this D-Link product because it was user friendly. When the ease of use disappeared, so did the value of the product.Camera on its way back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Can't Get it To Connect Wirelessly
Reviews.Author: Candace M. Decou
Reviews.Content: Am on my second item after first return of this and we cannot get it connected wirelessly.  It works well enough with the LAN cable, but I wanted wireless, so for now I have to give this a less-than-satisfied rating.  Tech Support helped the first time but said to return it.  Second item responds exactly like the first and I have not re-contacted Tech Support for help yet. I don't think anything is wrong with the unit, I believe it's something screwy with my W7 setup that I haven't figured out yet.  So I am basically still in the process of trying to figure out how to get it set up correctly.

Reviews.Title: About the same as a DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: J2014G
Reviews.Content: About the only difference I could tell is the 932 has 4 IR LEDs to illuminate an area up to maybe 5 feet in front of the camera. The specs on the light sensitivity specification (1 Lumen) is the same as the 930L which I also have. While the 932L is a good camera for general use under good lighting conditions, the DCS-930L is a better value IMHO.Did not notice terrible audio quality as mentioned in other posts but there is some background noise that I guess could be annoying if one wanted a totally silent background.

Reviews.Title: Works ok so far
Reviews.Author: Chuck G
Reviews.Content: I setup two of these today. Setup was fairly easy, but I'm a techno-geek. Mostly just followed the directions. So far I've got them externally viewable, including through the mydlink lite android app, and have played a bit with recording video using the D-ViewCam app.Plusses:The picture wasn't bad.Seems to be decent set of software that is included.Easy setup.Wired connection works well and provided fairly smooth videoMinuses:The jury's still out on wireless. I have one camera about 30 feet away going through a couple walls. The connection drops frequently and motion is very jerky. Perhaps the wireless network is too busy, my wife could be watching videos upstairs on her laptop. Fortunately, I have lots of cat-V wires pulled to various locations in the house in case I need to go the wired route.Followup review 2013/06/11I decided not to bother with wireless for these cameras. As I mentioned originally, I have lots of cat v runs in the house, so I've got all these hardwired to the network.I've played a bit with email alerts to confirm they work.More significantly, I am now feeding these into ZoneMinder running on a Ubuntu Linux server. I'm not too far into the setup yet, but everything's going well. I have 4 930L and one 932L cameras connected to ZoneMinder. I have a subset of them set to detect motion and record, working great. I still have more ZM setup to do, but so far the combo of low priced D-Link cameras coupled with FREE ZoneMinder and FREE Linux on a several generation old PC is working well.

Reviews.Title: Up and running with video on my iphone in less than 15 minutes
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here I was hesitant to buy this product.  I am a techy and can get most things to work but hate the hassle.  Since it was a Gold Box deal I decided to purchase and give it a try.  From the time I inserted the CD into my computer until I was watching video on my iphone was less than 15 minutes.  My 10 year old daughter could easily have successfully setup this product without any problems.  Just follow the CD exactly and you will have no issues.  The App works great on the iphone and picture quality is similar to what you would see on skype or facetime.  Not great quality but good enough to see just about everything.  If this shows up again as a Gold Box deal I will without hesitation buy another.

Reviews.Title: Dreadful
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Slow, slow, slow, slow. Did I mention it was slow? It does not matter how fast your internet connections are (mine are lightning fast) or if you are on a phone with 4g speed. It takes at least one minute to load the image, then it times out after one minute, even if you have UPNP configured on all your routers. It just does not work the way it is advertised. Very frustrating. I am going to sell this on ebay then spend the extra $20 for a professional grade wireless security camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Shadowclown
Reviews.Content: Good inexpensive camera. If you are saving directly to a network HDD (NAS) it does not save video, just a series of jpg images. Poor low light performance.

Reviews.Title: Good to keep an ey on the kids
Reviews.Author: G. Drayer "Avid reader, mom, business owner."
Reviews.Content: Great for keeping an eye on our kids while they play upstairs.  great for the price.  I wasn't looking for super good quality just enough so I could know what's going on.

Reviews.Title: Nice remote cam
Reviews.Author: Joseph W. Burkart
Reviews.Content: Received cam and had a minor problem setting up, but with a call to customer service, I was up and running in a very short time.  I have had it for a couple of weeks and so far, (except for light levels) it works great on both my android telephone and my laptop. The light sensitive issue is only a problem if you need to point it outside, works very well inside.

Reviews.Title: If you have a Mac, I have a secret ;)
Reviews.Author: SheilaE
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to go with the iCam app on my iPhone.  Had no idea if it would work, but it was the weekend, and I had time. The box told me it would work with a Mac.  The disk that came with it, however- was ALL PC :(I googled for help.  On the first page of results, I saw that D-Link had nicely placed a 5 minute video for using on a Mac system on YouTube! Yes!!!The only error I made afterwards was not placing my wireless key into the browser when it came up (I'm not too technical, I didn't realize that's what it wanted) otherwise- downloading the Mac installer, step-by-step instructions- it was awesome.I was able (using the iCam's excellent forums, which are chock full of data) to get it to run on my iPhone and iPad, along with my iMac's built in camera, using the iCam app. No audio, though -iMac is running snow leopard (don't know about Lion with this); iPhone is AT&T; with an IP starting with 166 (read the iCam forums).  I'm a happy camper! 2 camera security system in my pocket for the price of this camera, and a $5 app. Of course- when the sun goes down, unless a thief turns on all the lights, it's useless-Good luck!!!!  I'm saving for at least one night vision camera, too.

Reviews.Title: D-link DCS-932L
Reviews.Author: sharon "Osprey"
Reviews.Content: PRO:Longest unobstructed area in the house is 25-feet and even at night the picture is good. Very low light or darker room the image is not in color. Tested the camera outside pointed at my sleeping cat in the yard 30-feet away. With full zoom the cat filled the frame but detail was a little fuzzy. At 40-feet I could see my car in the driveway and down the street. Picture comes up on my computer. I wanted the camera for indoors and I am very happy with the indoor applications. There were some problems and the camera is not perfect so I gave it a 4. I think many of the problems may be specific to my equipment and didn't want to blame the camera.CON:Can't set it up in a window at night because of glass glare and only the detail of the screen is shown. Trouble seeing my yard because my neighbors porch light is visible in the yard and another outside light. Neither are very bright but the sensor thinks there is more light and the yard is all black to the camera. In the yard you can see the tables and fence, etc. Some people just set up the camera with no hassle. My set up was a beast. The first camera was defective and Amazon replaced it in one day. Thank you Amazon. The wireless would not set up and needed the Ethernet cable to the router. (Later it connected to wireless). It defaulted to the next dynamic IP address and it just would not set up with the D-link program. The password would only take 8 characters and I was not willing to change the password to all my computers, phones etc. Only way to configure it was to go into the router, set it up on the default IP address 192.X.X.20 and manually configure the connection. Afterwards the D-link software ran and I could configure the camera. Still can't configure the email in the camera software. The email is if you want it to snap motion and send the picture or pictures to email. The motion is not like a video camera but this could be my Internet or computer. It looks more like a Charlie Chaplin movie with split second delays between frames. If the cat rolls over slowly the slight delay is hardly noticeable. If the cat jumps off the chair, the motion is far more jerky like old films. This could be my Internet connection which is 1500-3000. I also have to unplug the camera when I watch Netflix movies on my ROKU. ROKU just can't get enough bandwidth to run both. The ISP provider said I should get a Static connection instead of Dynamic to end this problem. Static to Dynamic is double the price. Read all the reviews and the D-link forums. Your camera may connect instantly as most of them, but be prepared if it does not. Tech support at D-link was very good once you get past the screener who answers the phone and puts you through the trouble tree questions. Eventually it will work.

Reviews.Title: Better Resolution
Reviews.Author: RosieAndMe
Reviews.Content: Once you have your camera setup and you see the picture click on CAMERA INFO then ADVANCED SETTINGS then VIDEO RESOLUTION. The default is 320X240 if you set it to 640X480 the picture will be much improved.

Reviews.Title: Entry Level Network Cam
Reviews.Author: D. Howard
Reviews.Content: I bought this in the last lightning deal so ive had it for a few months now and I will say it's a decent product for the level they are labeling it. This means you get a no frills type of network cam.For one I never did get the "My Dlink" service to work (didn't want to anyway) and did give it a shot, but the software never wanted to recognize my camera. Because of this I set it up the way I was going to anyway which is manually and not using the dlink website at all; that process took a little bit of trial and error simply because they don't really give any instructions on not using their software (fair enough).I use this mostly for watching my dog while at work and bought two and once they are configured they work great for the basic needs im using them for; you can get sound although it won't pick up any subtle noises, it will get things like barking or howling (which I found my dog does apparently when not happy).The image quality is decent also, in a nicely lit room you can get very good detail on the cam and the FPS is pretty good if you have a good signal. I am planning on purchasing more devices to place around the house and possibly outside as these are cheap enough to be useful. Would not recommend for low light situations whatsoever as they do not have a large enough sensor and also no infrared or any of that kind of stuff.Overall I give it a 7 as it does everything stated and is a good jumping point to get started.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: Camera works well on PC from anywhere you have an internet connection using mydlink - no need to mess with network/router/modem settings.Daylight viewing is very good, night viewing is poor but adequate, sound is good.Android app works well, but sound on the app would be a definite plus.Previously tried Trendnet & Lorex, but Dlink has the simplest setup in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised
Reviews.Author: A. Goodman
Reviews.Content: this was pretty easy to set up.  Did have to install ActiveX and Java, however, once all that was finished it works as described.  I did not have to call tech support to get it working.  Thinking about buying another one.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For the Price
Reviews.Author: Richard L. "Richard"
Reviews.Content: If you want something more then a straight forward surveillance camera with night vision you probably should spend much, much more and look elsewhere.  For what it is intended for I'm very pleased and am looking to add more cameras.  Set up was easy and the emailed motion activated pictures worked great.  Didn't use the audio this time.

Reviews.Title: DCS-930L
Reviews.Author: Workaholic
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. (Even I could do it!) I use it as a puppy monitor when I am at work. Nice to be able to check in. Even though there is a delay in the live feed, it gives me an idea of what is going on. Just wish that the cell phone app came with audio feed also. I hear that this may be coming in the next release. I am keeping my fingers crossed.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Systems DCS-932L mydlink-Enabled Wireless N Day/Night Home Network Camera
Reviews.Author: In the AmaZone...
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed overall with this camera.  I found it easy to set up, easy to use and easy to access remotely using all the default setup parameters. While the audio quality is lacking in my opinion, it doesn't have much effect on my primary use for this camera, and I keep the audio disabled most of the time anyway.I am using this camera on a Linksys N wireless network, serving both Win XP and Win 7 PCs.  I completed the initial installation, including the MyDlink registration in about 15 minutes, just by following the instructions step by step.  I did set up the camera with a different username and password than I did for the MyDlink.com web account, since it appears that accessing the camera remotely, also reveals network settings.  The MyDlink registration did seem to stall on the last step, but it had completed, and when I closed the last registration window and accessed the site through my confirmation email, my account was active and website functional.The night vision works very well, and while accessing the camera remotely on the weekend during a thunderstorm, I was surprised at how quickly the camera adjusted/recovered from full-sky-illuminating lightning flashes, back to regular night vision. One note on night use is that between the red "night-lights" and the green power indicating light, this camera is actually fairly bright and very indiscrete.  If you are using it for security, it will get noticed.  I ended up putting a small piece of tape over the green light once it was set up and in position.  The camera is still noticeable during night-vision usage, but not quite as bright.Daylight or indoor illuminated use is quite good.  Colors are clearly differentiated and movement is pretty smooth for a camera this size.  I am currently using it to monitor my front door through a porch window since someone is usually home, and have found it to be quite convenient in monitoring activity at the front door during day or night hours.  (If you are planning on using this to view out doors through a window at night, there is some reflection from the glass during night viewing, but the closer the camera is to the glass, the less reflection there is.  Tight to the glass, there is no reflection from the 'night lights', and angled slightly, I am getting a very slight halo effect around the edge of the viewscreen.)  Since the camera is easily seen from outside the front door, it may have some deterrent qualities toward suspicious behavior as well.

Reviews.Title: Easy install with very cool functionality
Reviews.Author: S. Snell
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to monitor my house while I am away.  This is my first security camera to install and use.It's very easy to set-up and add to an existing home network.  It takes about 5 minutes to plug in and launch the installation CD to complete the initial set-up.  However, since most home wireless networks utilize internal (private) IP Addresses, if you want the video viewable from outside your home network, it requires additional technical work.  Another reviewer provides detailed information on how to allow the assigned camera IP address to be accessible from *outside* the home network.  Basically, it requires forwarding to the camera's assigned IP address.Coolness factor:1) The camera links to an account you create on mydlink.com where the camera image can be viewed and controlled.2) Additionally, there is a smart phone app (mydlink Lite) so you can view your camera(s) and take snapshots.3) Finally, if motion is detected, you can easily configure the camera to email snapshots when motion is detected.Note - these are provided at no additional cost.Overall, inexpensive, very easy to install (with medium-level wireless technical knowledge), user friendly interfaces, accessible from outside the network.  Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Buena camara
Reviews.Author: Luis Mendieta
Reviews.Content: Me parece que es un buen producto. El uso que le doy es para seguridad.Puntos a favor:Que es nocturno y tiene un buen alcance.Puntos en contra:Tiene autodetección pero no se puede establecer un horario para la autodetección.Si no tienes un buen ancho de banda el myDLink casi no funciona, siendo la única solución enrutar el ip interno de tu lan hacia el ip público.Conclusión:Bueno producto y aun precio asequible.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera, low cost
Reviews.Author: Dee Bee "DB"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to the 930 model because it has night vision capabilities. I was amazed at the quality and have since added an additional camera to my D-Link security camera network. It is a great find, and for the money...you can't go wrong. I am pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: John Coleman
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to keep an eye on the cat while I'm gone. Also got the Dlink 655 wireless N router (has UPnP) which works well with the camera.  Camera works fine for live viewing while on a trip - using my laptop or Android phone.Not sure I'll use the motion detector or email/FTP features since it tends to send a lot of email/pictures.

Reviews.Title: Bulls Eye
Reviews.Author: John Piquette "John P"
Reviews.Content: I turned off the audio, don't need. Its new so cannot talk about reliability but assume it will be good with D-Link as its name. Did not call tech support either.The rest, PERFECT...... Great size, incredibly well poackaged, so easy to set up, test and install wirelessly, The stand was adequate for its purpose. Needed to buy an extension cord for the power supply as the standard is 4 feet and it should be 6 to 8 but no one has that.The price, the best...... For nice, simple easy security this camera hits it out of the ball park.I just wish the email set up was easier but all else was simple and easy if you follow the instructions and write down information along the way so you have it there for the future.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This works well with Airport and Time capsule just fine.  MAKE SURE YOU HAVE NO SPACES IN YOUR NETWORK PASSWORD.  Took me 2 days of experimenting to figure that out.Would be nice if the iPhone app had sound also.  And it would be nice if you could use the email, frequency timer.  Optics pretty decent. Very nice small package for the price.  Adding a second one.

Reviews.Title: Nice for Home Security
Reviews.Author: Carol Roberts
Reviews.Content: A nice item to provide an additional level of home security. We installed this in an entry room facing our main door. We can monitor activity at our house online when we are away, and the night "vision" is a very cool feature. I imagine this would be a very good item for someone who wants to monitor care of their children or other activities in their home when they are at work.

Reviews.Title: so easy to use, and i love the night vision option!
Reviews.Author: Vee
Reviews.Content: we LOVE this little camera - don't have kiddies but we do have a very crazed jack russell puppy with super bad separation anxiety - we were having a problem putting her to bed or down for a nap and she was tearing our office a part - this little gem was so easy to set up and operate, and now we're able to rest easy knowing that we can still monitor her overnight or when we're away - the night vision allows us to see her w/o her knowing it, so when she gets up and starts thinking about chewing up our molding we're able to nip in the bud - i think this would be great for anyone - parents especially, whether they're babies or furry = )

Reviews.Title: Nice Cost Effective IP Camera
Reviews.Author: North2AK
Reviews.Content: I like the camera.  Its small size and wireless functionality make it perfect for putting up just about anywhere in the house.  The MyDlink web portal capability is super easy to setup and the app is fantastic for checking up on the house from my android phone.  The only thing that I wish it had was the ability to enable/disable the motion detection feature on the camera through the phone app.

Reviews.Title: D-Link DCS-930L Wireless Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Armbrester
Reviews.Content: Good product overall.  However, I was hoping that the camera could be motion-detection activated to begin recording to an FTP website.  The on-line product overview implied that this device was capable of such performance.  Unfortunately, after several attempts, I could not get the product to perform this function.

Reviews.Title: Works great, perfect for what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Wreckinball
Reviews.Content: I wanted to add a camera with night vision to my home monitoring, this was perfect.  I only wish that it didn't have the red led's on it, but c'est la vie.  Overall works great and I'm quite pleased.  Using it with their android app sealed the deal.  I was able to easily monitor my house from vacation, except when the wireless went down.  I have a new wireless router on order and should be here tomorrow, problem solved.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Jack21 "Jack21"
Reviews.Content: This camera has some problems with dropping wireless connectivity, even while right next to my (D-Link) router. I am still working on resolving those problems.  Seems to work fine otherwise.  I would recommend to D-Link that they provide an AC/DC power converter with a longer cord, though.  You have to locate an outlet really close to the camera position to be able to use the converter without an extension cord.  If you are plugging into a normally spaced wall outlet and want the camera above head height you will have to use an extension cord.  I really like the iPhone app which allows me to monitor while away from home.

Reviews.Title: tech guy
Reviews.Author: michael linville
Reviews.Content: very difficult to configure, I had to directly connect it to my wifi hub for installation.  Even then it continually dropped off the network and had to be re-started.  Not good for a security camera right!  The camera advertised it had motion sensing features and while the software was present, I never got this feature to work.  Low cost, cheap product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Fun!
Reviews.Author: KindlePad
Reviews.Content: I have no real experience with wifi / network video cameras but I love this one. Setup was fairly easy - I took off 1 star for a lack of Mac software - you have to use a clumsy java app. The iphone app works great - I wish there was a native ipad app but the iphone app works well. Quality is nice - the night vision mode works really well. I use mine to keep an eye on the kids in the living room to make sure they are doing homework etc. I need to spend more time finding out all this nifty device can do.

Reviews.Title: Fine Picture Qualty
Reviews.Author: scesq "scesq"
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the picture quality of this camera but I have some concerns about the sound quality. Set up was a bit of a chore and I wish the instructions were more detailed.I got this camera to monitor one room in my house.  I wanted to be able to go to my computer and see what was happening.  The camera works fine for this. I found the picture quality pretty good even in low light.I do hear some static when the sound is turned on medium or higher.  Since sound is not important to me I keep it low.I see that a number of people had problems with this camera.  I don't like to compare my review to others but in this case I want to mention that my needs are to be able to view a room during the day and I really don't care about sound.  I have only viewed the images on my desktop PC.This camera is fine for my needs. If sound was an issue I think I would have had more issues this product.Additional info:I just wanted to add to this review.  I have been using the night feature of this camera lately and I am pleased with it. Also, this is still working fine. July 2012

Reviews.Title: software does not work with win7.  Have good images but motion detector does not work
Reviews.Author: Maggie Googler
Reviews.Content: the order I received was missing camera and mounting kit. I saw other reviews had the same problems, seems the prolbem is Amazon's packaging.  The installation software works fine until setting up wireless, as soon as I remove the cat5 cable, the internet is disconnected.  I have to restart my att router.  So I set the wireless manually as other viewer suggested.I set up motion detector and it worked for few minutes then stopped.  I restarted the camera and the motion detector worked for few more minutes and stop completely.  If it worked, i will give it 4 stars

Reviews.Title: Nice and easy to use CAM
Reviews.Author: Antonio E. Z. Castro "Risk Services"
Reviews.Content: Works fine with a very good reception. Easy to install and a lot of good software for free including for iphone. I'll buy the other one with infrared cause it doesn't work with low light! Excelente choice...

Reviews.Title: Great camera for little money!
Reviews.Author: Kasas
Reviews.Content: I Liked the camera, and it works fine! If there is a lot of traffic on the wi-fi it is sometimes difficult to get logged in with it. but when it works it is easy. I used the Mac set-up and it worked great.

Reviews.Title: Not the best but for the price its a decent value
Reviews.Author: A. Ru
Reviews.Content: PROS:Great looking form factor and small and easily mountable.Doesn't require a computer to be always on for the motion sensing and camera setup features (computer required for the motion recording)Compatible with both Mac and PCWirelessHas an iPhone app (but limited to 1 mins durations)I didn't buy this through Amazon but still paid about $10 bucks less.CONS:NO night-vision, I didn't think this would matter that much but the lack of any low-light capability makes this pretty useless at night unless you have some sort of motion sensing light near it, which I luckily had bought already but even with an LED light there is still just barely enough light to see what shows up on the camera.AUDIO is limited to the camera through a PC in your home network through a JAVA/Active-X enabled browser. There isn't any audio transmission on the my-Dlink web-site feature or iPhone app.Cannot pan-and-tilt, the camera has a wide-angle so this isn't as much of a problem but for a bit about $30 more someone might want to go with a Foscam instead.Power cord is rather short.

Reviews.Title: Excitement to disappointment
Reviews.Author: E. Haley
Reviews.Content: The setup went very smoth and the picture quality looked very good, so i was very pleased while I was setting it up.  But when I strarted trying to connect and check on it later, I could not get connected.  this was in a remote cabin so I made a return trip to check it out.  Nothing was wrong and I finnally got connected to it OK.  It seems I can connect about 1 in 4 tries and then it is extremely slow.  then I found the part that if you do not have UPnp you have a 1 minute time limit.  I thought the advertisement said it would record to the web site and I could retrieve picture from the web site.  I have not figured out how to do that if it is even possible.  I tried the email and like every camera I've tried it jst fill up your email completely with nothing.  I lowered the sensitivity down to 60 and it still sent emails with no change.  I was going to send it back but was out of town and let the time slip by.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Bludgeon
Reviews.Content: Camera works great, the online mydlink also works great. The DVIEW Cam software took a little bit to figure out, but it does what I expected which is to record when there is motion detected. I had to turn off the virus software and firewall to install the everything, but after that no problems.

Reviews.Title: Camera works fairly well, but audio after two days of ues has degenerated into an intermittant clicking sound.
Reviews.Author: Maya Cointreau "Mother Maya"
Reviews.Content: It was super easy to set up, and it's useful for watching my mare that is about to foal. It's wireless N so it should have a very big range, but in fact has a shorter range than my wireless d/g laptop. I was counting on using the sound component to help wake me up when the mare begins foaling as night, but after the first night the audio sn't working anymore -- all I get is a click loop that goes on and on, no matter how many times I close my browser or restart the camera. So it's not serving it's function, other than to save me the trip to the barn very few hours when I wake up to check on the mare. I'm going to have to buy a regular old baby monitor to hear the mare, too... So, three stars. Oh -- and you can't feed the video to your own website, only look at it through Dlink. that is pretty annoying, since I have a ton of friends who would like to see the foaling. IF it has an internet connection and webfeed, one should be able to run it through their own server if they wish.  So, three stars. And I think that is VERY forgiving of me.

Reviews.Title: Wished it were a bit better
Reviews.Author: Mom to 2 boys
Reviews.Content: This camera is adequate- you can view your home from work to check on things or when you're away on vacation to make sure your home is safe.  There's the part I like...Now for the cons:*Not Mac friendly as another reviewer mentioned.  My husband installed it on an IBM instead, but we would have rather used our Mac laptop.*The video quality is grainy.*Depending on your connection, it's not usually real-time and it's not always continuous.We didn't try the audio yet so I can't really comment on that.  I also have not yet tried to view it with my iTouch but I would hope that it worked well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: SteelWheel
Reviews.Content: We have been really pleased with how well these little cameras have worked out. Image quality is decent and the wireless lets us move these around a school campus to monitor suspicious activity easily. In some ways these are better for our needs than the $5,000 high end cameras that is part of our DVR security system.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but limited
Reviews.Author: Steve_C
Reviews.Content: Range and video quality low. Easy to setup. Possibly suitable for limited uses, like baby monitoring at short range. I got this D-Link and a Foscam in the same order, intending to compare and keep the better unit. I'm keeping the Foscam, this one's been returned.

Reviews.Title: Crappy wireless range
Reviews.Author: A. Wang "A Dub"
Reviews.Content: I bought this wireless camera so I can place it about 20 feet away from my main router.  I had no issues setting it up initially while connected through ethernet to my router.  However, after I moved it to where I wanted to set it up, I could not get it to work.  I spent about 6 hours trying different things, moving it downstair (but closer to the router) to no avail.  I gave customer service a call and they deemed it a defective camera after going through their troubleshooting steps.  I did give it one last shot and was able to connect to the router wireless when it was 5 feet away.  Then I noticed the site survey feature on the manual setup window.  Apparently, this camera has an effective range of about 13 ft, maybe.  It greatly limits where I can place this wireless camera.For those who has some reception issues, try connecting to the router via wireless G instead of N.  It may give you a little more range.The only positive is that I think it is built pretty well.  I threw it across the room and kicked it out of frustration and it still works.

Reviews.Title: Not the greatest
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: Video quality is marginal at best. Wireless range is poor.Purchased because I got a decent price <50. Might be best used as a webcam

Reviews.Title: Worked at first
Reviews.Author: Al Becker
Reviews.Content: I have a Mac and this camera was very easy to install with the Mac. You have to download the Mac version from the D-Link website. I tried a Panasonic camera and it was very difficult to get running with the Mac. I never could get the camera to work wireless or on the net. I had this D-Link cam setup working wireless and on the net very quickly. When viewing the camera it seems to work better with Mozilla FireFox than with Safari. The sound works fine with FireFox. There is an app for the iPhone that is also very convenient and easy to use. The only drawback with this camera is that the recording software included only works with a PC.Update: The longer I have the cameras the worse they perform. It's almost impossible to get an internet connection. I can't get it to connect using a computer unless at home, which is completely useless to me. The iPhone app connection is spotty. The sound feature is intermittent. This has become a disappointment and I bought several of these. There has to be something better than this.

Reviews.Title: IT works
Reviews.Author: Jesse Benway "jbenz"
Reviews.Content: This camera works, the video could be smoother, the audio could be better, I have had to reboot the camera occasionally, but for the price its not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It is very simple to setup. It took me just 5 minutes to unpack and setup. I set this up in family room and use to watch my baby with the babysitter. I like this product and will buy one more for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my second home, and was so impressed by its small size, ease to install and picture quality that I got two more. It is so simple to use that all you have to do is log on to the "mydlink.com" website from any computer, anywhere, and you can view your home, yard, business, or whatever you want to view, and all done wirelessly, except of course for the power connection from the camera to an outlet.I highly recommend this camera, and it is very affordable!

Reviews.Title: Fits the bill
Reviews.Author: Robbya12
Reviews.Content: Mac setup was smooth using the beta installation software available online. These cameras do the trick for less than half the price of the nearest competitor at this level. If you just want to be able to look in every once in a while, this is a good way to go.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, took a little time to seup.
Reviews.Author: J2014G
Reviews.Content: My PC uses Vista Ultimate. Wired ethernet was easy to set up. Somewhat more difficult to figure out how to set up the wireless side. Big hint provided in the Dlink troubleshooting guide is to plug the camera's ethernet cable and the PC's ethernet cable into the same router while setting up the wireless section. After that everything set up easily. Wireless range seems feeble but got the camera working in the area needed without a booster. Found[...] provides live monitoring.  One item of note for using the internet to monitor the camera: I heard AT&T; is going to limit monthly usage of bandwidth to 150 GBytes per month for DSL customers. It seems this camera (or probably any other good resolution camera) uses 62 KBytes/S from the Dlink site while streaming. That's 5.4 GBytes/day meaning 24/7 external streaming would use 100% of the monthly DSL bandwidth allowed. So it seems it would be better to use motion detect to only alert via eamil when sensing movement or just login into mydlink.com to get real time video as needed. Of course, monitoring video using your own local area network internally is at no charge.

Reviews.Title: Good after inital setup
Reviews.Author: Bradley Johnston "brad"
Reviews.Content: On first setup had problem, call Dlink Tech service; first major language problem, then he told me to call Bell South and get DSL Modem bridged.So tried to setup again and this time worked fine, on problem was Firefox 4.0 does not work for viewing Video.Have had running 3 days, video okay for general viewing and seem quite reliable.

Reviews.Title: Not Super Easy, but Support Helpful
Reviews.Author: MariaSmiles
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: still lovin my cameras. Our router's signal has constantly been a problem, and my fiancee likes to unplug the cameras when he's home (it creeps him out to have them on), and even with all that fussin', these little guys still connect to the network every time the power or wi-fi signal is available, with no other input from me. Yay! I have noticed that I can only view 1 camera from an outside network, but I only tried it once, and didn't really look into fixing it yet.Still Satisfied!ORIGINAL POST:I am dealing with a fairly complicated set-up, network-wise, and a very finicky router. I know a moderate amount of stuff about computers, but not a whole lot about networking. There are a lot of settings/options you can configure, if you so choose. Many other reviewers have gone into detail about them. My main reason for writing a review is to reassure those who are not very knowledgeable that the Customer Technical Support is very helpful. Yes, they are probably in a non-US call center and there may be a limit to the time allowed for help, after purchase. But if you set the camera up soon after receipt, you should be fine. I have called twice so far and both times, (two different operators) were very helpful in getting me to the right spot and having me enter the right settings (even if I had little faith in the beginning). In addition, the manual (on CD) is very thorough and written well. There are other cameras out there with more "bells and whistles" for less money, but I will gladly pay a bit more for something that is reliable and offers more helpful human support as well as documentation.

Reviews.Title: Works with Mac and Android
Reviews.Author: Sanjay Mehta
Reviews.Content: I picked this up in Fry's despite some misgivings over Mac support. Even booted up Windows in a virtual machine in order to start off the installation process. Internet Explorer timed out near the end of the process so I started looking for an alternate means to install the camera.Google found a new Mac utility on the dlink site. Installed and fired that up to find that the initial installation had actually completed.Setup is extremely simple - just follow the steps in the application, and you should be on the Dlink site. I did see some weird behaviour from that site though. Sometimes [...] would redirect to a page saying "Invalid URL."While Dlink advertises their free IOS application both on the box, and on their website, I found an identical Android application as well in the Android market place. Having tried out both IOS and Android, I can tell you that they both work equally well. I've settled for using these applications instead of the mydlink website, as they're easier to use.The webcam also hosts a webserver inside it which alllows you to tweak settings such as frame rate, audio, motion detection etc. It also has a builtin email client which can send images to a designation email address every so often or send a sequence of frames triggered by the motion detection system.FTP support is also present, but I didn't try it.I was also able to fairly easily map the webcam to an externally visible IP address and then access the camera remotely. That's when I discovered that it supported audio as well - something I overlooked on the packaging.In short, this was trivially easily to configure on my Mac, and access via IOS (iPod Touch/iPad) and Android phone (Nexus S).Built quality is a little light - I'm not confident that this would survive powered on 24hours a day. I'm also skeptical of the power adaptor supplied.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Gamble
Reviews.Content: It works great was easy to setup and is easy to use. One two three four five six seven eight. Why do I need to waist these words when there is nothing more to write about this product?

Reviews.Title: wifi doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Irakli Korashvili
Reviews.Content: it doesn't work over wireless network at all. i can't access device from any other device. i was going to buy another 2 or 3 cameras for my home, but i don't want to have wires all over my house.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: James D. Wilkson "Jim Wilkson"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product to monitor cat behavior in the room that contains their litter boxes.  That room is about 50 feet away from my computer.  After repeated attempts I could not get the remote feature to work using the WPS feature on my wireless router.  Turns out my Verizon FiOS service does not support WPS (even though the button is there) and would not turn on the feature for me.  Even though the intended viewing area is too far away and not practical for a direct connection, I attempted to set the camera up for a direct connection and could not get it to work either.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: steve cochran
Reviews.Content: I bought 1 of these units it would not connect to my wifi.  Returned unit as per customer service.  Got another unit same thing JUNK!!!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: ordered three cameras. Had to download installation program. Cameras were not recognized by program, although my computer found them. You can only set up an account and access cameras through the install program. Could not find a solution. Called DLink, thirty minutes on hold, got to a rep who "couldn't hear well" and hung up.  Called back, 45 minutes on hold, got another person who asked me to hold real quick, 15 minutes later she disconnected.  Returned items to Amazon and will not purchase D-Link again.

Reviews.Title: Pass.
Reviews.Author: hlb
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a doggie nanny when we are away and the dog sitter is watching them. We just wanted a way to see our pups when traveling to feel a little more connected. I cannot get the wireless camera to function wirelessly! Which, is kind of the point of it. The moment i disconnect it... it loses the network and doesn't work anymore.On top of that the D-Link Support team is basically non existent so I can't get any help.Do yourself a favor and pay a little more and stay away from this brand.

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: Fred Acevedo
Reviews.Content: Purchase two one work will connected via Ethernet, the other works on occasion.  Neither works via wifi.  Good price but limited flexibility

Reviews.Title: wirerless
Reviews.Author: Dennis Gift
Reviews.Content: the wireless will not work so I have to use a cable to the computer, not good,I.won't buy it again

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: craftylady
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera after we were broken into twice in a month and a half.  It allows us to keep an eye on what is happening at home while we are at work.  The motion detection works great and the email notification go to my husbands phone usually within 20 seconds.  I love that I can check the camera from my phone.It doesn't have an on-off switch so we have to turn it to a wall when we are home to avoid getting emails every time someone walks in front of it (because of that we have not mounted it on the wall but have it on a desk), and it has turned off for as much as 15 minutes a few times, but it does reset itself eventually.  Other than those two relatively minor issues I am very pleased with the camera.I had a little trouble setting the time and date etc. but looked in the owners manual on line and found a phone number.  The tech walked me through the set up and now it works great.

Reviews.Title: It really works!!
Reviews.Author: rodolfo gadea
Reviews.Content: The setting is very easy and most important, it really works!!!Just be sure that the router stay connected all the time.

Reviews.Title: Dlink DCS-942L
Reviews.Author: svanderhill
Reviews.Content: The item arrived as described and was up and running within a half hour.  It was great to use my Iphone to set the cameras viewing area.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Work On IOS6 iPad
Reviews.Author: S. Young
Reviews.Content: Cameras work fine. They will not work on latest MAC Lion. The MyDlink+ APP for iPad does not work with IOS6, only the cheap MyDlink Lite APP works. Very poor customer service-Just kind of speak English and have No idea how to help or have correct information. Don't count on any tech help from them at all, I've tried many times with zero luck. You need Windows to use CD and set-up camera, the MAC downloadable software really does not work.

Reviews.Title: How sad, wifi no-go
Reviews.Author: G3
Reviews.Content: What is apparently a spiffy little affordable camera is instead a deeply flawed product. The installation wizard is full of blockades (for example, it could not find its own Dlink server, which was sitting in a browser on the same computer). Furthermore, there are no manual workarounds to the wizard; if it doesn't work, you're stuck.The wireless capability seems to be indicator lights only. No matter what I did or how I did it, the camera would accept the wireless settings and then simply not connect to the network. What a dismal experience, 3 hours wasted. Dlink is at the bottom of my list now.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work well with Apple OS
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA WITT "pw39"
Reviews.Content: I have a Mac book pro and installing this software was very difficult. The instructions were little help. The only device I can view images with is my phone. The camera images are choppy and sometimes the connection is lost. For the price of the camera, I guess the quality is ok. But I wouldn't recommend it for apple users.

Reviews.Title: Does NOT work with Airport Express
Reviews.Author: vnuzz "vnuzz"
Reviews.Content: This device requires 2 (TWO) ethernet ports on either your modem or your router in order to install the software and to update the firmware.If you have a cable modem with only 1 ethernet port - like mine - then this camera will not work since the AX also has only one ethernet port.If you have an AX network (more than one device) you might be able to get the camera to function while it's hard wired via an ethernet cable to the unused port on the AX that you use to extend your network.  But you will NOT be able to install any firmware updates since those require that both your computer and the camera be directly connected to the same network device via cable -- you cannot use Wi-Fi to download the firmware updates.It would be nice if DLink mentioned that fact somewhere....

Reviews.Title: frustrating piece of junk
Reviews.Author: mbeck001
Reviews.Content: Their quick setup guide covers one specific type of scenario. If your router doesn't have the required button options, you have to dive in via your computer. Configurating this thing has been a nightmare. Now I'm not afraid to roll my sleeves up and troubleshoot this kind of thing. I've successfully setup renderfarms for both mac and windows in the past. I can't even imagine what the regular consumer would think of this mess.
