Every step of the way, there's some problem with DLink's "Wizards" and "easy setups" and so on (I like the error "update wizard" with no further explanation -not to mention that the most current version of the wizard is in fact being used.)Their website is the typical maze of a large company with many products. Often times searches for answers leave one going in circles literally.Sometimes the wireless works, sometimes it doesn't. (and to even get that to work at all I had to do extensive reading of random forum posts online, taking up hours of my time.) The online portal comes up with the typical java problems on a Mac. The iPhone app does work, but that's only if the wireless is working for the camera at that time. I would easily pay three times more for a better product which had a rock solid setup/config procedure.

Reviews.Title: Skip it ....
Reviews.Author: BruceK
Reviews.Content: Oddly enough I bought a DLink fixed lens webcam for about the same cost years ago.This one is new and better styled, smaller, sleeker, but it's not really any better.  Thishas night vision but it's nothing to write home about.  Also sound that is more of anirritation when you click into the web interface and you hear this annoying howl in thebackground.The web interface to configure the camera is not that intuitive or very well documented.The point is for the money, I think this should be well under the $100 price point, andhave a whole lot more smarts and a better image, as well as audio that enhances thevideo experience not makes it worse.This should work and should priced about $60, and there should be better tools for theMac.

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!
Reviews.Author: Tom in NOVA "tfmh"
Reviews.Content: Pro: Camera connected to network using "push-buttons" (didn't have to enter network key.Cons:Setup Wizard would not load/run from CD,  downloaded wizard from mydlink.com that wouldn't work either.  All firewall and security SW was turned off to no avail.  Installed latest JAVA version, checked to see if all other OS etc were current still no luck.  Tried loading other SW via CD drive- all worked flawlessly.  Took CD to wife's laptop and guess what?  It worked  Go figure.mydlink site is a joke. you have almost no control over the camera and the security is nonexistent.  Basically, whatever your camera sees is viewable by just about anyone who does even basic hacking.Fortunately I bought at BestBuy, who. like Amazon don't hassle on returns.;

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with Mac Lion
Reviews.Author: spinoza
Reviews.Content: As with all the others here, I had to learn the hard way by spending the time with hopeless configuration and setup, only to learn that it doesn't work with Lion. I'm not sure why D-Link isn't up front with this information, I guess they've done the market research and learned enough people don't return the device to make it worth it not to say anything about being incompatible. My advice: if you own a Mac, don't touch D-Link products.

Reviews.Title: DOES NOT WORK with windows7
Reviews.Author: MINNA
Reviews.Content: The setup wizard does not work with windows7. it freezes at activeX part and wont let you continue. I have been trying for hours with their tech support to create mydlink account but no luck.

Reviews.Title: Horrible 3 hours set up with tech
Reviews.Author: eddym
Reviews.Content: Terrible...wasted my Friday night. Tech was from another planet. Would not let me create an account. Save your money so you dont waste 3 hours on a Friday night.

Reviews.Title: Not for PPC Macs, Not for OSX 10.4 (Tiger)
Reviews.Author: J. Bohrer
Reviews.Content: The box says it works on the Mac OSX 10.4 (Tiger) Operating System. Nope. Open up the box, no mention of the Mac in the documentation or on the CD. Go to the website, call them on the phone, download the software, open it up and see that it requires 10.5, not 10.4OK, restart your Mac in 10.5 and try it. Nope, still does not work on your PPC Mac, you have to have an Intel Mac.

Reviews.Title: Still working on it
Reviews.Author: Dana G.
Reviews.Content: I have an all-Macintosh OS house.  Three computers, to be exact.  There is always some bump in the road when it comes to this.  I am just having some trouble setting things up, but I wouldn't blame DLink as this takes some concentration and "alone time" to figure out.  I did download the instructions from their website and plan on attacking this setup as soon as I get my kids back to school in less than two weeks.  Plus, I don't have an iPhone yet (ANOTHER Apple product!) but hope to be getting one with the next release so I will be able to update my review to see how it works with the iPhone setup.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad webcam overall
Reviews.Author: R. Reed "Mainframes-R-Us"
Reviews.Content: Ok, overall this webcam can get the job done. Initial setup can be a bit tricky if you're trying to use the ftp setup to capture your surveillance videos.  I ended up abandoning the ftp setup and using D-ViewCam which is provided by Dlink which is far easier to use and setup. What always works for me in initial setup is to set up the Webcam as if it were going to be a wired setup and then switch it to wireless setup afterwards via the Webcam setup menus.  The Picture quality is great during the day and of course since this cam does not have night vision you only get a blank screen.  However, you can pickup for example headlights if your cam is pointed towards your driveway entrance. Which can still be very useful info.  We setup these D-Link DCS-930L cams, and Dlink-lite on our cell phones and went on vacation.  The only sore spot we found out is that the Dlink lite apps only let you view cam remotely for only up to 60seconds at a time.  The time for it make a connection via DLink lite takes a long time and several tries.  But once connected provides a glimpse of your home environment from a far and some peace of mind.  But compared to more expensive security solutions , for what it does is hard to beat.  We were gone for a total of 3 days, so I had to setup my pc to run continuously via the power settings to sleep mode off.  The other issue I ran into was an occasional crash in the D-ViewCam software under Windows 7 once a day.  I discovered that I had to upgrade my software D-link software which I did and use the Windows 7 recommended solution via it's automated trouble-shooting which was to allow it to adjust the Windows graphics settings.  But since we were going on vacation, I could not risk this happening again when I was away.  So, I downloaded and used the "Application Monitor" to detect if D-ViewCam application was not running and to restart it if needed. Whenever D-ViewCam crashed, a restart of the app always fixed it. If Windows 7 crashed then it always does a auto restart.  So in that case I put the "Application Monitor" into the Windows start up and removed the Windows password so that D-ViewCam would always be running.  All these preventive measures worked  So, despite the drawbacks DLink DCS-930L webcam is still a solid buy for the security it provides. One other thing which is a gotcha during setup.  I discovered the hard way that your WIFI modem password must be at least 8 characters long or it will always be rejected by the Dlink link setup software. Despite its drawbacks, the DCS-930L webcam is still a solid buy for the security it provides.  The webcams themselves have been very reliable.  Make sure if you're capture video for a number of days that you use a terabyte drive whereas one day can suck up to 29gigs of space with 2 webcams recording.

Reviews.Title: wireless range poor
Reviews.Author: mnorangeblossom "ALC"
Reviews.Content: internal antenna is so weak we can't use this camera well.  wanted to set up in nursery, but we would need to move our cable modem into the room!

Reviews.Title: If you need assistance, Don'tBuy D-link.
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Nelson "Sir Richard Thompson"
Reviews.Content: I'm trying to access D-links web site to see live shots from the DCS-930L camera. I spent 3 hours on the phone with a foreign teck that raised my blood pressure so high, I had to go to the emergency room. I called again, was pleased to here the voice of a native speaker of English. I told him that I had a case number; when I told him that he connected me to the same idiot that could not solve my problem. I have too many D-link products. When I log into D-link's Dir -655 (wireless N router), It shows the camera working, but I have not been able to get a PASSWORD for the Mydlik.com. If i have time, I am going to make an early call and hope to reach the Female tech that helped me set up my router last year. If I can't resolve the problem and I find that I can't return it, I'll throw in the garbage and start initiation of a conversation with any one I meet, and I will down D-link's crappy customer service to everyone I meet. I have no problems with their products if you can get them set up correctly. If they don't address their tech issues, they wil be out of this line of business like Cisco. Product good, tech is the worst I've encountered in over 15 years.

Reviews.Title: D-Link Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary R. Kornberger "Circle K Estates Gary K"
Reviews.Content: If you plug the cam into your wireless router it is a no brainier. Making it work on it's own, wireless. Have not figured that out. But believe it to be a deal where you need to call your router company to get help setting it up.We were forced to move out of our home due to a recent flood. I set my camera at a place most likely for a break in. Already had the Iphone app installed and a dedicated laptop for the cam in our hotel room. All the time we were away we could see and hear every thing going on inside. At night it switched over to black and white night vision. Day time, color. It made me feel much better about being away from our home. For us it was well worth the money with peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: 3G Timeouts
Reviews.Author: Michael Earwood
Reviews.Content: This camera works great when connected via WI-FI. However, when connecting via 3G from my Android phone or from my wife's iPhone 3GS we have endless timeouts. The free myDlink program for smartphones is terrible and if you do get connected it times out after 60 seconds.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT for my needs
Reviews.Author: David "Foxboy"
Reviews.Content: I have a rotten neighbor I need to keep an eye on and this worked perfect.  I set it hanging upside down from a inside window, rotated the camera 180 degrees and I am good to go!  It works wirelessly easy on my wi-fi home network, so I can keep tabs on this "guy" from anywhere.  I don't expect he will ever know he is being watched when he's running his business from his house, which he tries to cover up...it is not legal in this area to run a business from a house.Anyway, whatever your use, it works!The camera seemed easy enough on Mac, but they left out some details on how to connect wirelessly, I did need to call and get talked down by their "tech guy".  I was able to fill in the missing blanks and had it running in about 45 minutes, pretty simple once you know how the menus work.  The product is great, the "tech help, well -- needs help themselves.  The line was very busy, first call was a harsh hang up, then second call was a 5 minute wait...Long way to India I guess.  They have a Mac installer which is Beta on their website, works fine although it is sort of PC clunky, not real pretty but functional.  Can not have everything and the price is sweet.Anyway I give it a 5 Star and I am happy with the unit.I will also now be able to see the conditions from anywhere, very nice.  I still wish they would move, there are sure better people and I was here first!

Reviews.Title: Worth trying
Reviews.Author: GC
Reviews.Content: We have been waiting for the day when this technology became affordable, functional and easy to use. We decided to give this one a try to see that day had arrived. In summary, it has. The issues we have are twofold. First, when setting up the feature where it will email you when the device senses motion, it asks questions about our email account that are technical and we couldn't answer. So far we can't find out how to deal with this issue. Second, where we have the device located we have satellite internet access. This all but eliminates the functionality of the unit. I wish we had known this ahead of time.The unit is well made, surprisingly small, and we are confident it will one day serve as we had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Missing Parts in box!!!
Reviews.Author: Lynn "Alinn"
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these cameras and when I opened the boxes, neither boxes had the mounting kit inside. I called the company and they said to contact Amazon and this was probabably an isolated incident. NOT!!! I returned the cameras and Amazon sent out 2 more cameras and low and behold NO MOUNTING KITS!!! I called D-Link and they gave their standard spill in barely understandable english (I'm B__tching). After being disconnected/hungup on once and then told to go back to amazon I am returning the cameras and ordering a different brand of camera. They also told me that it is on amazon even though it is their sealed product Amazon is selling. They also told me that i could purchase the kits from them via email. A Bunch of BS!!!AMAZON as always was excellent in their customer service. I returned the first two cameras and the other two were overnighted to me. Maybe Amazon should get in the business of making more electronic products (besides kindle) because I would try them out just based on my experience of their customer service department!!!!

Reviews.Title: dont buy Dlink products if this is an example of thier Quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this has to the be the worst buying experience I have had from an item bought from Amazon the entire product form the software to the hardware is defective and should be removed from amazon it is the lowest standard I have ever run into as a consumer It was my fault for not going by the other product reviews I'd read now I realize that it is a 50/50 chance that the item will work as of now I hate Dlink products and will in the future refuse to purchase them ugh just terrible I have never token the time to vent about a product before....... lol now for my review:  Pros it looks pretty ........Cons: the product distrcription as a plug and play item is wrong it wold be right if the product and software worked at all but they don't the manual that comes with it is worthless the dlink support is wortless and they cant even admit that their product is broken....

Reviews.Title: Almost easy to set up.  Works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: PoorPossum
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything it says it does.  The night vision works well and the sound is better than I expected after reading some of the reviews (my firmware is v1.03 - 5/16/2012).I'm using it as a baby cam and probably the best thing is the app which I can use on my android phone, my Kindle HD and any web browser (via mydlink.com) on my computer (home and work).Regarding installation: there is an install software which seems to take care of most of the behind-the-scenes router and network setup (port forwarding, port 80 etc).  However... I ran into two issues when setting up:1) The bumph say that it supports '802.11b/g/n Wireless with WEP/WPA/WPA2 security'.  It does not support standard WEP.  If you only have WEP encryption on your wireless network, the camera will not connect to your wireless.  I needed to upgrade my wireless security to WPA or WPA2.  Then it worked fine.  I only found this information by accident on the internet and thought it was easier to try than some of the more complex port forwarding issues.  Worked a treat.2) I wanted to use the 'WPS' setup.  This is where you press one button on the camera and one button on your wireless router, they talk and it's done.  After an hour of wasted time I found that the WPS button on my router is a pointless tease with no actual use.  It is there 'for a future update'.  Thanks a lot Verizon FIOS. - this was a red herring and nothing to do with the camera.It could come with a mounting clip of some sort instead of just a base plate to screw into a wall, but overall I am very happy.  The baby cams I looked at in the stores were not as good and twice the price.  I may even add cameras for pets, security etc later.Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy these cameras.
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras, along with a D-Link wireless router. With quite a bit of tinkering, because of poor installation instructions, I finally got both cameras to work.The real problems began when I tried to use mydlink to view the images the cameras were transmitting. On two different computers, I was able to log into mydlink OK. Immediately, it started trying to download a Java applet needed to access the cameras. But the download would not finish - or even begin. I have downloaded several other Java applets in the past witout any problem.I sent an email to support explaining the problem. After more than 24 hours, the reply from support simply told me to try a different web browser. I tried that, but no dice.Don't buy these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Camera for Home Surveillance
Reviews.Author: Erin L. Lowmaster
Reviews.Content: Since my Husband is more tech Savvy than me, I had him share his thoughts on this product. Enjoy the review below!I opened the DCS-932L camera and was greeted by the camera, two cables, and a packet with the CD, a quick install guide, a big orange paper on how to contact support, and some GPL, GNU licence papers. There's a minimum amount of paper here, so not a lot to sort through to find what you need.Setup is fairly simple. My wireless router does not have WPS (WiFi Protected Setup) so I just plugged the camera into the router with a CAT-5 cable (included) and into the wall socket power cable (included.) I inserted the CD, and clicked Start. From there I entered in a device password, which is sadly limited to 6-8 characters. This is likely due to the fact it's probably stored on the device itself and there are hardware limitations to encryption. After answering a few simple questions, you are able to make a mydlink.com account. Here, there was also a limitation on the password. I'm not sure what it allows, other than it must be at least 6 characters. I tried to make a 12 character password with all manner of characters. It said it was invalid, with no explanation. I made the password 12 characters of upper and lower case letters, and numbers. This worked. Not as good as I'd like, as it is allowing access to my home, but it's not terrible. It could probably be longer than 12 if I wanted. I can only hope is stored properly in the website (not that I have much hope in that.) Be sure to complete the process after clicking the activate link in your email before trying to access the camera via website. I'm fairly certain you could even skip the mydlink.com account creation and set up the camera to work on your own domain and gain access via the web without needing to trust the mydlink.com site.If your router supports it, the camera also supports WPA-PSK / WPA2-PSK  wifi encryption (and if your router doesn't, get a new one.)Another issue I had was my Firefox browser with NoScript and my Chrome browser blocked access to the camera page from the website for security reasons I wont get into here. It's easily bypassed by going to the direct IP address while on your local network.The site dashboard allows you access to several cameras if you have more than one.The camera itself, and the features, are very nice. It comes mounted on a stand with a wide range of motion and can be mounted on a wall if you wish. We found a suitable location in a room that allows us to see almost the entire room. You can flip and/or mirror the image in the software settings if you need to as well.The microphone is also of good quality, and you can hear what's going on in the room. The night vision auto activates if the light is low enough (or you've pointed the camera down enough that the ceiling light wont reach it.)The software features accessible through the camera page are fantastic. There is motion detection which allows you to select certain regions of the view to watch for motion, while avoiding where (for example) the cat normally walks. You could have it look for an opening door, but not worry about the floor.There's a zoom feature, but it's only a digital zoom, so the quality isn't great when zooming.You can raise or lower the image quality and resolution so if you need the live stream to take up less bandwidth, you can do so, or raise it for high quality images.There are many more options, such as email and FTP access to store images, scheduling to turn the camera on and off automatically, and the ability to link the camera to a web domain name you control.Overall, aside from a few concerns on the passwords, which I am sensitive to because I am a security enthusiast, I think it's a fantastic device. The myriad of options and settings are very nice, and the price is about right for what we got.

Reviews.Title: Nice IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: I've only had the DCS-942L a few days. I bought it to test the difference in image quality compared to the Izon View camera I had purchased that had horrible image quality. I'm very pleased not only with the images projected by this camera, but with the features and options for tweaking that are available. Both day and night images from this camera are quite clear and cover a large area. I was amazed at the quality of the night vision video. I didn't expect it to be as clear as it is. The ability to record clips to the SD card, adjust quality, recording length and to tweak the colors really make this very useful. The Izon had none of those features. Dlink's control panel is reminiscent of setting up a router... something they have a long history with.Needless to say, I've returned the Izon View cameras and will be buying another of these.I am a Mac user and had no problem setting this up and getting it running on both my Mac and my iPhone. The myDlink lite app is definitely lite. It works well, but you'll want to do all of your tweaking via the Dlink IP control panel. By the way, I've read comments that state this does not work via Safari, but it works perfectly for me.The only glitch I ran into was in updating the firmware on my device. The myDlink website said it needed a firmware update, but the page did not give very good instructions on how to do so. I realized that there was a separate page that had instructions and once I found that all went smoothly. So if you run into the same issues, just dig around in the Top 5 FAQs area (as of this writing it's the top FAQ) for the instructions.My only complaints about this unit is that it's hard to hide because it's pretty big and at night the LEDs glow red drawing even more attention to it. I know this is necessary but that was the nice thing about the Izon system, you could hide it easier and turn off the LED display on the unit.

Reviews.Title: Awful Product and D-Link Support equally as bad
Reviews.Author: Marvin B. Holt
Reviews.Content: Hello, setup disc that came with unit would not autorun so I went to D-Links website and installed the software, That is required for the unit to work, and it was complicated beyond belief. I am very versed at working on networks and with network app's and this one was so frustrating that I had to call D-Link for support. The initiation wait time was 10 minutes ( this was on a Tuesday morning at 10:00 AM ) - I was on hold for 58 minutes. Support wanted to REMOTE into my computer to setup the Cam. I told them no way ! Talking about opening up a hole in your network, they are nuts to use remote control for a fix to there mess. I saw a new story this morning that showed a cam that had been hacked and the person was watching and talking to the family's baby. Back to the meat of this review - as I was on hold for this 58 minutes, I had plenty of time to check out the D-Link FAQ database. Here are a few things I found;One of the most asked questions was " What do I do if the installation disc doesn't run on my computer ? "Another one was ' How do I get a MyD-Link account ? " --- A my d-link account is required for this camera to broadcast. It will not work if you don't have a my d-link account - Period. The installation disc that comes with the unit, if it worked, would take you through this process as you setup the unit. Without it you must contact D-Links support to setup this camera ( 58 Minutes on HOLD ). If I had known that this camera wouldn't work without having to be a d-link cloud member, I sure wouldn't have wasted my money on it.There are to many things bad about this unit, including after I set it up with supports help, the firmware was out of date. It has to be updated right out of the box --- come on D-Link, at least update the firmware or toss these units into the trash. That will be the next place these units will be, in our landfills ! They have lowered the price again and again on these units. That should have been a red flag. Trust me, it will be from now on. Don't waste your time or money on this unit. Once I got it working, the cams picture and audio were not even as good as the older webcams that are built in on laptops. The network part of the cam was in and out. I never was able to watch a steady stream. The app that you use with a smart phone is a 'lite" app.To get the full app it cost you more money ! D-Link has gotten the last dollar from this old man !!!

Reviews.Title: Home camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Bolger
Reviews.Content: Ok I got this and the write up said, very easy to install!Well it was just as described. At first I hard wired in to my network. I downloaded the fee app myDlink Lite. Put this on my iPhone.MyDlink requires a set up and this went easy as well.I watched our dog home alone, has night view and day view, helpful with a black dog.The instructions indicated this camera would be wireless, explained how in very limited instructions.It indicated I should use the WPS button on my modem/router. I tried but no success it said hold button on camera until blue light came on the within minute press WPS on router. Well did not work, so I kept it hard wired into network.Then a week later, thought why not hold the router button down and see what happens. I detected a quick flash out of sequence on the camera, and thought,Maybe It worked.I looked at my cell phone and there it was connected wirelessly.I wrote down what I did as these router all vary.I also found from the myDlink web page advance settings, log in as admin,( your new password) you find the settings for clock plus more.So the product works extremely well. I bought a Motorola monitor have babies room (grandchild). Spent the same money and wish I had found this first. You can have up to 4 cameras.I used my cell phone video to help line up camera for view I liked. Mute your cell phone or you get feedback through phone. The camera has a mike built in as well.Just my opinionLarry

Reviews.Author: newpixel
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good, because it's a short list. The iPhone and Android apps aren't too bad - 3 stars I'd say for adequate basic functionality (since their last update). Initial network configuration was easy. It worked on my iPhone, iPad, Android tablet and both OS X and Windows (until I updated the firmware - now it only works reliable on the iPhone and iPads).Unfortunately, the hardware is terrible. It washes out in a bright room if there is a light source anywhere in front of the camera. Not enough light and it's too dark to see anything. I even tried using it to view outside and the image was only viable during the early morning and evening.The software looks like something that was designed by an amateur in 1995, and for some unfathomable reason it runs only in full-screen.If they could fix all the problems that they introduced with their firmware 'upgrades', and they updated their software I might be able to find a use for it.Pros:It used to workInitial set-up was easyCons:Not much of the original functionality worksSoftware looks like it was designed for the original NintendoWhen it does work, the lighting has to be just right or the image is useless

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this one
Reviews.Author: R. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I needed a easy to use IP camera to capture images of a black bear coming to my bird feeder at night. I thought this would be perfect. As stated, the box literature and actual reality of setup are far apart. Wireless operation was haphazard and I finally had to string a long ethernet cable direct to it. Flimsy plastic mount and non waterproof enclosure made me put it under rain protection. The built in infrared projectors are weak and only good for about 10-15 feet. I did end up buying a bigger infrared array to place next to it. Setup was infuriating with Java applets and hard to understand directions about email and ftp setup. And in the end I did get my bear video but since it does not work with Win7 64 bit OS, I am constantly flpping back to my older 32 bit IE version. It still crashes when I pull up the SD card motion avi movie clips and have to remove the micro card and look at the sequences directly on my usb adapter on computer. I am still in search of plug and play IP cam. This is not the one.
